14.content: Zephyr woke up in his home. Not much of a home, but home none the less. Light filtered through the dirty windows. His sister walked in. She was 12, small and innocent despite everything. "The fighting has to stop Zeph, you can't do this forever!" She had short black hair and a cute innocent looking face. "Jess, I'm sorry. But if I stop we can't eat." He glances at himself in the mirror. A jagged scar runs across his left eye, a gift from the night his new life began. Jessica looked back at him, tears filling her eyes. "But, Zeph what if you get killed?" She was the only person who he didn't hurt now. He pushes everyone away, thinking he will just get more pain. "Jess, It'll be ok. I'm too tough to die." he gets up and wraps his arms around his sister. "I wish we still had Mom and Dad." She says hugging tightly to her last remaining family. "I do too but we have to get by." Zephyr checked his watch. "Bedtime Jess. You have school tomorrow." Jess pulled away and walked to her room, which was just a cot and a shelf. "Why don't you go to school Zeph?" She asked using the pet name that only she could get away with. "I can't go back. I wasn't there for long enough to pass." She walked into her room and closed the door. Zephyr looked around his abandoned house. He snuck in and stole from a few camps and made this a home. He thought about his usual things. Food, the next match, and revenge. 10 years ago his parents were murdered in front of him by his only friend. He carried his 2 year old sister out of the house and ran, getting slashed across the eye with the knife that stole his parents from him. At 7, this left him hollow. His friend was 12, the same age his sister is now. He would be 22 today. At 17, Zephyr is training to fight, so nothing will ever be taken from him again. He found an underground fighting ring, $200 for a win, $50 for a loss. He feeds himself and his sister with that money. The next day.......

Well, as the title subtly suggests, I had the idea of minor spin offs... (Yeah, minor spin offs inside a whole spin off story... not the hardest thing to figure out). However, these spin off series might ignore the complete canon or just parts of it. I also intend to give different tints to these stories, although, somehow keeping the original essence... a bit complicated, in fact, this idea was born from the fact I haven't written in a while, and somehow the accumulated unused inspiration becomes distressing.

None of the stories here are canon, nor is this whole interactive, this was once the real sequel, but I didn't expect that the originally spin-off X series would become so much better. That's thanks to my friends who have supported that story: Luigi P. (63) Friendly Thinker (57) Pen (46) 02jsharp Here's the link http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...

Also, I hadn't considered it, but the X series sticks more to the original idea than this story, which blows most of the original story to hell, I mean... I know that super powers and stuff are fantasy, but time traveling is still crazier than that... Anyway, these stories are most likely to ignore the original story, keeping the characters with slight modifications to fit into their current universe. As I'm writing this, I'm thinking about how to branch this new series of stories, which are supposed to be kept minor, since the whole story didn't make it as a true sequel.

As of the characters, they'll retain their age and most of personality, though they'll be adapted to the different worlds.

About the choices below:

The first one is already known, I toyed a bit with that genre with the SWGF/GTS 1.5, but in difference of that, this wouldn't stick to the original story nor the backstory given by it and the X series (It may sound confusing, but SWGF/GTS 1.5 sticks to the back story, and shows the characters in their younger versions, but it keeps parts of the canon, for example, Joana and Blake meeting at 7th grade, Karina befriending Blake at 9 years old, etc). These stories are supposed to be complete changes to the story, keeping only the caracters and maybe the context of 2000-2010's world. Most of these might be radical changes on how the characters grew up or something.

The second one might sound ambiguous, but with fantasy I mean an alternate world, in a different age, for example, Middle Age-like, Renaissance-like or maybe even a futuristic world (hell, I might even leave option for a prehistoric-ancient world), involving maybe magic and/or technology. If I get an idea I'll write, but is someone has already one, go ahead. My invitation to add is always open.

The third and fourth ones may be the craziest one, a spin-off-fan fic hybrid... (or maybe author-fic? since I'm the author... it makes no sense anyway XD). And NO, with this I don't mean to involve my characters in anything hentai related. I had the not-so-good the idea of a story mixed with my characters and maybe some anime/videogame/movie. I have a small project on this one, but you'll know soon enough which one I'll be working on. By the way, I DON'T intend to replace the series' characters with mine, as the title says, they would appear as additional characters

Well, that's all I've thought of. If someone wants to suggest a fifth branch and its possible option, I'll be glad to discuss it by e-mail. I'm online almost every day, so, I'll reply as soon as possible. Have a nice reading!

PS: The item "Blake... Another Future" is NOT canon. Is just the prelude for this interactive's main story, and no, I'm not otaku nor a very hardcore gamer, that's why my choices would be limited in the guests path

September 15th, 1991...

Another child was born, one among the thousands of children that are born every hour, every day, every year...

It was a male, and a dark skinned and black haired one. The father was happy, a tall man (5'11" or 180 cm, maybe not that tall I guess...) with dark skin as well, and black hair. His eyes looked sharp and cold in their natural state, but despite his seemingly dark features, the man was really happy when he could hold the baby in his arms. Before that, and in difference of the rest, this baby was continuously crying since he was born (all of the other babies were tired and sleeping).

The mother didn't look happy at all, which almost didn't surprise the nurses, despite being used to see both happy parents or being usually the mother the happy one... but no, this woman was not happy at all, she had been restrained for nine months by doctors and nurses because she kept trying to eliminate the life she was carrying in her womb, and pretty much all of the hospital personnel knew it. However, this didn't seem to affect the man, who only cared about his son and nothing else in that right moment.

However, James, the man, now father, knew about his wife's intentions, and was forced to take the little Blake anywhere he was going. One of those days, Lilith's (the mother and wife) family came in early in the morning, James and Blake had already left and were at James' work. Lilith's father (who was a white seemingly old yet still strong man) said

-"Good. Now, we have serious business to talk to you, Lilith..."-

-"You don't need to tell it, old man..."- She said rudely, another man, Lilith's brother, said

-"That's not the way to talk to our father!! This is all your fault you bitch..."-

She was about to slap her older brother but the old man stopped both of them, with a look that showed his authority, then he cleared his throat and said

-"We always knew that it was wrong that you were with an impure one, you already have dishonored our family's name, and there's more..."- He said, and someone else entered the house. His presence felt heavy to everyone, like a really great authority of some sort, but none of his features was visible, he was covered in a dark gray cloak with a hood. He said

-"The child is a threat. He carries evil blood within his veins, and he will be the one to bring disgrace and destruction to all of you..."- The mysterious guest said, with a teenager-young sounding voice

-"And just who the hell do you think you are?!"- Lilith was angry, not because she cared, but because her father was allowing a stranger to warn her

-"You better watch your mouth, young woman, he is a Great Sage!!"- Her father said, again, sounding authoritarian

-"From... the Orden?"- Lilith's voice showed fear, and both her father and her brother nodded

-"But not everything is lost yet. The almighty God gives everyone a chance to mend their way... even you, sinful woman..."- He paused, and added -"What you have to do is what you have wanted to do ever since the little bastard was born. To get rid of it. The child descends from demons, and he's destined to bring the world's end if he reaches adulthood..."- Then he turned to Lilith's father and brother, and said

-"I know that his father will protect him, that's why I want all of you to kill the father first, then the child. That's something this woman won't be able to do by herself. Remember, time is running out, and the clock is still ticking..."- The mysterious guy left very quietly. Some minutes later, the old man said

-"None of this would've happened if you JUST wouldn't have had your fun with that goddamn lowlife slacker..."-

-"At least we'll get rid of him and the damn child..."- She answered, again, not really caring

-"You BROUGHT a DEMON into the world!! Our noble family always took pride on..."- Lilith's brother was cut off by her

-"I know!! I f***ing know!!"-

After that, uncomfortable silence filled the house. They waited like that for hours, until James came back from work, carrying the 8 days old Blake. He was silent when saw Lilith's family. Everyone, including Lilith hated him and the baby both, however, he wasn't expecting what was going to happen...

He instinctively placed Blake on the floor and dodged an otherwise fatal blow. Lilith's brother tried to stab him with a knife. James said

-"And you call me a lowlife... at least I'm not a sissy coward... like you"- He kicked Lilith's brother's arm, which made him to drop the knife, then, he punched him in the stomach, just then, James felt a punch on the back of his neck, and behind him was Lilith's father... old, but still strong. For an unknown reason, he looked where Blake was, and saw Lilith getting near him, obviously, with no good intentions, so, he kicked the old man in the stomach and rushed toward Lith, who slashed at him with another knife, it hit his shoulder, but it wasn't a very deep wound. He took Blake in hir arms and kept dodging punches, kicks and slashes.

They wouldn't allow him to get out of the house with his son, and they got him surrounded. He kept fighting back with just one hand and his feet. Surprisingly, he was keeping up against two men and an armed woman despite his handicap, and managed to knock out the old man by punching him in the chin. He also got to punch Lilith's brother with all his might, which forced him to cough up some blood, and stunned him a moment, then, James confronted his ife and espite she was using two knives, he could pin her down with his feet. She was struggling againt it and tried to make James lose his footing, but she wasn't strong enough

Lilith's brother got up and tried to attack James as well, but he was too battered and weakened, and was struggling against James' free arm, in that moment, the door opened, and someone covered in a dark gray cloak and a hood. For some unknown reason, everyone stopped, as if a great authority had just entered. The guy spoke, saying

-"Meh. I knew you pathethic people wouldn't be enough... to match even your own species..."- He walked toward James, and noticed the knocked out old man, the woman and her brother struggling against him. Without saying anything, he punched James and the force of impact sent him through the wall to a room. Lilith and her brother stared in awe... what they just saw, was not human. The Sage was obviously far superior to them. In the end, the guy ignored tham and walked toward the rubble, and saw James, who placed the child on the bed and asked angrily

-"Who the hell do you think you are?!!"-

-"I am far more than you can even comprehend. Now, give me the child..."-

-"Over my dead body"- James answered firmly, despite he was really damaged by crashing through a solid wall. He coughed up blood, then charged toward the guy in gray, he was so enraged because it looked like everyone and everything hated him and his son. His wife hated him, her family did as well, and now, even a stranger came to take his life, it was the last straw for James, who connected his best punch right into the guy's stomach...

However, he didn't move an inch, nor showed any sign of pain (well, his face wasn't visible under his hood anyway). James attacked again with his strongest punches and kicks, but they did nothing to the "sage". When James stopped, he saw two red eyes glowing in the hood's darkness, and said

-"You're nothing but a pest to me..."- with that, he shot a dark purple beam through his hand, which pierced James' chest and created a large hole in his thorax. His eyes went blank, and he felt cold... he felt how the life was quickly getting drained from his body (he was just 21 years old by that time). He saw his son, now a defenseless 8 day old baby, and muttered

-"I'm sorry Blake..."-

He was no longer able to say anything, but his mind kept thinking

-"Maybe you will never forgive me, but I'll understand it. I failed. I wasn't strong enough to save you from this imminent death... I hate myself for that... I have just left you on your own, at an age where you can't comprehend anything... Good bye, my son..."-

James' mind was the last thing to fade away, and while doing so, he saw many things he couldn't understand, and assumed they were an extremely flashing back of his own life, despite some things weren't right... but he had no time to think about it as his body was quickly going cold and lifeless. The guy in gray simply said

-"Meh. Moronic animal instincts..."- He walked, stepping over the recently dead father, and picked up the child, saying -"AND YOU are coming with me..."-

The guy left quietly, not even caring about the dead body, nor the heavily damaged people on the floor
1512.title: I warned you

15121.content:
It had been years after that fateful day, and the child was "raised" by the guy in gray, who without it was a 16-18 year looking teenager, with extremely long white hair, which went down his waist and covered his eyes as well. Just after he got the child, he came to an abandoned warehouse, and threw him violently against the floor, and did not pay attention to his cries. He simply walked away and did not return until the following day, to check on him. He gave an evil smile and said

-"Hey little baby, I brought you a pet!!"-

With that, he released a big rat, which almost instinctively, attacked the defenseless child, slashing through his soft skin with its claws and biting the baby in the shoulder. The baby tried to get away from the rat, and despite being hungry and tired, managed to crawl away, but the rat was after him and kept wounding him. It kept like that for more than 30 minutes, and the white haired guy was considering killing the rat, when the baby's black eyes went blank, and swiftly grabbed the rat and broke its neck easily. After that, the baby fell unconscious. The white haired guy smiled.

When the baby woke up, he was presented to a badly cracked and seemingly old bowl full of milk. The white haired guy said

-"You earned it, but only for that one. If you want more, you'll have to prove worthy..."-

Despite not truly understanding the stranger, the baby's instinct told him to drink the milk from that bowl. As the time passed, this white haired guy kept making the baby fight everyday rats, mice, and as he grew, cats and dogs. When the child was old enough, he stopped giving him milk and gave him water in his only bowl per day, along a small piece of bread.

The years passed, and the child turned into an older kid (10 years old). The white haired guy allowed himself to even bring wolves to make the kid fight with, and was pleased on seeing how first Blake got wounded, then, his eyes became blank and killed violently the animals. He had taken little time to speak with the kid, and barely taugh him some language. The kid knew how to read and write, but beyond that he wasn't allowed to do anything he wasn't told to. He spent most of the time recovering from his wounds from his daily fights. One of those days, after killing two wolves and waking up from unconsciousness, the white haired guy said

-"Well done my pet. Here's your reward as always"- He presented him the same old bowl full of water and two pieces of bread. He ate them desperately, and after he was done, the white haired guy stared impatient at him, asking

-"Well?"-

-"Thank you, master, for feeding me once more"- The kid answered submissively.

-"That's better. Now, go to sleep, you need to rest for tomorrow..."- The kid walked to an empty room inside the warehouse, and laid on the floor. Minutes later, the white haired guy felt a presence behind him

-"How long is this going to take, Blaze?!!"-

-"Years. Fricking years, I told you!! And since when have you grown so bold"- He turned around to see his visitor

-"I'm sorry, prince..."- The visitor apologized

-"He's progressing well. At this rate, in about 4 years he'll be ready"-

-"4 years?!!"-

-"Hey!! We've been stuck here for over 10,000 years!!, I guess 4 more won't hurt"-

-"Alright..."- The visitor vanished

However, things were going to change. 1 years later...

Blaze was sleeping as usual, but woke up when hearing a knock in the door 'Who the heck knocks a warehouse's door? And this early at that?!!' He thought, after checking his watch, which marked 7.00 AM. He walked groggily and opened the door

-"Yeah?"-

-"Good morning"- A police officer said -"I've been informed that people live here..."-

-"So what?"- Blaze asked groggily

-"This is an abandoned building!!"-

-"I have no means to get a better place, officer..."-

-"How many people live here?"- The police officer asked, Blaze growled, he was thinking about killing him with just a single energy shot, but noticed a lot more of patrols outside 'Dammit... the kid isn't strong enough yet... he'd die easily if these stupid bastards shot at him...' He thought, and decided to stay "good" with the officer

-"Just me and my brother..."-

-"Where is he?"-

-"Sleeping over a room..."- Blaze opened the door slightly more to allow the officer to see the black haired boy sleeping on the floor

-"He looks nothing like you..."-

-"I'm a frickin' albino, 'kay?!!"- Blaze said

-"Uh... sorry about that..."- The officer apologized (well, despite the way Blaze was answering, an adult man would be more comprehensive to stray children, at least normally, right?)

-"But that kid should be getting ready for school right now..."-

-"I don't have money for that. We have barely enough to get food. But at least he finished elementary"- Blaze answered, and showed the officer a certificate (which was fake, Blaze kept it just in case), though inside, he was having fun fooling a human.

-"I see, though, I'm afraid I'll have to take you both at some orphanage..."-

-"What?!! I mean... that wouldn't work, my brother is too old to be picked by any family... and, in case you wonder, we aren't into drugs, otherwise we'd have loads of money..."- Blaze replied in such a teenagerish way that made the officer laugh, he said

-"Okay then. I'll let it slide for this time, but you better have your brother registered at a high school ASAP good thing he's at the right age..."-

-"Yeah"- Blaze nodded annoyed

-"I'll get you some money through a scholarship, so, as long as your brother studies, you won't starve"-

-"Gee... thanks officer"- Blaze pretended to be polite, and soon the officer left. Blaze growled angrily, thiking

'God dammit!! I have to frickin' get this kid at school!! And I can't leave that easily because I know they're watching me... I might kill them but more officers would come and I'd make it to the most wanted list... And this kid might get killed in the process, no way, I've spent years to train him...' He thought, then another thought echoes in his mind

'Well... that might be a chance to Blake for seeing what humans really are like... and so he'll come to truly hate them!! When he's strong enough he'll start killing people mercilessly!!! Maybe the school is a good idea'

-"Blake!!"- He shouted, and immediately, the boy was before him, down to his knee

-"Yes, master?"-

-"Your life is going to change. You'll be going to school in a few months*"-

-"School, master?"-

-"Not a big deal, it's a place crowded with immature young humans. Your mission will be to lean about their disgusting nature, and keep on a low profile. You'll have to act as a human..."-

-"With all due respect, master, I don't know how to do that"- Blake answered

-"Dammit... well, I guess I'll have to teach you their disgusting ways of life then"-

-"What's it for, master?"-

-"Because I've kept you isolated from the world, the cruel and horrible world. Yet, you have to get to know because you'll destroy it one day, and need to know what will you be fighting. I also want you to see the people with your own eyes, how disgustingly they live, and how stupid they are. I want you to hate them, after you see how they truly are..."- Blaze said, really sounding conviced, despite he knew that he was acting cheaply

-"Understood"- Was Blake's answer

-"But your training will go on while you aren't as school"- Blaze remarked

-"Understood, master"-

-"Good"-

And so, Blaze taught Blake about human behavior, but he mostly was focusing him on hating humans after finding out how they were. Blaze told him that they were hypocrite, and acted nice despite they hated others.

-"So, remember this, even if a human attacks you, don't fight back unless he either really hurts you or are alone. If you happen to be alone you may kill him"-

-"Understood, master"-

-"Also, don't talk very long to them. Talk to them as least as possible, or they may corrupt you..."-

-"I will not fall for their lies, master"-

-"Good. But I want to remark THIS because most of people will try to act nice around you. Just ignore them, and don't say anything unless it's necessary, however, this only applies to the other humans which look like your age. You'll have to stick to what teachers say..."-

-"Teachers?"-

-"Adult humans, who are supposed to teach things to the young ones, though most of that isn't important at all. But you'll have to pay attention to them and do as they say, within limits"- Blaze answered

-"Alright, master"-

-"You also are not allowed to fight back ANY adult being while in school. You can fight back only the ones your age. I'll take care of any adult who causes you trouble"- Blaze added

-"Understood, master..."- And so, the months passed quickly

*In story, it's December, and school registrations are done about February, at leats that's how it's done where I live, I'm not sure about the US... Also, here's obligatory for children to go to school up to 9th grade
15121.title: Years later...

151211.content:
Blaze also had to teach him minimal stuff which would be basic for normal teenagers, such as learning what was a woman like (not much, i fact, Blake only learned that they're refrred as she or her, and that their physic looks different from males. Blaze himself wasn't too fond of the topic). Blaze even had to explain how are humans born, because they'd be studying that topic at some point in school...

Needless to say, Blake really disliked pretty much of all the stuff related to humans, and, as taught by Blaze, "their instincts were plainly pathethic". Blaze remarked several times to not talk to anyone unless it's necessary, and during the lunch break, avoid any human company. To the point Blake memorized what Blaze said about most of possible situations.

Months later...

Blaze had already gotten Blake registered at the nearest high school, and early in the morning, he woke Blake up by throwing an angry rat at him. The now nearly 12 years old boy killed it with ease, and saw the bowl with water and three bread pieces before him, Blaze said

-"You'll need a bit more of energy, just in case..."- Blake ate them rather quickly (given his life style, he was always hungry, but never complained)

-"Now, remember that if someone asks about who you live with, you have to answer 'My big brother'. Also, never, NEVER tell anyone where you live"-

-"Understood, master... but..."-

-"But?"- Blaze was about to shout and possibly punch the teenager he had been "raising"

-"...Is this school stuff necessary?"-

Blaze sighed in relief, at least he wasn't questioning him, as he kew clearly that not even Blaze was happy about the school thing

-"Sadly yes. I'd hate to spend the whole day around humans... it's a punishment that none of us truly deserves, but, I can't confront the human police until you're strong enough. You can get killed by a mere bullet... humans and their damn fire power... if this were like 500 years ago you'd be already killing entire villages..."- Blaze was starting to go off the point, but he realized and said

-"If you don't want to bear this for too long, then train better and harder, so you will grow stronger faster... As a gift, you'll kill all of the school's people when your day comes, I'm sure you'll come to hate them..."-

-"Thanks, master..."- Blake answered, and Blaze gave him a backpack which had a single notebook, a book and a pen inside.

-"Now, go"- Blaze said, and Blake left. All those years of extreme fighting against wild animals made him really strong and fast, and he was able to run quickly. He got to school in 20 minutes (where a normal person would've taken an hour). Blake checked the watch Blaze gave him. It marked 6:50 AM*

-"Good. 10 minutes left..."- Blake sighed and saw before him the large building, at the current time, empty, as most of people came by bus some minutes before 7:00, so, there wasn't much people around. He checked a paper Blaze had given him:

"Classroom 10-D"

Blake also checked what he was going to do by the day

7:00 to 8.00 AM History
8:00 to 9:00 AM Biology
9:00 to 9:40 AM Lunch Break
9:40 to 10:20 AM Biology
10:20 to 11:20 AM Math
11:20 to 12.20 AM Physics
12.20 to 1:20 PM English


-"This is not going to be a good day... it was easier just to kill some animal every day than sitting the whole day hearing nonsense..."- Blake growled angrily at his realization, he found his classroom and sought a seat in the last row. He didn't go for a corner to avoid being obvious, so he sat and opened his backpack. He took out a book called "The art of War" He saw a note which said "While you aren't doing anything, you better read about how to destroy people, understood?" Blake nodded, despite Blaze wasn't there.

Minutes later, he heard footsteps and with the corner of his eye he watched two people enter the classroom. According to what Blaze ad told him, those two were females, called "girls" as a generic term. He was seemingly not paying attention to anything but heard them talking

-"Who's that guy over there**?"- Said the short blonde one, low enough that she SHOULDN'T be heard. Blake's senses were above average, so he could hear clearly

-"I don't know... I had never seen him"- Said the other girl, who was average geight if not tall. She had brown wavy hair worn as a ponytail.

-"Weird..."- The blonde said looking at him, Blake seemed to be focused on his book so the girls weren't too worried

-"Why? He's just reading..."- The brown haired one replied

-"Doesn't look like an intellectual guy to me..."-

-"Maybe he does so because he know nobody?"-

-"Maybe... but I have a bad feeling about him. We better stay away..."- The blonde one said, though the brown haired one stared at him a bit longer, until they heard more foot steps and the rest of students came in.

Blake watched them, and noticed that they didn't pay attention to him 'Good. I'll keep getting here early so I don't draw attention...' However, that was going to change, as the principal came in. He greeted the students and introduced himself. He also introduced briefly all of the teachers. After that, he left and the History teacher was the only one to stay. He introduced himself as Mr. Pauls.

He was an average height man (170 - 180 cm) with dark brown hair, thick rimmed glasses whose age couldn't be told by sight, he looked young but his way to speak reflected far more experience, despite his serious look, he told the students they'd start calm and for the first week they wouldn't be doing much. He wanted to get to know the students as he did with each generation, and he asked them to introduce themselves as he took attendance

'Dammit' Blake thought, and disliked the teacher for that. As he called out the names, said student would introduce themselves, most of them with moderate confidence, as they knew almost everyone from back in the elementary. It came the turn to the blonde one

-"Karina?"- (The teacher also called them by their names, not their surnames, to make it a bit less formal)

-"Present"- She answered, and stood up

-"May you introduce yourself to the others?"- He asked with a warm tone, she smiled and a bit nervous, replied

-"My name is Karina. I come from the Elementary School #42***"-

-"And what's your age?****"-

-"12 years old"-

-"Alright, please take your seat"- He said. He noticed a boy who was in the last rows reading some book. He raised an eyebrow, finding that behavior unusual for a first day. Usually, everyone was nervous and anxious, and somewhat willing to make new friends since they were new to school and stuff. Mr Pauls knew that well, because that's how it was for lots of generations of students. He made a mental note to pay more attention to that boy. He continued calling names and making everyone introduce themselves, he was now expecting to talk to him.

After some calls, it was the bron haired's turn

-"Joana..."-

-"Present"- She answered rather happily

-"Is it correctly written? Many times the school's scecretaries screw up names"- Everyone in the classroom laughed, except the boy reading the book.

-"Yes sir"-

-"So... where do you come from?"-

-"Well, from Elementary #42 as the rest of us"-

-"Alright. Your age?"-

-"13 years old sir"- It wasn't uncommon that some students were slightly older than the rest, but it was strange that this girl would've lost a year, she had clean records, and good notes. Still, it was a minor problem compared to th boy who was seemingly not caring about the first day of high school...

-"Good. Take your seat please"- Mr Pauls kept calling names expecting to find what was the boy called, and almost coming to the last one, he called

-"Blake?"- Everyone went silent. Nobody they knew had such a name, which meant...






*By the way, yeah, school here is from 7.00 AM to 1 or 2:00 PM. I'm not sure if it's the same for the US or other countries. The schedule shown here is based on a real one
** Since it's 7th grade, and starting high school, there's not much new guy concept, however, since most of them studied together in elementary, they can tell that someone isn't from there...
*** I never figured where in the US would Blake live, so I better leave this as a mystery. Also, here, most of public schools are in fact named by a number
**** Another teachers' custom here, they ask everyone's age, even girls'. Don't ask me why, don't know...
151211.title: Blake goes to school...

choices: The ring for lunch break rings...
1512111.content:
Blake closed his book and stood calmly. He was dressed in a black open jacket, a white shirt under it, black jeans and clack tennis shoes. He was about 170 cm tall, tall for any early teenager.

-"Present, sir"- He answered, strangely politely, thought Mr Pauls

-"What school do you come from?"-

-"...From Mendoza Institute..."-

-"Never heard of that school..."- Replied Mr Pauls, being his and Blake's voices the only ones audible in the room, for some reason, everyone else was silent. The warm and happy ambient seemingly stopped as Blake had been called

-"Well, that's because it's true name it's Instituto Mendoza... from Mexico..."- Blake replied, according to the fake certificate Blaze had for him.

-"Oh I see... so, you're new here..."-

-"Pretty much, sir..."- Blake again asnwered, but his calm and politeness sounded creepy to the students. Mr Pauls wated to dig deeper into this guy's psyche. By his experience he knew how to handle common teenagers, but this one wasn't exactly a common one

-"Alright... then, how old are you?"-

-"11 years old, sir"-

-"11?"- Now Mr Pauls was surprised, not only looked tough, and tall for a teenager, but also was younger than the rest. Everyone now was from feeling creeped to taking more confidence, mostly, because that meant he would be easier to scare

-"Not much of a big deal... I'll turn 12 in September..."- Blake said (School started at August, so, there was not much difference)

-"Alright..."- Mr Pauls said. He knew that if he took any longer it would look suspicious, but everyone was suspicious already. Blake sat back and resumed reading, in complete silence. There was mumbling around, and Karina was telling to Joana

-"You see? He acts weird... he should be nervous about being the new guy... or at least be open and willing to make friends..."-

-"Maybe he's just shy..."- Joana suggested

-"I don't think the teachers nor the rest of people here will treat him nicely, you know what they do to the 'new guy'..."-

-"C'mon, he doesn't deserve it... the whole class he hasn't messed with anyone, he's just been reading..."- Joana said

-"Wether he does or not, people won't care. It's clear that something is wrong with that guy..."-

-"I still think he's shy, and is just tryint to not looke like it..."- Joana added

-"Whatever..."- Karina said, and the mumbling stopped as Mr Pauls called the last names. After that. Mr Pauls let them have free time until his class was over. As usual, during the time between teachers, most of students relaxed and talked, except Blake, who kept reading. Karina and Joana kept watching Blake and noticed that Ayrton, a good friend of theirs talked to him, and Karina still had the feeling things would end badly

-"Hi... Blake, right?"- Ayrton greeted Blake, who didn't close the book this time, but looked at the one who was talking to him. A short guy, with tanned skin and short black hair 'Not much of a threat' Blake thought

-"Yeah..."- Blake answered flatly

-"So, you're new here..."- Ayrton tried to start a conversation, this time, Blake closed the book, and replied

-"I thought this was everyone's first day..."- Ayrton laughed at that answer, despite Blake kept his serious expression, Ayrton said then

-"It is, but almost everyone comes from the same elementary school..."-

-"..."- Blake was silent, thinking 'Like I care. I didn't come here to make friends'

-"Don't worry, I know what you're thinking..."- Ayrton said, and Blake gasped, he added happily -"Cheer up! I'll get you to meet people!!"- Blake couldn't help but to have a '¬_¬ expression (the apostrophe means a sweatdrop btw)

-"I don't think that would be..."- Ayrton was already dragging him, but everyone stopped as Biology's teacher entered. She introduced herself ar Mrs. Philipps, though since she also taught at the elementary school, most of the students knew her. That was the reason she also was acting more relaxed, though, Blake drew her atention just like the previous class. He seemed to be unwilling about going to school, nor willing to anything (Since women have better intuition, that's why she realizes a bit more than Mr Pauls did). She was telling them that the first week was to get the students acquainted witht he whole new school and what it implied. It was also for the students to get to know each other.

She noticed Blake's slight scowl whenever she said anything about making friends. She also noticed that he wasn't paying much attention, and since she hadn't taken attendance, she called him

-"Hey, you!!"-

Everyone stopped, and the teacher said

-"The one in the back row... the one in black..."-

Blake sighed. If he were an ordinary teenager he'd be embarrassed, but given the circumstances he couldn't care less, however, he knew he had to stick to what Blaze said about teachers...

-"Yes, Mrs Philipps?"- Blake asked calmly, though he was starting to get angry at getting called out

-"I forgot what I was saying, may you remind me?"- She said in a tone that to the other students meant 'Show me that you paid attention or you're doomed'

Blake replied with surprising calm. The students were with wide open eyes and their jaws dropped, because none of them would've actually repeated the whole speech word by word. After he finished, he added

-"Then you called me, Mrs Philipps..."- Even said teacher was with her jaws dropping and her eyes wide open. It was the first time a student could defeat her like that, sure, some students recalled exact words from just mere minutes ago, but none was able to say the exact speech word by word. She scowled in her inside but decided that she'd leave him alone for now... until he gave her another reason to call him out

-"Yeah... thanks... you may take our seat back..."- Blake sat back on his chair without saying anything. The students started to mumble, and Blake clearly heard some phrases

-"Wow... this is the first new guy who can actually defend himself from teachers..."-

-"Yeah and what a way..."-

-"Which makes him weirder..."-

-"So.. what do you think? He doesn't look like a bad guy to me..."- In Blake's mind, a record needle's scratch was heard, and he quickly looked at who said those words... the girl with brown hair... he also paid more attention to her conversation

-"I don't know... I still think he's creepy and that we should stay away from him..."- Karina replied

-"Maybe he's just smart?"- Joana said

'Note to self: Stay away from the girl with brown hair... more specifically, stay away from the girl with brown hair and*...' Blake's thought was interrupted as the teacher regained the attention and everyone remained silent again. She kept talking, and to prevent further incidents, Blake stopped reading and pretended to pay attention, however, both he and the teacher knew he wasn't really doing so, but if she asked him he'd definitively answer correctly which would prove her wrong...

The teacher then called out students names, again, asking their name and age. To make them even, before starting she revealed her own, 36. After a lot of names, it came Blake's turn. By the way, in difference of Mr Pauls or the rest of the teachers, Mrs Philipps asked the students as a last question to say anything relevant about themselves, what they liked, etc...

-"Blake?"- She called out in her list

-"Present..."- Blake answered rather flatly

-"I see that you're not from the Elementary #42, what school are you from?"-

Blake sighed slithgly, and answered

-"I'm from a mexican school..."-

-"I see... so, how long have you lived here?"-

-"A few months..."- Blake said what Blaze told him to say when he was asked such a question

-"Alright... how old are you?"-

-"11"-

-"11? Aren't you too young?"-

-"I'll turn 12 in September..."- Blake answered, barely containing the anger

-"Alright. Some other thing you may tell us about you?"-

-"Not really..."- Blake said, wanting to end the questions as soon as possible, however, that was not the answer she or anyone would expect... it was like a non written contract, everyone risked to say a few things about themselves so the others would know them better... and sticking to this, since others told about themselves, the following ones would do so...

-"No?"- Now Mrs Philipps was growing more suspicious on Blake. He knew that Blaze told him to NOT tell anything about his real life, she stared at him inquisitively, Blake sighed again

-"There's not anything I could say about me..."-

-"There has to be something. Everyone is different and everyone has a story to tell..."- (I know, she sounds more like an art education teacher, but she actually speaks like that)

-"Well, I have nothing to say..."- Mrs Philipps sighed and Blake sat back on his chair.As it happened with Mr Pauls, she couldn't dig deeper into Blake's mind because it'd take longer and it would look suspicious. But she was now sure that there was something wrong with him.


* I thought it'd be better to leave to your imagination what other trait of hers Blake was going to mention...
1512111.title: Blake's turn to "introduce" himself...

15121111.content:
Blake decided to stay since he didn't even know what "lunch" meant. Suddenly his chair is yanked from under him and he falls backward.

-"Hey freak"- Comes the voice of the person who threw him down. Blake sees a huge kid at least 6' 5" and 230 pounds. He begins to send a punch to Blake but someone steps in the way. A kid in a sweatshirt with his hood up stands over him holding the fist of his attacker.

-"You leave him alone."- The larger pulls his fist away and Blake gets up.

-"How will you stop me? You're weak"- says the larger person. The smaller goes into a position for fighting. One hand held in front of his chest in a fist, the other held half open in front. The larger sends three punches towards the kid, but they were sloppy. He ducks the one aimed for his head, sidesteps one going for his stomach and deflects one on a course for his face. Suddenly, the kid goes on the offensive. He punches his enemy in the stomach, then connects his elbow to the side of his head and then kicks him in the ribs. The older kid now bent over holding his stomach is laid out by an uppercut to the face. He stands and begins to try once again to hit the smaller kid, but no hits are connected. The smaller sends a kick into his gut, a punch to his jaw, and then, once more the other holding his stomach finishes his fight with a flip kick to the face. The larger boy finally gets up and leaves, knowing his odds of winning are low.

The other one goes over to Blake. "You ok? I'm Seth by the way"
15121111.title: Lunch

151211111.content:
-"Yeah, I'm alright"- Blake answered, a bit confused that a human actually helped him. Though he'd have done a bloodier fight. He noticed Seth's look, and somehow feeling obligated he said

-"My name is Blake..."-

-"Yeah I know. You kinda started school with the wrong foot"-

-"I'd guess that I did worse than that"- Blake said and was interrupted by a happy-annoying sounding voice

-"There you are!! No escape this time!!"- Ayrton came in, pulling Blake's arm, who had a raised eyebrow and said

-"Isn't there someone else who needs your help in... social stuff or something?"-

-"Nope. You're the first in my list... now, be good and come along..."- He was trying harder to drag Blake, Seth watched in amusement

-"Listen, I am not into anything social, I just want to be alone"- Blake was starting to get angry

-"But you'll ruin your reputation, then nobody will talk to you"- Ayrton was trying his best to convince the stubborn guy

-"Not like I care..."-

-"Well, I'll bring people here to meet you"- Ayrton said after getting tired, Blake had now a twitch in the eye, and said

-"You wouldn't..."- He saw Ayrton going after a few guys, and got up to leave. Ayrton quickly came to where he was and Blake said

-"I'm going ALONE"-

-"You aren't. I'll follow you around all day..."- Ayrton said, and grinned as Blake faceplamed himself

-"If I go to your social stuff you will stop annoying me?"- Blake finally asked

-"Just for today..."-

-"Arghhh..."- Blake was clenching his fist, but Seth's glare somehow stopped him.

-"C'mon. You'll like it"- Ayrton dragged a sighing and facelapming Blake by his arm out of the classroom. Mrs Philipps had watched everything and was slightly amused as well. Seth also walked out of the classroom. He'd watch the new guy "just in case"...

-"Maybe the students themselves might help that guy..."- Mrs Philipps muttered, and then she heard them

-"And just because I'm so damn cool, I'll get you to know some GIRLS!!"-

-"WHAT?!!"- Was the last a very desperate Blake said before getting too far away to be heard. Mrs Philipps smiled at that. 'This might be interesting' she thought, and got up to leave as well, she'd have her lunch in the cafeteria, to watch how would Blake do...

She caught up with them timely, and taking a seat from a descent distance, she watched Ayrton and Blake, who was dragged by the former and met with Joana and Karina

-"Hi girls"- Ayrton said happily

-"Hi Ayrton"- Both girls greeted back, they noticed Blake and had different reactions: Karina stared at him and Joana just giggled. Ayrton nudged him in the ribs and he said reluctantly

-"Hi"- After a small pause, he said to Ayrton -"Alright, I met people. Whooohoo, I am SO happy. Now, if you excuse me..."- He started to leave when Ayrton grabbed him by the back of his shirt's collar

-"Not so fast, pal. We're having lunch with them"-

-"Ayrton, maybe you shouldn't annoy him so much..."- Karina said, and for the first time, Blake didn't dislike her, however, Joana, the other girl glared at her and Karina said

-"I don't mind..."- Blake wanted very much to strangle Joana. His angry look was only noticeable to Seth and Mrs Philipps, who by the way, was caught by Mr Pauls looking at some students

-"Too bad they don't sell popcorn here..."- He said

-"It's alright..."-

-"What are you up to this time, Linda?"- He asked more seriously

-"That kid... there's something that's not normal with him..."-

-"Huh? what kid?"- He asked, and Mrs Philipps pointed at Blake discreetely

-"Oh... that kid... yeah there's something strange about him..."-

-"Didn't you notice?"-

-"Of course I did"- Mr Pauls said -"But he acted polite and behaved well... so, I have no reason to do anything about him..."-

-"I think there's something wrong with him..."-

-"Maybe he's maltreated?"-

-"Maybe... but he seems too calm to be just that. No, what I've felt is that he dislikes people..."-

-"C'mon, aren't you overreacting again?"-

-"I am not!!"- Mrs Philipps said angrily -"I can understand bad attitude to teachers, but to other students?"- Any person at 12 years is beginning to become a teenager, and want desperately to be part of a group..."-

-"Well, there will be always someone different"- He said -"I also found that he's younger than the rest..."-

-"Yeah I know, but that doesn't explain..."-

-"Well, he's sitting with other students, it can't be too bad..."-

-"Just because another student forced him to. He kept annoying him until he agreed..."-

-"It's better than nothing. Maybe they'll eventually help him..."-

-"Maybe..."- She said, and Mr Pauls sat on an unocuppied chair, both of them watching Blake...

-"So... you're new here?"- Joana asked, trying to be friendly

-"Yeah..."- Blake answered flatly. Then she noticed that he wasn't eating anything, and asked

-"Um... where's your lunch?"-

-"Lunch?"-

-"Food. Aren't you hungry?"-

-"Hungry?"- Blaze didn't tell him the meaning of those words

-"Don't you have money to buy food?"- Joana thought he simply didn't know the words in english, and showed him some coins and then pointed to her food

-"I don't have that... Anyway I've already eaten"- Blake answered, not really caring

-"When?"-

-"When I woke up. I had my meal early... so what?"- He noticed that both girls and Ayrton stared at him

-"You mean you only have a meal once a day?"- Joana asked, worried

-"What's the fuss for?"- Blake asked angrily

-"Everyone has two or three a day, Blake..."- Ayrton said, now sounding serious

-"Well, I'm alright..."- Blake knew it was an uncomfortable situation, and saw Joana getting up without saying anything. Blake still didn't care about what was she going for, and tried to leave, but Ayrton tried to stop him. And so, Blake was trying to walk out of there slowed down because he was dragging a determinated Ayrton (Again, Blake doesn't care about the fact he's doing a scene...) Just when he was about fo get out of the cafeteria, Joana stood before him, with a tray with food. She noticed Blake's struggle to get away but gestured him to go back to the table. Blake, who just felt like having enough of everything, glared at her, and kept trying to leave.

Somehow, Ayrton knew what was going to happen, and quickly released Blake, and grabbed the food tray and went back to the table. Joana walked behind Blake and grabbed his shirt's collar by the back. Blake said loudly

-"What the...?!!"- And was dragged by Joana, who did not say any word at all, until she brought him to his chair and sat him (forcefully). Blake tried to stand up again but her glare stopped him... Blake was used to obey Blaze, but he wouldn't lower himself to obey people. Still, Joana's look somehow stopped him, and thought 'Just for THIS once...'

-"Good thing they were serving pizza today. Now, here you go"- Joana said, while Karina and Ayrton had O.O faces. They rarely had seen Joana like that, and what was weirder, she managed to subjugate Blake's stubbornness, at least for a while...

Blake, who had never seen a pizza in his life, stared at the 2 triangular slices that were in front of him. He muttered, wondering

-"What the hell is this?"- However, Joana heard him

-"It's pizza... you didn't know?"-

-"Never heard of it..."- Blake answered flatly

-"He must be joking... there's no person on earth who doesn't know what's a pizza..."- Ayrton said, patting Blake's shoulder, who was pondering either eating it or swiftly getting away (well, not that swiftly... he would make a mess in the cafeteria, and Blaze told him to not get in trouble...) 'Dammit' He thought and kept staring at the pizza slices, and his instincts were telling him to eat them. He was used to be hungry, and early in his childhood came to the conclusion that it was normal to feel like that. After living eating very little per day for years, his instincts wanted him to eat. It was a chance he wouldn't have outside school, and Blaze wouldn't have to know...

He ate them quickly, though he tried to not look like he was really hungry. Ayrton, Joana, Karina, Seth, Mr Pauls and Mrs Philipps knew it in the end though.

-"You see? It has to feel good..."- Joana said with a n_n expression

-"Meh..."- Blake answered, disegarding what just happened. But he felt good. He felt slightly more lively, and wondered why then he was used to eat just once a day... he was told that he was a demon prince, so, he should live better than any person on earth... well, he'd try to find out later...

-"That was strange..."- Mrs Philipps said

-"What? The scene he just did? or the fact that he just has one meal per day?"- Mr Pauls asked

-"No! The fact that the girl stopped him without force..."- She said

-"I can't blame him. Angry women are scary"- Mr Pauls said, laughing. Mrs Philipps pretended to be mad.

"You gave Jake a thrashing today. He wants revenge." Seth looked them over. Each were much bigger than him. "Wouldn't one on one be more fair?" One threw a punch at Seth from behind. It clipped him in the ear. He stayed up and immediately went into his combat mode. He stamped on one person's knee and heard the crack of something. He barreled the guy over and started sprinting down the hall. He was fast, but not fast enough to escape. He was tackled by the smallest and was held back by two. He took many hits and keeled over with a grunt. They left and picked up the wounded one. Seth stayed on the floor, sliding between conciousness and its opposite.
1512111111.title: Outnumbered

15121111111.content:
After a forceful lunch, Blake got up and started to walk away, this time, Joana didn't stop him, as there were just a few minutes left before classes resumed. However Ayton followed him. When he got far enough, Karina narrowed her eyes and said to her friend

-"What the heck was that?"-

-"Huh? What are you talking about?"- Joana asked, seemingly confused

-"Don't pretend innocence... I know that you're up to something..."-

-"Why?"-

-"That's what I should ask!!"-

-"I'm up to nothing. I just helped Blake..."-

-"Now you call him by his name..."-

-"Is anything wrong with that?"-

-"He's the 'new guy' ... and pretty much a freak... I hope to God that he's not into mafia or drug dealing or something..."- Karina emphasized the words "new guy" in a tone that implied that it was no good.

-"I think you're exaggerating..."- Joana said, laughing

-"Well, do as you wish... but if he does something bad to you, I won't help you..."- Karina said, frowning and crossing her arms

-"I doubt he's a pervert..."-

-"He better isn't one..."-

Blake decided to go to the restroom, just to wash his face, as a means to wake himself up. It had been realy strange and it was just the first day. But he stopped as he noticed the guy who helped him, laying on the floor, bleeding and nearly unconscious. He simply stared at him... he had no reason to attack him but neither had reason to help him, as Blaze had told him that all humans were evil... which contradicted what happened just this day... Blake was pondering what to do when Ayrton came behind him, gasped and quickly helped Seth up. He (Ayrton) asked

-"What happened?"-

-"It...was...nothing...serious...urgh..."- He almost fell to the floor -"Let's...go...back to classes...this never happened..."- He said with difficult

Ayrton was still amazed at Blake's emotionless expression even after seeing Seth hurt like that. He almost looked like something not human. But Ayrton shrugged it off, thinking that maybe he was shocked. As they were walking back to their classroom (Ayrton helped Seth, who was still able to walk but leant on his shoulder for support ). Seth had noticed Blake's blank expression but it was something he'd expect. But, a punch from behind interrupted his thoughts, and sent him and Ayrton about 2 feet forward, landing face first on the floor. They saw two huge guys and an average one.

-"Dammit..."- Seth muttered

-"So, this is the little freak who caused everything..."- Said the average size one*, though Blake was in fact tall (170 cm is tall for an 11/12 years old)

-"That's HIM? That's the fool we've looking for?!!"- Said one of the large guys, sounding angry and disappointed

-"It'll be easier to deal with him..."- The average sized guy walked threateningly toward them. Ayrton got up and helped Seth to do so. Then he nudged Blake, tryint to tlel him to run, but noticed that his blank expression changed to a half smile... a creepy half smile. He and Seth stared in shock as one of the large guys punched Blake right in the face... and he didn't move a single inch. When the guy's hand returned to its position, they noticed that Blake's face wasn't even damaged, except for a bit of blood from the corner of his lip. Blake calmly wiped it off and smiled, showing his teeth

[Background Music: Guilty Gear - Suck a Sage http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3F7M1sfAj... ]

Blake dashed quickly, sinking his fist into the guy's stomach. Then the other attacked but Blake swiftly dodged the incoming fist and countered with a kick into the face. The average size guy tried to tackle him but Blake dodged him and he ended up landing face first on the floor. Blake stomped on his back, and before anything else, spun around to face the guy he previously had hit, and punched his face like a punching bag. Needless to say that Ayrton had a OoO face. Seth was slightly surprised as well. The bad thing is that they were seen and other students started to crowd around them, watching the freaky new guy kicking bullies' asses

Blake moved around, dodging the fists and kicks very fast, but his fighting style didn't look ordinary... he moved more like an animal than a person. He also didn't block, other than dodging, and attacked really wildly when he got in close combat. Three guys, two ones being heavy, were still no match for him. Blake could stop each one with a hand and kick the average sized one with one foot. He also smashed the big guys' heads together. And punched their stomachs like punching bags again.

Joana and Karina noticed the crowd and walked near to find out what was going on. When they asked a guy who was watching, he replied, excited

-"The new guy is kicking asses!! This is a hell of a fight!!"- With that information, Joana gasped and started to walk into the crowd, Karina sighed and followed her. They managed to get to a point where they could see the fight almost clearly.

Blake took several hits, punches and kicks, and whenever he bled, he simply wiped it off and smiled more. He also enjoyed when he drew blood from his opponents. He kept stomping on the average sized guy until he spat out blood, but got punched by one of the big guys, sending him agaist a locker. He turned around, and only slight damage was visible. Blake ran toward him and punched his face several times, like a punchball. The guy fell backwards, completely knocked out, but Blake hadn't enough and started kicking the unconscious guy's body. He also started to stretch his arms, but was kicked by the remaining guy (the other big one)

-"This is the best day EVER!!"- Some guy exclaimed. Blake didn't even mind that there was people seeing him.

-"I won!!! The new guy kicked ass!! I'm rich!!"- Said other guy

Joana was worried and Karina had a pale face. She was a fighter herself, but had never seen something like Blake... he was fighting like some sort of wild beast...

Back to the fight... Blake dodged the big guy rather easily, and grabbed him by the face, smashing him violently on the floor. He did so several times more, and stomped on his head. He was about to punch it once more when his hand was stopped... it was Seth, who said

-"Enough..."- Blake glared at him and growled angrily, but Seth didn't release his grip. Before Blake thought of anything else, everyone heard a voice

-"I'll say when it's enough..."-

An absolutely huge guy walked in, and the ones before him stepped back in fear. This guy was 6'6" and had to be over 260 pounds. He had white skin and several scars.

-"The guy is dead... nobody stands a chance against Ivan..."- Said some other guy in the crowd. Joana gasped again, and this time was a lot more worried.

-"So... it's you the one who's been causing trouble around..."- Ivan walked threateningly toward Blake and Seth, the latter released his grip on Blake's hand. Blake stood inhis fighting stance without saying any word. Ivan laughed

-"You're so funny... too bad I don't like clowns..."- Ivan was about to punch Blake but the bell rang, and everyone rushed to their respective classrooms, as they knew that the teachers would soon go out of their lounge and if they caught anyone in the fight, they'd be in deep trouble. They didn't know that at least two teachers had watched everything...

-"Hmph...Saved by the bell..."- Ivan said, turning around, then added -"If you value your pitiful life, don't get into any more trouble..."-

-"Let's go back to classes..."- Ayrton said, nunding Blake, who was growling angrily, because he lost the chance of another fight. Joana and Karina ran to where they were and she asked worried

-"Are you okay?"-

-"..."- Blake stayed silent, and still had an angry look.

-"I guess he is... now, let's go back before we get in trouble..."- Karina said, pushing Joana away from Blake. Ayrton and Seth laughed at it, and walked toward their classroom. Blake reluctantly walked next to them...


*Given that is a 12 years old, I assume that average height would range from 130 to 150 cm.
15121111111.title: The next period begins (Seth is found)

151211111111.content: They all went to class, albeit Seth a bit slowly. Blake sat in a corner, reading as if nothing happened. People glanced at Blake, wondering how he could be so calm. He now had Ivan to deal with. He must not know about him. Seth, on the other hand, was worried. He felt a vibe from everyone. Blake, though he couldn't read. Something blocked his emotions from him. Seth glanced at him, only reading. Where was his fear? Ivan is a monster of a person. Seth thought back to his own life. Yesterday someone pulled a knife on him and told him to give all his money to a thief. There was a struggle and he stabbed the thief in the leg. Now this accomplises are after him and after today, school is no break from the pain. Assaulted here and assaulted at home. He looked at the teacher as he walked in. "I'd like to do some introductions today, I'm sure you're all tired of it but I don't know you. Let's start here in front. Seth looked on from the back and watched. Eventually the monotone of introductions reached him. He began his introduction. "I am Seth Firman. I moved here from Chicago a few months ago." he started to sit and the teacher looked him over. "Alright class is about over. I'll see you all tomorrow."
151211111111.title: Next class?

1512111111111.content: Seth only registered the teachers as a drone the next few hours. He got up and gave his introduction when it was time, but now he was thinking about the best way to beat Ivan in a fight. He was a big guy, and the best way would be to get away from his punches. The faster he goes down, the better. Still, nobody can beat Ivan easily. Actually, nobody has beaten Ivan at all, that Seth has heard of. He looked at Blake again. 'Maybe he's crazy.' Seth somehow felt better thinking that he is actually insane. 'Maybe it'll make him fight better.' He finally wondered about the glass ball. His father had left it with the warning of "Only break it if you're ready to face the evils of the world." Seth assumed that was metaphoric. It did have an interesting sparkle to it. He looked at his watch. Twenty minutes until I go through the worst beating of my life. He looked at the little marble in his pocket. He held it with great meaning. His father gave this to him on the day he died. Three hours before. Seth disappeared that day at his father's command. Breaking it means losing the last tie to him besides the name Firman. Seth put it back in his pocket. What would breaking it do, anyways? Put some glass pieces on the floor. Seth shook his head and then put the marble back. He looked one last time at Blake before preparing himself mentally further.

152.title: Blake and Co. in a Fantasy World...

choices: Something happens at night (Maybe an enemy attack or something)
1521.content:
[Author's Note: Well, I haven't written in a while, and I've come to several ideas... One of them was particularly persistent, a plot I discarded long ago, having Blake and Co. in a fantasy world, middle-age styled, though I might combine Japanese and European middle age... just another crazy idea... Well, let's see if I can make this work. Blake´s story will retain its essence (I hope so) but will have more changes than you expect... Btw, I know, I kinda wasn't sure about how to begin with the story, and it might be the consequence of not writing for who-knows-how long...]

A different time, in another world... where what we know as fantasy is reality...

It was an ordinary day in Kildevar*, for most of people, they carried on their daily business, and did whatever they were used to do every day, most of children helped their parents with their work, merchants kept selling, buying, exchanging and advertising their products, and so on. A brown haired man was sitting at what seemed to be his house, reading some work papers, when the door was suddenly opened, and a guy came in...

It was a tall guy, wearing black gloves, a black shirt, and dark gray pants, as well as brown leather boots. He also had a black hooded cloak, which shadowed the guy's face, and carried an abnormally broad sword on his back. However, the man didn't seem to be bothered by his presence, and interrupted his work to speak to him

-"So... What did you forget?"-

-"The mission is done already..."- Said the guy

-"Really?"- The man asked

-"It wasn't that difficult... The robbers didn't get too far. Everything has been returned..."-

-"Whoah, that's good... so, I guess you've come for your payment..."-

-"Of course"-

-"Alright then"- The man took out a small bag with several gold coins in it, and handed it to the guy, who took it and walked out of there. One of the maids who was sweeping the floor stopped for a while, and asked to the man

-"Uhm... I don't mean to be disrespectful, my lord, but is it really necessary to have hired a mercenary squad just for a minor rob?"-

-"Of course not..."- The man replied calmly, and the maid gasped

-"Then... why did you hire them, my lord?"- She asked, confused, the man sighed, and said

-"For the same reason I've been hiring them for the last two years..."- Then he added -"They would be wandering around with no place to be... As long as I give them some money, they will stay... And here, they're safe... Specially the guy you just saw... It's better for him to stay here... And you can't say they aren't useful, they haven't failed any mission... and the money I spend on them is the money other dukes use to live the great life themselves... at least I'm helping someone who actually needs it..."-

-"I see..."-

-"Why... it's a long story, but let's just say that I'm paying a debt to a friend of mine..."- He said, and the maid resumed cleaning the place (Which by the way, was just a house larger than average, not enough to be a mansion or a palace)

Back to the guy...

He walked into a modest inn, and encountered with four guys, also in their teens. He said

-"Well, here's our reward for today's work. I've already taken my part, you guys do whatever you like with yours"- He handed them the bag and started to walk away, one of the guys, a short one, said

-"Hey Blake, why don't you stay here?"-

-"I have things to do... But don't worry, have your fun..."- He said as he walked away

-"Man, sometimes I wonder what does Blake do when he's by himself"- A red haired guy asked

-"I dunno... Maybe he has some girl..."- A black guy suggested

-"It's not that. Blake is a lone wolf, and I can tell you that he's truly by himself..."- A guy with black curly hair said

-"But he rarely celebrates anything..."- Another guy with black hair and tanned skin added.

-"Let him be"- The guy with curly hair said, and the four of them went to get something to eat...

Meanwhile, Blake was walking, wandering around the village, wondering about many things... When he snapped himself out of his thoughts when he heard suspicious noise, and walked toward where it came from. He found a man laying on the floor, with some wounds caused by a knife, Blake asked

-"What happened?"-

-"Someone attacked me out of nowhere and took away my money..."-

-"Alright"- Blake said, and jumped to a house's roof. He quickly noticed a man dressed in brown and white, who was running, towards the village's outskirts. He started jumping from roof to roof until he caught up with the thief. Then, he muttered something, and aimed his hand toward the thief, and ropes made of light were fired from his fingers, and entangled themselves around the thief's arms and legs, immobilizing him. Blake then jumped down and took the bags he was carrying (3 or 4), and went back to where he found the man who was robbed.

He was still on the floor, bleeding. Blake walked near him and crouched, aimed his left hand toward him and said

-"Shine, sun's gentle glow, 10 days of spring, heal, stop the bleeding, close the wounds with nature's touch..."-

His hand started to glow in pale golden light, and the man was healed, and stopped bleeding. He said

-"That was incredible!! Thank you very much sir!!"- Blake handed him the bags, and he answered -"The thief only took away one bag from me... I guess you should keep them. Besides, you healed me!!"-

-"No, you keep it. You seem to be a hard working man with family, they need the money more than I do. I'm just fine"- Blake said and walked away, disappearing as quietly as he appeared. The man wondered for a while who was that guy, why did he get no money from him and how could he heal him so easily...

Blake kept walking, thoughtful, as the day continued. When the sun started to set, he went to a large, old tree, jumped on one of its thick branches, and quietly fell asleep...





*DON'T ask how did I come to that name... okay, I wasn't able to think of a really proper name, and I didn't want to be too cliché and use japanese, so I searched some name generators, and I didn't like none of those names, and ended up checking foreign words, and came up with "Kilde" and "Var", both of them are norwegian for spring... Aghhh!! Don't judge me!!

On a second note, I guess you weren't expecting none of this, huh? This version of Blake seems to be more prepared for confronting the world... maybe... there are things that not even him would believe... BTW, I leave the last two choices for anyone, I'll be using the first one
1521.title: So, fantasy, huh? It might work anyway...

15211.content:
The following morning, as the sunlight stared to glow, gently illuminating Kildevar for one more day, Blake slowly woke up from "his" tree, and stood up, jumping to a nearby branch, he caressed what looked like a giant sleeping cat (roughly as big as a horse, though a bit longer), which opened its eyes groggily, and stretched as all cats do. Blake and the cat jumped down. The cat rubbed softly its head and purred. Blake patted its head, and started to walk, with the cat following him.

He went to see a merchant's shop, who was seemingly waiting for him. He greeted Blake

-"Hello, Mr. Blake... You sure get up early. That's good, seeing people who works hard while in their youth is a bit of a relief"-

-"Thanks. I guess you know what I'm here for..."- Blake replied

-"Of course. Here it is"- The merchant showed him two pairs of metal rings, a black shirt, black pants, a black hooded cape, a pair of black boots and a pair of black fingerless gloves. All of it looked identical to what Blake was wearing right now. Blake said, surprised

-"How come you could lift them up?"-

-"That's where I was going. Blake, this new gear is different. It's controlled by this gem"- He showed Blake a small blue stone, which looked like a sapphire

-"Really? Incredible..."- Blake said, surprised

-"Also, with this new equipment, you'll no longer need to keep buying newer and heavier ones. This one controls its weight at your will"-

-"Good"-

-"But to deactivate it, you must remove the metal rings you wear around your wrists and ankles"-

-"Alright"-

-"Then it's all set. It'll be 12 gold coins"- The merchant said, and Blake handed him the money. Then the merchant said

-"To keep this important gem from getting lost, I can set it in that silver tag you wear"-

-"Here it is"- Blake took off a silver chain he always wore, which had a silver tag. After some minutes, the merchant returned with the silver tag, now with the small blue stone incrusted in it

-"Thank you very much"- Blake said, then he took the new gear into a bag that the merchant gave him, and left with the cat, who was black with some white parts (its legs were white as if they were boots, and half of its face was white as well. This cat looked thin and had delicate traits). Blake walked to a nearby forest, and after finding a lonely spot, he started to change his clothes and gear for the new ones. He placed the old ones gently on the ground, but even so, it sunk a bit.

Blake put the metal rings around his ankles and wrists, and noticed that all of them had a smaller blue stone, and their color was lighter than he stone in his silver tag. Then, he concentrated and the stone glowed, then the other ones. Blake moved a bit, walked, and did some fighting stances to check it. He felt good, then, he took the metal rings off and put them in his pocket.

Blake quickly went to see the merchant again, and gave him his old equipment for free, so he could resell it. Blake never cared too much about money, as long as he had what he needed, he wouldn't worry, then, he went back to where the cat was, seemingly, it was waiting for him. Blake petted its head again, and Blake said

-"I've had to walk for a lot. I miss a good ride, do you mind?"- The cat purred happily, and Blake then said

-"Well, let's go check if there's any j..."- Blake was interrupted because the cat ran, slid under him, and then started to run. There was, Blake, riding a giant cat*, and in no time they were in front of the Duke's house. Blake got off his cat and came in (despite belonging to the nobility, the Duke behaved more as a public server, and kept the doors open until the sun set), but before entering, he put on his hood.

-"Good morning, duke. Is there any job for us?"- Blake asked, rather calmly because he didn't really have anything else to do, and had enough money for a month (Blake used very little money, since he slept in a tree rather than an inn)

-"Uhmm... nope, I'm afraid... there would have been one, a man who got robbed yesterday around the sunset, but he reported that some mysterious young man in black saved him, got more than his money back, and healed his wounds..."-

-"I see..."- Blake knew the truth, but pretended to be disappointed and left. The duke resumed reading, signing and stamping papers. The maid again stopped her work and said

-"It was him, wasn't he, my lord?"-

-"Yeah"- He answered

-"Why don't you recommend him for the Royal Army? He might even become an Elite..."- The maid asked

-" *Sigh* Believe me, he and I have our reasons. He's refused to go with the army before. And I agree with him on that..."-

-"But why? He might make a living from it, and if he becomes an Elite and is lucky, may even marry some court's lady..."-

-"There are things you wouldn't understand. But I'll tell you two things..."- He gestured her to get closer, then he whispered -"One, the Royal Army might kill him, and two, he's already as strong as an Elite, if not stronger..."- The maid dropped her broom in surprise, after a while, she resumed cleaning up the duke's house...

Back to Blake...

He was riding again, and in little time he was near the inn where his friends stayed. Only Ferdinand (somewhat tall guy, though not taller than Blake, thin but not skinny, curly black hair, he dresses almost like Blake. But in difference of him, he wears gray bandages wrapped around his arms) seemed to be outside. He noticed Blake's presence, and was somewhat surprised o see him riding his cat.

-"Hey, since when did you decide to ride again?"- He said

-"Thanks to new stuff. Now this will only weigh when I walk or when I'm in battle. You know why I use this"-

-"Yeah"- Ferdinand nodded

-"You haven't told anyone, right?"-

-"Of course not. It would be stupid to have this village's people to run after us furiously with torches and whatnot..."-

-"It's been a long time since the last incident..."- Blake said

-"It was even before we had a squad. It was just you and me at that time"- Ferdinand said, remembering

-"I know"- Blake said -"Well, I went to see Rick, and it seems we're off for today..."-

-"It was about time, they've been keeping us here with little things such as robs..."- Ferdinand complained

-"Don't be like that, they payment is good enough"- Blake said

-"Isn't it a bit suspicious that this village has been paying us here, a mercenary squad, for things the Royal Army can solve easily?"- Ferdinand wondered

-"I bet Rick doesn't want to be so overseen by those snobs..."- Blake said, he was serious but at the same time, it sounded like a joke

-"Well, when you're strong enough to be an Elite, you have rights to be a total snob..."- Ferdinand commented

-"You and I know perfectly that all of us can be easily ranked as such"- Blake said, then added -"In fact, I have never told you to stick here, you can be greater than this if you want. It's just the two of us who can't..."-

-"I know. The sole use of dark-based magic was forbidden over 15 years ago..."- Ferdinand said

-"Grandma never told me everything about me. She just said that my father was the Dark Sage, and that he's dead... nothing more..."-

-"I was told when I was a child that there were more than one dark magicians, but that they were annihilated by the King... I bet we're the last ones..."-

-"Yeah..."- Blake sighed

-"Well, what are we going to do?"- Ferdinand asked

-"How about bring food and just hang out somewhere in the forest. I don't like the sun very much..."- Blake said

-"I know. Well, I'll go tell the rest of the guys"- Ferdinand went inside the inn. Blake preferred to wait outside.

Minutes later, they had the food and headed for the forest. It was Blake's cat who was carrying the food over its back. Blake and his friends brought their weapons just in case, there might be a thief or some dangerous beast...


*I know it's strange, but I didn't want to go with the cliché such as a horse or a dragon... argh!! let me be!!
15211.title: The next day...

152111.content:
Later, in the forest, Blake and his friends were lying down on the grass, under the trees' shadow and hearing the birds. A day off was good once in a while. Blake was resting his head on his cat's back. Then the guys started talking

-"Whoa, how long have we been here?"- Gustave (he was dressed with a cream colored shirt and pants, wore sandals, and had a wine colored cape. He's slightly taller than Ferdinand, has caucasian skin, and red curly hair, similar to Ferdinand's but red)

-"Three years..."- Blake answered, with his eyes closed

-"Shouldn't we move on to somewhere else?"- Caesar (black guy [I mean no offense], with short straight hair, very tall and thin, his arms are longer than average too. He wore white pants, and a blue vest [sleeve and collar-less clothing] )

-"Dude, we've been paid practically for staying, we've done little work, and this place is just fine"- Ayrton said (Short guy, tanned skin but still caucasian, middle length black straight hair. He was wearing a blue shirt and gray pants)

-"Yeah but I'd like to see something new"- Gustave said, and Blake replied

-"What you want to see are new girls"- Everyone laughed, then Gustave said

-"C'mon!! I'm not like that!!"-

-"You're almost as bad as Anthony, heh"- Blake laughed again, then he said, more seriously -"I wonder how's he doing... the last I heard of him was that he made it to the Royal Army"-

Suddenly, everyone was silent. It was like the minute of silence thing, when the memories of Anthony returned. Anthony was another friend of theirs, who was with the squad until 4 years ago. There was no conflict, Blake had stated that nobody had to stay with the team if they didn't want to, but most of them stayed because of their friendship, and a honor sense. However Anthony wanted to become an Elite

-"Hey, Blake, you mock me about girls, but, how come we've never seen you with one?"- Gustave said, breaking the sad/uncomfortable silence

-"Because I've never been with one"- Blake said, still with his eyes closed.

Gustave, Caesar and Ayrton gasped. Gustave said

-"Are you serious man?"-

-"What's the big deal?"- Blake said

-"You've never even kissed one?"- Caesar said

-"Who cares?"- Blake said -"I'm just not good in that stuff, and to be honest I have seen nothing special in none of the women you've seen"-

-"Heh, I bet you'd be with a tough girl or something like that"- Gustave said

-"Nope. I take no orders from anyone who doesn't pay me"- Blake said

-"Who said she wouldn't pay you? She would, in her own way"- Gustave and the rest of the guys laughed

-"I meant money!!"- Blake corrected himself
