-"That's why I hate to tell you guys about me"- Blake said, pretending to be mad -"Anyway, if I were to be seeking for a girl, I'd probably end up like Ferdinand, any girl he likes has a boyfriend, husband, or is engaged"-

-"That's right.... I hate my luck"- Ferdinand had a T_T expression

-"I guess I'm not missing anything important"- Blake concluded

-"I think that maybe a warrior girl wouldn't work. Maybe what you need is a cute, kind and loving girl"- Ayrton said, Gustave and Caesar burst into laughter

-"That's the funniest thing I've heard in years"- Gustave said, containing a tear from laughing so much, Caesar kept laughing uncontrollably

-"I don't see why it's so difficult to accept. I'm serious. I don't know why, but Blake gives me the impression of a guy who needs an older girlfriend, that would take care of him"- Ayrton said

-"I'm not that type of guy, Ayrton"- Blake said, and threw a nut he found near him into Caesar's head, to shut him up

-"That will teach you"- Blake said, and added -"And if I were with a girl, Tabitha might get jealous"- Blake said, joking

-"That reminds me, that you're so damn lucky... those cats are expensive as hell"- Gustave said -"And I'm telling you, a guy who came from a formerly rich family..."-

-"I guess. Someone must have abandoned her"- Blake said, and moved his head slightly to a more comfortable position, Tabitha started to purr again happily, and the sound made Blake feel a bit sleepy...

The rest of the guys were feeling sleepy as well. But less than 15 minutes later, an arrow as shot at them, nearly hitting Ferdinand. Tabitha stood (on her fours) and hissed angrily, Ferdinand, and the guys who got up quickly, looked at where Tabitha was looking. Blake nodded at Gustave, and he aimed his hand toward the tree's branch, and shot a fireball. It exploded, and apparently missed, but Blake and his friends heard movement, and knew that whoever they were, they were hiding in the nearby trees

Then, Caesar put his hands together, and thunderbolts hit the trees, electrifying them. 4 people fell to the ground. They all were covered in bandages up to beneath their eyes, and over them they had what looked like white vests, and white pants, without shoes, only their feet covered in bandages. They moved quickly and tried to attack Blake but Tabitha jumped toward them, slashing one of them in the chest

Blake (who had quickly put the metal rings on) drew his sword, and heard Gustave say in surprise:

-"It can't be... the Sand Bandits..."-

-"Sand Bandits? What do you know about them?"- Blake asked

-"They are thieves and slave traders... they steal people's things, but mainly capture people and sell them as slaves..."-

-"What?!"- Said Ayrton

-"What are they doing here? This is way far from the desert"- Blake said

-"I don't know..."- Gustave answered -"But they are the ones who made my family lose their wealth..."- He added, angrily. and fire surrounded his hands

-"Well, before spilling blood, I'll try to persuade them..."- Blake said, and walked in front of them -"Listen, bandits, I don't know you, but I'll tell you that we have nothing of value here..."-

-"Naive young man. We aren't after things this time. We were given the mission to catch people..."- One of them said, and his voice was creepy, the only thing visible was that he had long straight red hair, also, in different of the rest, he was wearing a very long, light beige cape.

-"Do we look like guys you'd have at a house cleaning up? Don't make me laugh!!"- Caesar said

-"WE are a Mercenary Squad!!"- Ayrton said

-"That's good. We were sent to find strong people, heh..."- Another bandit said, this one was shorter, and had short black hair

-"Then you leave us no choice. Under the 88th article of King's law, we have the right to defend ourselves, by killing you..."- Ferdinand said, showing his scythe.

There were no more words, Blake and his friends dashed toward the bandits. Blake fought the long red haired one, who seemed to be the leader. Ferdinand fought the shorter black haired one. Caesar started fighting a shaven headed one. Ayrton and Gustave started fighting another long haired one, but this ones' hair was white. Blake tried to slash his opponent with his sword, but he kept dodging, and connected quick hits on Blake, who was starting to lose patience.

Then, he closed his eyes and aimed his hand at his enemy, and his hand glowed in golden as Blake muttered

-"Shining light from the heavens, vanish the darkness, enlighten, erase the evil, destroy this soul..."- He shot a powerful golden beam at the red haired bandit, who opened his eyes wide in surprise. It caused a large explosion*...

-"So... a light magician... I thought they died in the war, that's what the books said... Impressive..."- The bandit leader was covering himself with his cape, and his clothes had slight burns, Blake said nothing, and the bandit added -"But you should know better, our job is to catch any person, thus, we must be stronger than any other person... Now that I've found that you're from a rare race, it'll just increase the amount I'll get paid for..."-

Blake said nothing, but dashed toward him, and tried to slash him again, this time, the bandit countered with a katana (particularly long, nearly 150 cm, though thin), the force of their clash cracked the ground, and the bandit noticed this, then, he moved swiftly, trying to stab Blake in the back, but much to his surprise, Blake knew it and fired a golden beam behind himself without looking, the beam pushed the bandit away for at least 150 feet.

-"A beam with no incantation... heh, you sure are something..."- He did some quick moves with his hands, and placed his right open palm on the ground, saying

-"Earth Battle Spell #42: Granite Spikes!!"- And as soon as he said that, very sharp rock spikes rose from the ground, in a line which went toward Blake, who moved quickly and dodged them right before they would pierce him from beneath. But, he opened his eyes wide as he saw the bandit, with his two hands together, saying

-"Earth Sealing Spell #14: Rock Coffin!!"- Blake was seemingly enclosed into a rectangle shaped coffin made of solid rock, and then the bandit said -"Earth Sealing Spell #16: Quartz chains..."- Two chains made of pure quartz wrapped themselves tightly around the coffin, the bandit was breathing heavily, and sighed in relief...



*I mean, an explosion similar to a grenade, about 2 times larger. Not an atomic-like explosion.
152111.title: It seems there's no such thing as a day off...

choices: The battle continues... and Blake shows even more power than before...
1521111.content:
While in the coffin...

-"Alright. I guess I don't have time to play around. I better take these off..."- Blake said, and took off the metal rings around his wrists and ankles. The blue gem in his silver tag ceased to glow, and Blake put the rings away in his pocket. Then he closed and opened his right hand several times

-"It's been over 10 years I've fought with my full strength.... Let's see what I can do..."- Blake muttered, and gave s slight punch to the coffin...

Outside...

The bandit leader was helping the bandit that was fighting Gustave and Ayrton, and were having a hard time, specially with Gustave, who used fire techniques and kept burning their earth shields, as well as the rock knives they tried to shoot at them. Ayrton had seen the coffin, and knew that they got Blake enclosed into it, which angered him further, and using wind, he enhanced his speed enough to get behind the bandit leader and threatened him, putting his swords' blades (Ayrton fought using 2 swords) near the bandit's throat

-"You lose, sand scum... now release Blake!!"-

-"Really?"- The bandit leader said, and closing his eyes, two arms made of rock rose from the ground, grabbing Ayrton in a tight grip, while the white haired bandit kept fighting Gustave. Until they heard something cracking, and the bandit leader opened his eyes wide as he saw his rock coffin breaking to pieces, as well as the quartz chains... And Blake was standing there, completely unharmed, until, he suddenly disappeared... and reappeared, behind him, the bandit leader barely had time to look at him before Blake punched him, creating a powerful shockwave, and sending him away enough to be out of sight (roughly 500 meters, or half of a mile)

Ayrton had his mouth wide open, and Blake said

-"There are a lot of things I cannot explain, this is one of those. Now, go help Gustave, I'll take on this one"- Blake said, and disappeared.

Meanwhile, Ferdinand was fighting with the black haired bandit, who wielded metal claws as his weapons against Ferdinand's scythe, who was very good with it, and could change from a quick block with the scythe's blade to a surprising counter. Both fighters were focused on using their melee combat abilities. Caesar was fighting a bandit that seemed older, rather an adult than another teenager, and was using chained hooks (2 in each hand, hold between his fingers), versus Caesar's long chain whip. Caesar was however, capable of piercing the bandit's shoulder, and send electricity though the chained whip, causing heavy damage.

The explosions from electricity, fire, light, and even the dust risen from powerful earth techniques was visible from Kildevar. Rick (the duke) was starting to get worried, and went outside, and asked where was Blake's squad. It took a while for him to find out that they went to the forest to hang out. He returned to his house, and was walking around frantically. He thought

'They are definitively in trouble... if I ask support from the Royal Army they're going to kill Blake and Ferdinand... And if I don't, they might not make it... and sending my personal guard is suicide... What should I do?! Blake and his squad are actually my best men... not to mention the debt to my old friend...' His thoughts were interrupted as the maid asked him

-"Is something wrong, my lord?"-

-"Yes. Probably Blake and his squad are in trouble..."-

-"Why don't you call the Royal Army?"-

-"I've already told you. If they find out about Blake, they'll kill him, is friends, and maybe even me..."-

-"What's so bad about Blake?"-

-" *Sigh* I can't tell you..."-

-"What are you going to do?"-

-"I...don't...know..."- Rick said -"The only thing I can do without causing further trouble is pray to God that they get out of there alive and safe..."- He said, and it could be seen that he was very concerned

Back to Blake and the bandit leader... far enough to not be heard or seen by the others...

-"Spell breaker and speed enhancing spells... nothing new..."- The bandit said, brushing off the dust (ironically) from his cape

-"Nope. You're very wrong if you think I used spells. This is my real strength and speed..."- Blake disappeared again, the bandit leader, instinctively turned around, but Blake knew this and appeared behind him (if he hadn't turned around it'd be in front of him) and kicked him upward, sending him very high into the sky. Blake appeared next to him and said

-"You know what sucks about earth magicians?... they can't fight in air..."- Blake said, who connected a lot of punches and kicks while they started to fall, after a considerable combo, Blake clutched his hands together, and double axe-handle punched him, sending him downward and into the ground, rising huge amounts of dust, and crating a large crater (deeper rather than wider)

Blake landed safely near the crater, and drew his sword. The bandit leader climbed up and got out of the crater, this time, he had some bleeding wounds, but he didn't seem to care, and after doing a quick move with his right hand, knives made of rock appeared in his hand and he started throwing them at Blake, who blocked them, using his sword's wide blade as a shield (His sword looked like this http://www.tantra.ph/mudha/images/nikrat... )

Then, the bandit leader moved quickly, trying to attack in an open point in Blake's defense, but he swung his sword, creating an horizontal C-shaped wave of golden energy, which, although missed, prevented the bandit from attacking. Blake quickly turned around and hit the ground with his sword, creating a shockwave that knocked the bandit off his feet. Blake then shot three golden energy balls at him, and apparently hit their target, causing small explosions...

After the smoke vanished, the red bandit could be seen, he had activated a solid rock shield, which got cracked, and it turned to dust after some seconds. The bandit then said

-"This is inhuman... Nobody had broken a rock coffin and quartz chains through sheer strength... And nobody other than us can generate quakes..."-, then, the dust rose from the ground and patched his wounds, and healed them. Then, he laughed and said

-"This is a real earthquake!!"- He did other moves with his hands, then put them together, and said -"Earth Battle Spell #71: Great Quake!!"- The ground beneath Blake cracked, and he moved quickly away from it. The ground started to shake violently, but Blake punched hard the ground, causing a wide and deep crater, and the quake stopped.

-"Uh...what?!!"- The bandit was confused, and before he realized, Blake was in front of him, grabbed him by the face and slammed him against the ground, the impact caused a smaller quake and clouds of dust rose from it. Blake kept punching the bandit until he shot a wave of fire at him. Blake dashed back and drew his sword again, just in time to block another fire wave. The wind was swirling around the bandit, and it could be seen that he was angrier

-"Why you?!!"- The bandit said, and dashed toward Blake, his katana clashed against Blake's sword, and started an insane sword fight, both of them moved quickly, tried to slash and stab each other, and Blake was able to perform some amazing moves such as a 360 degree air spin, attempting to slash the bandit's shoulder from above, but he stopped it with his katana and pushed Blake away.

Meanwhile, Ferdinand and his opponent were seemingly even, and had used only melee combat so far. However, Ferdinand perceived Blake was against a strong enemy, so, he started using dark magic, he formed a bow made of what looked like black fire, and shot an arrow made of the same thing to the black haired bandit's knee. The bandit said

-"A dark magician? I thought your King had wiped you out..."- Ferdinand knew that what he just did was really risky, but he didn't feel like having much more time to waste on these thieves. Then, he swung his scythe and formed two C-shaped waves made of darkness, they caused a great explosion but apparently missed, until Ferdinand noticed that his opponent was limping, and that his right leg was bleeding...

Also, Caesar managed to pierce the shaven-headed bandit's chest, and forced a heavy electroshock on him, through his chained whip. He pulled his whip back, and the bandit stared at him blankly, then, he fell to the ground, dead.

Ayrton and Gustave were having a hard time against the white haired bandit, because he was using a lot of powerful higher level earth spells, which such as a quartz shield, which were able to block Gustave's fire attacks, and Ayrton's Wind cutter (Similar to other waves, this one is made of wind, and in difference of the others, this one cuts rather than exploding). Until a thunderbolt struck him from above, Gustave and Ayrton turned around to see Caesar, who said

-"Need some help?"-

-"Actually yes, but Ferdinand and Blake are fighting alone over there..."- Ayrton said

-"I know, but they can handle it. And you know Blake fights hates interference when fighting one on one..."- Caesar replied, Gustave noded in agreement, while Ayrton said no more because it wouldn't change things

-"Alright, let's take care of this one quickly, then we'll help out Ferdinand"- Caesar said, cracking his knuckles...
1521111.title: The battle continues...

choices: Later, at the Sand Bandit's Village
15211111.content:
Blake saw what Ferdinand did, and knew that he couldn't let these bandits go alive, not after witnessing one of the last living dark magician. Blake sighed, thinking

'This terrible power is what led to my people's downfall... the power of darkness caused their deaths, by fear, of them becoming dangerous... I hate what this does to us, what it has done to me, to Ferdinand... It probably also got my father killed... But right now, I have no other choice than killing all these bandits as quickly as possible'

Blake took off the silver chain with the tag he always wore, and put it away in another pocket. The instant he did that, his heart started to beat faster, and louder (though Blake was the only one who could hear it, of course), his hair started waving upward, like a flame. And his eyes whited out (became iris and pupil-less). The wind started to swirl around him violently, and small dark flames were visible around him along the wind. Then, he dashed toward the bandit, who formed a thick rock solid shield, but Blake broke it with a single punch, and, after grabbing the bandit by the throat, smashed him on the ground again, and pinned him with his left foot.

Blake then shot an immense dark beam that bounced off the ground as a massive pillar of black reddish fire (That's what's darkness like here, though Ferdinand's is bluish instead). Then, without warning, a purplish dark beam struck Blake from above, and the white haired bandit stood in front of him. Blake got up and turned around to see two of the bandits dead (the shaven-headed and the short haired one) and his friends laying unconscious. Blake said

-"I-Impossible... w-who...what the hell are you?"-

-"You don't have to know"- The white haired bandit's eyes glowed in red (before, they were mistaken for dark brown), and had a purplish dark flame in his hand, then he said -"Now that nobody's watching, fight me with all you've got!!"-

-"I thought the bandits were earth magicians..."- Blake replied, and dashed toward his new enemy, their firsts clashed and caused a powerful shockwave that even shook Kildevar's buildings. They started moving at insane speeds, exchanging dark beams, which caused more explosions...

A bit earlier, at Kildevar, the people was starting to get scared, and kept asking the duke about what to do, also, they started to push him to bring the Royal Army

-"Listen, people of Kildevar. I don't know what's going on, but our mercenary squad is fighting whatever might threaten our safety. Please trust them, they've worked here for three years and have stopped crime, and we've been enjoying peace thanks to them. I only ask you to stay calm"- Rick said, and the crowd calmed down, until someone shouted

-"I saw clearly earth dust, and we felt an earthquake not too long ago. That can only mean that we're under the Sand Bandits' Attack"-

-"What?!!"- Rick said, and the crowd became very worried again

-"Listen, let's give it some more time... if this doesn't stop at noon, I'll send my personal guard"-

-"We need the Royal Army!! Only they can handle such a thing!!"- The crowd shouted

-"Just calm down, what if Blake and his squad stop this threat? We'd have brought the Royal Army for nothing, and they'd be mad, you know how are the General and the King about these sort of things"- Rick said, and people started to go to their houses when they saw a massive pillar or dark fire rise from the ground. It was so massive that blocked the sun for a moment. The people didn't move an inch, but kept staring at Rick, who said

-"Alright... I'll send a message to the Royal Army"-

Secretly, he wrote another message in a scroll, which said

'Blake. I don't know what's going on there, but people has become very worried and scared, and what happened recently forced me to bring the Royal Army, as there are rumors about the sand bandits. If they find you, you and your friends will be executed. Get outta there ASAP!! I personally thank you very much for your services, and I know that you were the mysterious person who helped people. Take this as a gift, and use it wisely. You have to go as far as possible from here. Maybe you could go back to some place you've been before, I know there's people willing to help you out.

Rick - Duke of Kildevar

PS: In case you forgot... GET THE HELL OUTTA THERE!!!'

He rolled it and put it in a small bag, which was nearly full of gold coins. He sent a messenger to the woods, and told him to watch them, if the fight ended, or if the Royal Army started to get near there. In both cases, he would need to deliver the message to Blake and to see that they get far enough. He also gave him money to buy a few knives and a sword just in case...

The messenger went to see a blacksmith, who was the man Blake saved the previous day. After learning what the messenger was there for, he gave him his best weapons for free, and gave him some golden coins to add to the bag. The messenger left, and as soon as he started walking into the woods, he could feel the powerful shockwaves, and saw traces of black fire in the sky...

Back to Blake's fight

He kept trying to punch and kick this bandit with long white hair, but he was able to dodge and counter his attacks. They also shot powerful dark waves at each other, but they cancelled and exploded when hitting each other, which meant that this guy was as powerful as Blake, who was surprised by this, and muttered

-"Dark magic... this guy is definitively NOT an earth magician... but how can that be? Ferdinand and me are the last living ones!!"-

-"Are you scared? You should... stupid little kid. You certainly overwhelmed that sand bandit with such power, but that doesn't intimidate someone like me!!"- He disappeared and reappeared next to Blake, and aimed his open palm in front of Blake's face

-"Bye bye..."- The white haired bandit said, and fired a massive purplish dark energy ball, which, again, was visible from Kildevar. The explosion was extremely intense, and shook Kildevar to the point that some houses and stores collapsed, also, people saw the traces of dark energy, though only the older people knew what it meant...

Blake was now lying unconscious, and reverted to his normal state. Just in time, the white haired bandit's eyes stopped glowing and said

-"Hmph... Not bad, but it seems you haven't used darkness in a while... how funny, attempting to deny what you truly are..."-

Then, the bandit leader woke up groggily, and said

-"Ouch... my head... everything hurts..."- Then he saw Blake and his friends laying unconscious, then, he looked at the white haired bandit, who said

-"It's all ready. I managed to knock these guys out..."- He pretended to be wounded

-"Whoah. You're really good. But... it cost us two of our team members... Our bosses won't be happy"-

-"They will when you get your payment from that deal. I'll tell you what. Sell them this guy, we don't want him at a normal house, which he can escape easily from..."- The white haired pointed his finger at Blake. Then, the bandit leader picked him up, and felt a sudden pain as something attacked him from behind. He quickly recovered, and saw an angry giant cat* hissing furiously...

-"Uh... we forgot about this thing..."- The bandit leader said, and a rock fell from above, hitting Tabitha's head, leaving her unconscious. The white haired bandit said

-"We're taking her as well. We'll get a juicy reward for such a rare and expensive animal"- The white haired bandit lifted her up, and placed her, as well as Blake's friends, in a very solid rock cage, reinforced with four quartz chains. Blake was chained with diamond+ chains around his wrists, ankle, abdomen and neck, to a cage made of diamond, inside another rock cage, which was reinforced with 4 diamonds chains wrapped around it...

-"This is NOT good..."- The messenger sent by Rick said...

*Just to remind readers: They are supposed to be a certain species of cats, used for riding and carrying things, though they are really expensive, as Gustave said. Blake found her abandoned at some point during his childhood.
+ With diamond I meant uncut or crude diamond
15211111.title: Blake shows his real power...

choices: Blake wakes up after a while...
152111111.content:
(Before starting: As it has been stated, these bandits are earth magicians, the name of Sand Bandits comes from the place they live, the desert, which makes very difficult for anyone to attack or infiltrate there, and the land is technically useless to any conqueror)

A tall man, with dark red hair (almost brown), dressed as all bandits (wrapped in grayish bandages, light beige pants, and vest), but with a gray cape, said

-"Why isn't here the whole team?"-

-"We lost two of our teammates, sir, these guys were pretty strong, specially the one we brought alone..."- Said the bandit with long red hair, and gulped

-"BUT we brought this"- The white haired bandit said, showing him the unconscious cat in a rock cage -"I know it can't compensate our loss, but at least we can get more from this..."-

-"It's alright. I would've lost more men if I sent a weaker team after such a mission. Then, get prepared, because the rest of the teams are busy right now, so, you'll have to do the delivery as well"- The tall man, who seemingly was their superior, said

-"Yes, sir"- The red haired bandit said

-"One moment. I think we can get more money out of those people..."- The white haired bandit said -"Just sell them the strongest one, it's not like we want him near us, or in a house from which he can escape with no problem... and we might make him very, very expensive..."-

-"I like how you think"- The tall man said, then he added -"Then, deliver that one, and we'll sell the rest for high prices as well"-

-"I'll get going sir"- The red haired bandit said

-"When you return, you can have two days off. And make sure to check the apprentices, you'll need to add two of them to your team..."-

-"Yes sir"- The red haired bandit replied, then he said to his white haired partner

-"It's a bit of a long trip. Can you take care of the other guys until we sell them?"-

The white haired bandit nodded as an answer, and the red haired started to get going. It wasn't that difficult since he formed wheels made of rock under the cage that kept Blake prisoner, and had two camels pulling it, despite this, he preferred to travel on a plain rock (surfing-like, using his earth abilities) rather than mounting one of them. Hours passed, and after roughly 6 hours Blake woke up, just to find himself bleeding and in a dark place, chained everywhere, he couldn't move, and because he used a lot of power, he had little strength left, perhaps, enough to survive the travel, to wherever those crazy bandits where taking him.

Blake couldn't know how much time had passed, it was hot, dark, and couldn't move. He was also hungry, and thirsty, but nothing he couldn't endure. What he hated was the idea of being sold as a slave, he could almost see some random man buying him, and use him to clean the house and do everything, specially disgusting tasks, for a miserable portion of food that wouldn't let him get back to his full strength, and would probably get whipped as well. The better case was that of a domestic slave for a woman, generally, wife to an important person, such as a duke, or a count (though Rick didn't make use of slaves, he had maids and paid them, as well as providing them with food and decent living)

Blake also considered that they might take him to some spectacle manager, elegant name for a gladiator manager, who would find Blake's abilities very attractive for bloody spectacles, for which the people paid a lot to watch. Blake might return to his full power, but it'd be still difficult to escape, as Elite-level guards usually keep the gladiators from that. Some captains and colonels were known for using their men for this, and are extremely rich because of the two jobs, on the Elite ranks, paid by the King, and by their own earnings from gladiator fights... Blake hated this idea. It was true that he was a mercenary, but he only worked on stopping crime, and defending villages unattended by the Royal Army (They used to bully people and take their stuff away, and nobody could complain, because anyone who dared would probably get killed by them)

Blake thought again, about the bandits' words "That's good. We were sent to find strong people, heh..." What could they mean? What would someone want a warrior like Blake for? He kept wondering, he knew it didn't matter, because on the end, he'd find out the bad way, but this at least kept his mind busy, as he neither knew how long had he been there...

The only good thing about being tightly wrapped in chains, was that he didn't feel the bumps along the ride, but this was of little help, Blake was far more worried about where would he end up. He also thought the possibility of being brought to the King, just to be executed for being a living dark magician. He was told by his grandma that if he was ever caught by the King, that's what would happen to him, that's what kept Blake and Ferdinand from trying to get into the Royal Army. Blake would have prayed for this not to happen, however, he had little to do when finally, the hunger and tiredness knocked him unconscious again...

Outside, it had passed 2 days, and by the look in the red haired bandit's eyes, they were near their destination. It was an immense village, literally, all buildings were like they were scaled over 50 times their normal size. Anyone with a small bit of brain would know that it was obvious that giants lived here, however, the bandit was not worried, and entered the village without fear. But, despite it couldn't be seen because of the bandages he wore, he was truly surprised, he had never seen such a place in his entire life. The inhabitants were roughly 150 feet tall. Anyone else (normal sized) would be scared and run away, but the bandit was confident on his power and the threat of Sand Bandits' enmity. He headed to a gigantic castle, which didn't need a moat due to its sheer size and its inhabitants' size as well (Thus, it didn't have the typical bridge-door thing, but still, it had an immense door)

The camels stopped, and the chains they were pulling turned into dust (they were made of rock as well), then rock chains appeared to keep the camels from escaping. The red haired bandit walked toward the door, rose from the ground with a earth platform that went up to 100 feet tall, and used a big hand made of rock to knock the door. A giant girl (blonde, with short hair, slightly shorter than the rest, possibly around 200 feet tall), seemingly 17-18 years old opened it, and wasn't very surprised of seeing the tiny (to her) bandit, she said

-"So, did you bring what we agreed?"-

-"Of course. And let me tell you that this is of the best ones, it was very difficult to capture him"- The bandit said, though the girl rolled her eyes

-"It would have been easier for any of us, but since your king exiled us and threatened us with war, we needed someone else to do it..."-

-"We aren't under the king's orders"- The bandit said

-"Whatever..."- Replied the giant girl -"So, where is it?"-

-"It's outside, but now, let's discuss the payment. This specimen was extremely difficult to capture, and it cost two of our teammates lives. So I expect a good payment"-

-"Well, it was only one, but if what you said is right and is particularly strong, I guess it was worth it"- She put on the ground a giant bag filled with...guess what? giant gold coins. The bandit used a giant hand made of earth to grab it, and said

-"It's a few meters behind me, in a rock cage, though to you it's more of a box"- The giant blonde girl called for another girl, an asian-looking one (also, slightly taller than her)

-"Claire? Can you bring that rock box inside? It's a very special thing..."- The girl nodded and brought the box inside. The bandit left, and they closed the castle's doors.

-"What is it, Karina?"- Claire asked

-"Something very rare and expensive..."-

-"More jewelry?"-

-"Nope"-

-"New shoes?"- Claire asked, and Karina slapped her forehead...

-"Open it and look by yourself"- She said, and Claire complied. Inside it, was a tiny guy, wrapped in lots of chains

-"Is this a toy or something?"- Claire asked, Karina sighed and started removing the chains (which was very easy for anyone that size). After the "mess" was removed, it remained a tiny unconscious guy

-"It's a man..."- Karina said, a bit surprised, as she had never seen one in her entire life, only in books.

-"Is he alive?"- Claire asked, seeing Blake's terrible condition

-"He must, otherwise, that bandit is going to suffer a lot..."- Karina said, and noticed lots of wounds on him -"At least he was telling the truth, it seems that he gave quite a fight to them... We better start healing him..."-

-"What are we going to do with him?"- Claire asked

-"WE? Nothing. It's for the princess..."- Karina replied

-"Awww..."- Claire said

-"Maybe in the future we might get more, but for now, this one will be for the princess. Royalty's first, you know. And we can't let the royal family die out like this. Anyway, it was with good timing. The princess will turn 18 in a few days..."- Karina said, and put Blake to rest in a bowl with what looked like hot water, plus some herbs

-"Take care of him. I'll go tell the princess"- Karina said to Claire and left...
152111111.title: Later, at the Sand Bandit's Village

choices: Continue (Back to the Sand Bandits' village)...
1521111111.content:
Some minutes later, Blake woke up. Apparently, he was in a large bathtub, and the water smelled of healing herbs, Blake thought

'Can this be? I was sold as a slave... unless...No, that can't be, this place looks like nothing I've seen before... I wonder...' Blake said, not moving yet, but his eyes were open, and opened even wider when he saw a girl's face, a lot bigger...

-"WHAT IN THE NAME OF...?!"- The girl put her index finger on Blake's mouth, and said

-"Sshhh... calm down, little man..."-

-"MFFFF MFF MFFFFFMFFF!"- Blake said, muffled by her finger, and she moved her finger away from him

-"How can I calm down? My friends and me were captured by some crazy bandits! And they sold me as a slave! And I'm not little, you're FREAKING HUGE!!"- Blake shouted, though, much to his dismay, the girl giggled

-"You look as you had never seen a giant before"-

-"I didn't even know giants existed in the first place!"- Blake said, still very angry, and tried to get up, but some of his wounds reopened, and fell down in pain (still in the bowl)

-"You should rest for now. Your wounds haven't healed yet..."-

-"Of all people, why would YOU buy a slave like me?!! I can't do any thing you'd expect from a slave, you'd need a giant slave for that!"-

-"Believe me, you can do things we can't..."- Claire said, trying to sound seductive

-"Like what? Killing giant mice?! Cleaning small places?! For the love of..."- Blake was interrupted again by Claire putting her index finger on his face

-"Calm down. Anger is not good for your health"-

-"And you care about my health?!"- Blake said, angry and sarcastically

-"Of course. You need to be in good health"- Claire replied

-"Meh..."- Blake said -"I am SO going to hate this..."- Then he thought 'Maybe I have better chances of escaping, I guess it would be difficult for them see someone my size going out through a window...'

Claire giggled again, somehow, it was cute to her that he knew nothing about giants, and also, somehow, Blake's reaction was a bit comical...

-"By the way... What's your name?"- She asked

-"Does it matter?"- Blake said, still mad, at himself for being wounded, and for losing the fight, at the bandits for kidnapping him and selling him to giants, and at this girl for trying to be cheerful when he's gonna be a mere slave...

-"It does"-

-"Blake..."- He said, reluctantly

-"I'm Claire"- She said, and winked at him, just to find that he closed his eyes, leaving her with a ¬///¬ expression (angry/blushing) -"H-Hey!!"- She said

-"What?!! Do you expect me to be happy about this? You still haven't told me what the hell do you want me for!!"- Blake answered, angrily

-"Well... I'm not the one to tell you that... the princess should tell you herself"- Claire replied, while Blake could hear a glass breaking in his head

-"A...a princess?!!"- Blake had a nearly petrified expression and his mind was already creating horrible images, possibly a 12 -13 years old spoiled brat, maybe ugly, or maybe just with lots of freckles and a geeky look, pigtails (why? don't ask me, maybe because they look childish, I dunno). Blake also imagined that he'd probably be treated as a hamster or an animated toy.

-"G-G-goddammit!! Of all things!! A toy?!!"- Blake got up, and despite some of his wounds reopened again, he didn't care, and attempted to escape by jumping out of the bowl (He had no weights on, so, he can jump far, though not as much as he would if he were fully healed). Then he started to run, screaming -"There's no way IN HELL I'll become an oversized spoiled brat's toy!!"- He almost got out of the room (equivalent to a living room, by the way) but the gigantic door was closed, and the space beneath was not enough for him to escape. Claire towered over him, and he gulped hard, she picked him up

-"You're not going to heal if you keep running like this"-

-"I DON'T WANT TO HEAL! I WANT TO GET THE HELL OUTTA HERE!"- Blake kept struggling and more wounds reopened. He started to get weakened, and Claire said

-"You were too expensive, I can't let you die like that. Anyway, Karina would kill me"-

-"Please, for whatever you believe in, let me go..."- Blake attempted to appeal to her mercy

-"That's not going to work"-

-"What do you want me to do?! I'll do anything if you get me out of here..."- Blake said more desperately, and Claire was somewhat tempted, but knew that Karina would be extremely mad, as well as pretty much all people, for stealing princess' birthday gift.

-"I'm sorry. I can't help you. What you have to do is lie there, relax, get healed and stay with the princess"-

-"Seriously, a human?! That's the best you thought of?! There are things called TOYS! I won't be a toy for whatever spoiled brat you call a princess!"-

-"Actually it was Karina's idea... well, not exactly, we were seeking for a human male..."-

-"Aren't there other ones?! Why me?!"-

-"It's a long story. I dunno much about it, only that we were exiled by your king under threats of war, and since we don't have males, that would only make our extinction faster..."-

-"Extinction..."- Blake's mind was processing the information, then, it hit him in the head like a brick thrown from a castle tower... -"W-wa-wa-wait... if you want me because you're endangered... that means..."- Blake gulped hard, and added -"You want me to..."- Claire nodded, as she knew that he realized...

-"THIS IS A LOT WORSE THAN BEING A TOY! Let me go!"- Blake was starting to open Claire's hand, and she used both hands to enclose him

-"Please! You can't do this to me!"-

-"I won't do anything. The princess will..."-

-"Aaaaarghhhhh!!"- Blake's scream was so strong that nearby birds fled from the trees...

Claire placed him in a thick transparent jar, and poured the healing water in there (With Blake standing up, it went barely past his ankles, so, he could just lay and let the water do its job). Karina came in immediately

-"Claire!! What happened?!! I heard a scream..."- Then she looked at the jar, with the human the bandits brought punching and kicking it

-"He screamed because he learned what he's here for..."- Claire said, giggling

-"He doesn't seem happy about it..."- Karina commented -"It's not like that matters. I bought him legally, and belongs to the princess"-

-"LEGALLY?! What the HELL?! What kind of kingdom allows giants to buy people?!"-

-"Ours"- Karina and Claire replied, and both giggled

-"I demand you to cancel this! I'm not from your kingdom, the law doesn't apply, I'm a foreigner!"- Blake said (he was running out of ideas)

-"Sorry, but only your king may rescue you, only he and his army are powerful enough to threaten us..."- Karina answered

'That's it!! I need to contact Rick! He's a duke, he might get me out of this mess!' Blake thought, but also knew that the possibilities to contact him were nearly of 0%, so, he decided to go on with his plan to escape, punching and kicking the jar, although he was doing it slowly, because of the pain he was feeling

-"He's stubborn, but cute"- Claire said

-"I bet you that he'll change his mind once he sees the princess"- Karina said, then she called her -"Your Majesty, you may come in..."-

Blake gulped hard, and stopped for a moment. Although he didn't really want to see the princess, his curiosity would force him to (He was thinking more like "How bad/ugly will this spoiled brat be?). She came in. It was a girl taller than the others, with fair skin, wavy brown hair, and hazel eyes. As well as large breasts but Blake didn't really pay attention to that. He stared at her for 10 seconds in shock, and Karina laughed, saying to Claire

-"I told you"-

Then, Blake turned around and started to punch, kick and throw energy frantically at the jar, cracking it slightly, and kept giving stronger punches and kicks, more frantically than ever

-"Yeah... he changed his mind"- Claire said sarcastically, she had perceived before that Blake wouldn't really care of what the princess looked like, he'd try to escape anyway.

-"Why is he... trying to break the jar?"- The princess asked, shyly

-"Hey, you stop doing that!"- Karina ordered to Blake, but he didn't listen, and kept trying more frantically than ever. He managed to dent the thick glass and was cracking it more and more, then, he shot a golden beam from his two hands and caused an explosion (small to the girls). After that, he was breathing very heavily, and with his hands trembling (by pain and tiredness) he drew his sword and started hitting the jar, and began to splinter it. Claire walked next to the jar and was about to take Blake out when he stopped, and fell unconscious again. The medicinal water turned red from the blood that was shedding from Blake's wounds, all of them reopened due to his desperate efforts...

-"Uhm... I guess you'll have you acquaint with him when he wakes up. But it'd be better that you keep him at your room. If he tries to escape just call us, Majesty"- Karina took Blake from the jar and put him on the princess' open palm.

-"I'll get more healing water"- Claire said, and left. And so, the princess took Blake to her room, although very shyly...
1521111111.title: Blake wakes up after a while...

15211111111.content:
While Blake was learning of his new home, the others were being auctioned off like a piece of furniture. Some richer people came in their fancy clothes, and then one man stood in his brown cloak. They were sold as a group. The auction started and ended with his bid. He pulled them along, chained up, wounded, and mentally destroyed. He reached his carriage and left with them. He pulled aside a ways from the auction and unchained them.

"I know exactly who you are and what you want." They were all shocked that this man was so forward. "You want Blake, I want Blake. And not in a creepy way."

The gang was now very confused as to how anyone could know all this.

"We need to heal you up, then we will get to the bandit's hideout and get his position. Only then do we decide on a plan." They piled in the back and an hours trip brought them to a large inn.

"My sister and I own this place. We fixed it up and now it's looking great. Let's get some food into you and get healing, huh?" he walked away as the gang still sat in bewilderment. How could they have not seen his face and how does he know all this?
15211111111.title: Continue (Back to the Sand Bandits' village...

152111111111.content:
Hours later, in the giantesses' castle...

The princess was contemplating the little human Karina and Claire gave her. She didn't really know what to do (Karina was going to start explaining about it when they heard Blake's scream). He was laying unconscious in a bowl with medicinal water inside a small cage, to keep him from escaping. He was sleeping, and moved a bit in his sleep. After a while, she noticed that it was more like a nightmare, his arms were moving a bit, as if they were swinging his sword, which had been conveniently put away by the princess on her nightstand. Despite what it seems, she was more worried about him getting hurt rather than afraid of him escaping.

He muttered in his dream/nightmare 'I..am...not...guilty....I...was...born like this...you...can't blame...me...for that' This confused the princess, who started to wonder who was really that little guy. He seemed to be suffering in his dream, and by what she heard, he was in some sort of trial. After some minutes, he kept moving while in the medicinal water, and sat up quickly, exclaiming

-"I'm not going to die!!"- Then he realized that it had been all a dream, and said -" *Phew!* Good thing nobody heard me..."- And when he looked around, he noticed a different giant girl staring at him, he fell backward and got some water in his mouth

-"What the?! *Gasp* "- Blake then coughed out some water, which by the way had a stronger taste, as it was more concentrated to accelerate his healing

-"I... I'm sorry... I didn't mean to scare you..."- She apologized, Blake recognized this girl as the princess (Or in his own words, "the spoiled brat"). He sat up, and checked his wounds. They closed again, but would reopen with another big effort, he sighed, calculating that he'd need at least 3 days to fully recover. Then he looked around, and noticed the cage around the bowl where he had been laying unconscious. 'I guess they don't make the same mistake twice' He thought, and now, with the girl watching him, there was no way he could escape...

Blake then noticed that his sword was no longer there, and slapped his forehead 'Dammit!! Just what I needed... I can't lose that sword, I need to get it back...' he thought, and searched for it, soon he found it on the nightstand. Blake opened and closed his hands repeatedly 'Maybe I can still pull a last attempt off' and prepared himself, a ball of pale golden energy started to charge up in his left hand (while it was behind his back). He then said, almost whispering

-"Gold shining light. The source of all life, gather in my hand, lend me the power to destroy my enemy, purify, vanish the darkness..."-

After that, the ball changed to a darker and stronger golden color, and shot it at the cage's padlock, exploding and destroying it. The princess got scared by this, and suddenly, felt something hitting her in the stomach with tremendous force, making her to fall back on her bed. Much to her surprise, Blake had quickly gotten his sword back, and was pointing one of its bladed edges at her throat. He even pushed it slightly so she felt the cold and sharp metal.

-"I may not be gigantic, but I'm not someone to be underestimated..."- She gasped, and Blake said -"Any word, any suspicious move, and I'll cut your neck, understood?"- She nodded, very scared. Then Blake said

-"Honestly, I have nothing against you. But I'm NOT for sale!! And I'm NOT GOING to be your property!!"- Blake then charged what looked like another golden energy ball, and said

-"If you don't say anything, I'll just leave, and you'll see me never again..."- She could hear the energy charging in his hand -"BUT... if you try to have those giant girls to catch me, I'll blow your head with a beam..."- Then the door was suddenly opened

-"Your Majesty, it's dinner t..."- Karina entered, and the first she saw was the princess laying on her bed, and the little human was pointing a sword at her throat as well as a charging energy ball -"How dare you to treat the Princess like that?!!"- She said angrily, and tried to dash toward him to catch him, and Blake said

-"I'm outta here"- He jumped quickly and escaped through the open window. Despite Karina was really mad, she first checked on the princess, and asked her

-"What happened? Are you hurt?"-

-"I don't know, there was an explosion, and before I knew anything, he appeared in front of me. But he said he wouldn't hurt me, he just wanted to leave..."-

Karina facepalmed herself, then she said

-"With all due respect, Your Majesty, you could have easily have pinned him down with your hand..."-

-"No... I couldn't, he was too fast"- The princess denied with her head

-"I'll go after him"- Karina said, and called for Claire and explained her the situation, soon, they ran outside and started searching, leaving an even more confused, and a bit scared princess.

-"He can't get too far, this place is immense to him..."- Claire said

-"I better hope so. He cost us too much to let him go like that..."- Karina said, angry again

Meanwhile, Blake was dashing* the fastest he could. He knew the girls would be after him, and that they'd search in grass and ground in general, so, he climbed a gigantic tree and resumed escaping by jumping from branches to other branches, until a huge house blocked his way. He would go around it in normal circumstances, but he knew he'd waste a lot of time, and time was what he needed, so, he decided to sneak in, though the window, go in a straight line and get out of the house as silently as he entered. And so, he saw the window, and jumped toward it, but the bad thing was that Blake's legs failed for a brief moment, due to the constant strain and that Blake hadn't given himself time to rest and fully recover, which resulted in him crashing through the window, instead of landing near it and sliding beneath a small opening, Blake ended up landing in a table...

Blake got some cuts from the glass, and quickly took out the glass pieces stuck in his shoulders and arms. He also noticed that his wounds were reopening again. 'Damn!!' He thought, and when he prepared to run, he noticed a giant woman at his left, who was sitting at her table, which

-"Argh... just great... I had to crash into that goddamn window... it's obvious I did some noise..."- Blake also noticed that the woman was staring at him, he said

-"I'm sorry. I don't have money to pay that broken glass. My presence here it's just an accident..."- He prepared again to leave and the woman said

-"Wait"-

-"Huh?"- Blake was confused, and didn't trust giant women after what happened some minutes before -"I don't mean to be rude, ma'am, but I can't stay here, nor anywhere near here. I need to go back to my home village"- Despite Blake knew he had no home land, he wouldn't waste more time to explain that woman, and a simple excuse was all he needed. However, the woman said

-"You're hurt..."-

-"I'll take care of that later... wait!!"- The woman grabbed Blake in her hand, and this time he had little strength left to oppose more resistance. By the way, this woman was thin, with wavy waist-length brown hair, fair skinned, and had emerald green eyes. Blake couldn't determinate her age by her look, she looked like she was in her 20's. or did he care, he wished that she wasn't going to give him back to the princess and her servants (SPECIALLY her servants).

She brought him near her eyes, and Blake assumed she was checking his wounds, although he didn't understand why a giantess would help a human she doesn't know, but his thoughts were interrupted when he was abruptly moved, and the woman gave him a very tight hug. She said

-"My baby!!!"-

-"W...What?!!"- Blake said, then, after realizing what she said he muttered -"Oh God... why did I have to sneak in this house... this woman is crazy!!"-

After she released her hug, Blake said, trying to sound as polite as possible -"Excuse me, ma'am. But you're obviously mistaking me for someone else. I am not related to you in any way..."-

-"Of course you are. You are my little baby..."- The woman said happily, with a n_n face

-"I AM NOT YOUR BABY!!"- Blake shouted angrily, and tried to leave, more desperate than before -"This woman is totally nuts for sure..."- He muttered, but the woman closed her hand.

-"Listen, how can you seriously think I'm your baby?! You're a giant!! I'm a human!!"- Blake said, struggling against her grip, and noticed that her expression became more serious

-"You don't believe me, do you?"-

-"Of course not!!"-

-"I can prove it"- The woman said, still sounding serious

-"Oh really?"- Blake said, with a challenging tone -"Let's make a bet. If you can prove it, I'll stay. If you're wrong, you let me go..."- The woman nodded


*Dash: A fast move, which consists of Blake "disappearing" and "reappearing". It's not teleporting, it's just Blake's raw speed. Also, despite he apparently disappears from eyesight for brief moments, that doesn't mean he can't collide with things. The length and speed of these dashes depends on Blake's health and skill.
152111111111.title: Back to Blake's...new home?

1521111111111.content:
-"First, your name is Blake..."- She said, and Blake said mentally 'HUH?!! Alright, calm down, it's possible that they found out because of the bandit or something'

-"Your father was a Dark Sage..."- Blake was now with a O.O face 'There's no way she could know that'

-"You were born September 15th, at the sunset..."- The woman continued 'Impossible!! How could she know the detail I was born at the sunset?!!' Blake thought, growing more desperate

-"Also, we gave you a silver chain with a silver tag which had your name written on it in gold letters... which you're not wearing by the way..."- The woman said, and Blake, who managed to break free from her grip, drew his sword and pointed it at her

-"Alright!! How do you know such information and why the hell do you know such information?!!"-

-"I told you. You're my baby..."- The woman said, her tone was sounding sweeter

-"I'm serious!!! I'm not gonna buy that"- Blake said, angrier than before, because this woman might know too much about him

-"I'll tell you a definitive proof. A trait that you inherited from me... You have a blue beauty mark in your left shoulder..."- The woman said

Blake opened his eyes and mouth wide. He knew he had that blue beauty mark, (And there was no way she could see it, since he was wearing a black shirt and a black cape on top of it) and his grandma told him that it was his mother's family's mark... (Although Blake was never told who was his mother)

-"There has to be something wrong... This isn't possible... this isn't happening..."- Blake's hands were trembling

-"I guessed you wouldn't believe me... but it's true, you are my son..."- She said, sounding even sweeter -"Although not a proof... the scar you have in your right eye is identical to your fathers'..."- She added

-"But... I am a human... how can a giant be my mother?!!"- Blake had never been so confused in his life

-"It's a very long story..."-

-"Then, why did you never say anything, tell my grandma where to find you?!!"- Blake was angrier at the revelation that his mother was a giant and that she didn't seem to care about him

-"We had to keep you secret until you were old enough... Blake... in the rest of people's eyes, you are the fruit of a forbidden relationship... well, technically, of two forbidden relationships..."-

-"Huh?!!"-

-"You must be aware that you are a Zasshu... aren't you?"-

-"What's a Zasshu?"- Blake had heard the word before, and remembered...

He had lived his entire life with his grandmother. His only friend and neighbor was Ferdinand. They lived in a forest, away from most of people. One day, when he was 9 years old, a furious crowd attacked him with no reason, Ferdinand came to help him (he was 10 years old), and they kept chasing after them, they tried to lose them inside the forest, but the crowd used torches to illuminate their way. The crowd kept shouting

-"Death to Dark magicians!!"-

Ferdinand and Blake got cornered, and started fighting back using dark magic and light magic, respectively, then, a man slashed Blake's face with a pitchfork (which would leave a scar in his left eye, which is one of Blake's most recognizable traits, though he always wore a hood to darken his face, preventing others from seeing it. Only Ferdinand knew of it). Ferdinand countered with dark beams and formed a shield in front of Blake, which made the man bounce off... Then another man tried to pull Blake by the arm, but he swung it, and threw away the man through a lot of trees at an insane distance. The people stopped for a moment, then they shouted more furiously

-"Death to the Zasshu!! Death to the Zasshu!!"-

Blake's grandma appeared, and told them to go away. She told Blake that she had nothing else to teach him, and that he needed to live on, to move on, to go on his own. After he and Ferdinand got far enough, they saw a massive pillar of darkness rise, shaped like a double edged sword's tip. They knew what it meant... it was a forbidden spell, that needed a person's life to be performed. Blake fell to his knees, and tears dropped from his eyes. Ferdinand could only kneel next to him and put his hand on his shoulder... That was the only time anyone had ever seen Blake crying...

-"It's the name humans gave to the hybrids born from a male human and a giantess..."- Blake's mother interrupted his thoughts -"A long time ago, the world was in peace. Giants and Humans lived together, until a certain rebel general decided to become the new King. That general was extremely powerful himself, and had an entire army of rebels, thieves, and renegades with him. The Seven Sages, and the King, with his army, weren't going to let it happen without a fight, and giants decided to help as well which meant it was a war between humans, giants, and rebel humans...

It was a horrible and long war... At first, we won. But it cost us a lot... all giant males died in that war, and there wasn't any male born... Some giantesses theorized that they might breed with humans, creating 1/2 human-giant hybrids, which were assumed to be larger than people but smaller than pure giants. Following that theory, they thought that if those hybrids kept breeding amongst themselves, the human blood would soon dilute until it was a very minimal portion, and these new hybrids wouldn't be much different from original giants. That was the plan to restore our species...

But the rebel general returned, and convinced most of the people against the plan of restoring the giants' species, and with all that support, he managed to kill the King and take over the whole kingdom. As soon as he was crowned, he forbid any attempt to breed between humans and giants. Six of the Seven Sages, the most powerful magicians, rose up in arms once again. But the new King, and his new army branch, the Royal Elites, imprisoned 5 of them. Only the Dark Sage and his people, the dark magicians were left alive, because they escaped..."-

-"My father..."- Blake said

-"No... your grandfather..."-

-"But, if there were 5 imprisoned sages, and the Dark Sage, that makes 6. Where was the 7th?"-

-"It was the Sage of Light. He died during the previous war..."-

-"I see..."- Blake said, and wondered why was he taught light spells being he born as a dark magician...

-"With 5 sages imprisoned, one dead, and the other missing, there was nothing to stop the King, and he banished all giantesses, thus, the plan to restore our species was actually never done... although some men who lost their wives in war accepted to help marrying giantesses..."-

-"Then?"- Blake was already intrigued

-"I thought you wouldn't believe any of this..."-

-"I always wanted to know..."-

-"Well... the King made himself extremely powerful, and by sacrificing the 5 sages. Fire, Water, Wind, Thunder and Earth, he acquired all of their powers, and became nearly immortal by performing another spell... but the spell has a flaw..."-

-"What does that have to do with what happened to you and my father?"-

-"Let me continue. The spell prevented any living species from killing the King, but at the moment it was done, there were no hybrids... None of them had been born yet. Technically, that means only a hybrid can kill that King..."-

-"So?"-

-"Some months later, the first hybrids were born, but much to our surprise, they were all female, and with time, they grew up just like normal giantesses. This raised our hopes because we thought it'd be easier than we thought to restore our species, until the first male hybrids were born... in difference of what we thought, they were human sized, but had inhuman abilities, almost like having a giant's strength compressed into a much smaller body. They were also very fast. Because of their size, they were taken to the villages in the kingdom, to be raised as ordinary people, but soon they realized of their abilities and started calling them Zasshu. Which has a negative meaning by the way..."-

-"And where were you at all this?"-

-"I was about 10 years old by that time..."- Blake's mother laughed -"People started trying to kill the Zasshu, but they all got together, among some dark magicians, and commanded by the Dark Sage, they fought against the King and his army once more... The Zasshu proved to be even more powerful than the Elites, but they were outnumbered, and they all died. Before going to that battle, his wife and his son, who was 12 years old by that time, left, as well as the majority of dark magicians..."-

-"My father..."-

-"Yup. And as you may assume, at some point I fell in love with him, but he wanted to avenge his father's death. He also told me that he was taught that the relationship between different sages was forbidden, because they'd bear a child with both powers..."-

-"I don't get it"-

-"I am the Sage of Light's daughter..."-

-"Whoah, stop right there... this is just too much... my mother is a giant, and now I end up being the son of two sages?"-

-"That's why you are so special..."-

-"Special... not a word I'd use to describe myself..."- Blake said -"I'm more of a freak..."-

-"Don't be so hard to yourself. I hated that about your father..."- She hugged Blake
1521111111111.title: Oh Really?!!

choices: Back to Blake's friends, and their mysterious savior...
15211111111111.content:
-"I thought you'd hate to know how did I fell in love with your father, so I skipped that part. Anyway, when he became 18, and I was 16, he claimed the title of Dark Sage. I knew that it meant he'd go on to fight the King as his own father did. However, he had not yet prepared an attack, and the Elites appeared, they were sent by the King to exterminate all dark magicians, which lived in self imposed exile as well, in difference of the other magicians, who despite losing their sages, still lived in the kingdom, under the King's orders...

They all fought with all their power, but in the end, only your father and your grandmother, who were powerful enough, could defeat them. All other dark magicians were killed, though your father rescued a baby. The last living dark magician other than himself..."-

Blake gasped when he heard this -"Ferdinand... he's the last pure dark magician..."-

-"That's right. After a while, I finally convinced to marry me... and some time later, well, you know..."- She blushed a bit -"9 months later, you were born..."-

-"But... why didn't you keep me here?"-

-"You're the only living male hybrid. There were some bad things going around in here, and it was dangerous... also, as the only male around, you might have suffered a bit... also, carrying the blood of 2 Sages would be taboo and it was known that your father was the Dark Sage, and my father was the last Light Sage... you could have been executed..."-

-"...So, that's what Grandma meant..."- Blake now understood -"She said people would try to kill us for being dark magicians... but she always remarked that I'd be in danger..."-

-"Your father's mother has more than all my respect. She took a responsibility that was not hers, and raised you, despite it was my obligation..."-

Blake stood there. It had just been revealed to him that his mother was alive, though she was a giantess.. also that he has both the powers of the light and dark sages... and that his always unusual strength and speed were caused because of him being the only living male giantess-human hybrid. Blake even forgot why he came to this place in the first place, until it rang in his head. But first there was something he wanted to ask

-"Uhm... what's your name? It's a bit weird that you told me that you're my mother but didn't tell me your name..."-

-"Whoops... I'm sorry. My name is Lith. But I don't mind if you call me 'mom'..."-

-"It's too soon for that..."- Blake replied, Lith saddened a bit, but she knew she was asking for too much, she got the chance to see her son grown up, and at least he didn't seem to hate her...

-"You need to be healed..."- Lith said to him

-"Are you going to start with that stuff? Meh... if you're the current sage of light, why don't you do a spell or something?"-

-"Because I want to... have a last chance of being a mom... I know I failed at it..."-

Blake was about to say something like "It doesn't matter anymore" But he realized that he'd hurt her feelings, more than they already seem to be... also, his internal instinct was also keeping him to do so, telling him without words, that this giant woman was his mother. Despite Blake showed very little emotion himself, he was perfectly capable of sensing others' emotions. His thoughts were interrupted again when Lith hugged him tightly again, and she said

-"I thought you'd never learn who you really are, and that I would never see you... I missed you a lot..."-

Time later...

She had bandaged Blake's whole body, and before that, she had put some paste made of medicinal herbs. Blake was not saying anything just because he felt that Lith really wanted to be a mother at least for once. Then, while she was cooking something, she asked Blake

-"Now tell me about you... what happened? I only raised you a year before your grandmother took you with her. How did you end here?"-

-"I can't tell some things yet... but, I've had to go on my own for over half of my life. I formed a mercenary squad, and we wandered, went anywhere we had a job, and stayed for three years at a nice place* called Kildevar..."-

-"Kildevar? Does that place still exist?"- Lith stopped cooking for a moment

-"You know Kildevar?"-

-"That's where the dark magicians used to live, but when your father took me there, it was a beautiful landscape, uninhabited..."-

-"Now it's a village. I guess things changed in 17 years..."- Blake said

-"How did you end up here?"-

-"You'll be hysterical if I tell you..."-

-"C'mon. I'm not that type of woman"- Lith turned around and faced Blake, who was resting on the table

-"Just some days ago, I was with my friends, hanging out at the forest, we had a day off, when suddenly some strange guys called the Sand Bandits attacked us, we fought back but we lost... I lost consciousness... and when I woke up again, they were selling me as a slave..."-

-"Here?"- Lith was a bit confused, but Blake was relieved that she didn't went hysterical as he had predicted

-"Yeah. They sold me to some crazy girls at some sort of castle... I had to do some crazy things to escape from that hellish place, and I ended up here because I was going as fast as possible to get away from them..."- Blake lied about that, because he suspected that if his mother knew he threatened a princess, and ran off, she might be mad at him...

-"The castle? Why would they want a slave?"-

-"I. don't. know. "- Blake said those words separately, and somewhat lied, he knew what they really wanted him for, but he wasn't going to tell anyone that.

-"Well, you're safe here. To everyone, I'm just a common woman, a bit lonely but nothing unusual. I doubt the royalty is going to search for anything here"-

-"Thanks"- Was Blake's only answer, and despite he was now relieved, Lith kept wondering why would the castle giantesses buy a human slave (Umm... yeah, Blake's relative naivety comes from her.. though hers is worse...)

Some more minutes later, the food was ready. Lith made a nice vegetable soup (There aren't enough large animals to get meat from, so pretty much all giantess eat vegetables and fruits only. Though the royal family used to eat cows as well...). She even had a very small (to her) bowl and other stuff such as spoons, which were from the time she was married to James (Blake's father)

To Blake it was very strange, he used to eat fruits from trees, and cooked meat from animals he hunt himself. He had never had a vegetable soup for a meal, but he was hungry (he didn't eat for 2 days) and tried it... it turned out to be really good. Lith noticed that he was enjoying it

-"Your father loved this soup"-

-"It's really good"- Blake finished in less than 5 minutes

-"Wow, you were really hungry..."-

-"I don't know for how long I didn't eat. I only know it was a long time, while those bandits brought me here..."-

-"Then here you go"- Lith served him another bowl of soup (her agility at using tiny things comes from the time her husband was alive)

Blake started to eat the soup, when they heard that someone was knocking the door...
15211111111111.title: She tells him more...

152111111111111.content:
While Blake was having his adventure, the gang was resting up for theirs. Their savior hadn't told his name or removed his cloak since returning. He was about twenty voice-wise and had a sister of about 18. In the first 3 days, nothing had happened except for food and rest. They sat at the basement if the inn, eating dinner when the man's sister Sarah came down. Ferdinand and Gustave had both been flirting with her, something to due with her nice body and other things as well. She was kind and modest, even denying offers of marriage from nobles due to their personality.

"Can one of you help me grab a crate of wine from the cellar?" Ferdinand jumped up and said

"Allow me milady." The man shook his head.

"I'll be back in a few minutes. You guys dig in before it gets cold." he leaves and begins sharpening weapons and gathering gold to get arrows crafted. He walls out about ten minutes later and all are back.

"I know all of you want Blake back. Not only that, but I know why the royal army can't help. I want to-""How do you know all this?!" Ayrton said, angered and surprised.

"I have connections. They let me know." He said. The table all seemed angry and scared for their friend.

"I can't tell you who my connections are. They would be unhappy." Now they were outraged.

"Also why do you hide behind your hood?!" Ayrton said as he tried to grab the hood. The man caught his hand and threw him down with one arm.

"You NEVER try to lift my hood. IS THIS UNDERSTOOD!?" All were silent as he had gone from their generous savior to an enraged person who clearly had the potential to take them on in a fight. They nod and he walks to his room and slams the door. Sarah rushed down.

"What happened? I heard yelling." Ferdinand only said "It was nothing." But he thought 'He really got upset because of the hood, just like Blake'
152111111111111.title: Confrontation

1521111111111111.content:
Back to Blake and Lith...

Blake was eating his second bowl of soup and Lith went to see who was knocking the door. She glanced through the window and saw Karina, a servant of the royal family, and the current counselor (as her mother was the royal family's counselor, but died by disease), in other words, she was running the royalty's businesses until the princess became a queen. Lith acted groggy, as if she just woke up

-"Oh, Karina, what's the reason of your visit?"-

-"We lost something very important... and we think he might be somewhere near here"-

'Blake was not lying...' Lith thought, and crossing her arms, asked -"What could have been so important?"-

Karina looked around, then she whispered to her -"We acquired a human male. He's going to be the Princess' birthday gift..."-

Lith couldn't help but scowl at that, but she pretended not to believe her, and asked -"How did you get a human to come here?"-

-"We had a deal with the Sand Bandits, since they operate outside the human kingdom's law, and selling slaves is their specialty. We asked for a young and strong one, but it seems he was a bit too strong. He was heavily damaged yet he was able to escape..."-

-"Well, I have seen no- "- Lith was interrupted by Claire, who said loudly

-"He's inside!!"-

-"What?!!"- Karina rushed inside the house, but Lith was faster and quickly grabbed Blake, who had just finished eating, and had no idea of what was going on -"Lith. I have no time for games. Hand over that human, it's an order from the royal family..."-

-"No"- Lith said firmly -"He doesn't belong to you. And what's more, this boy is MY son..."- Karina could almost feel the fire in Lith's green eyes, but couldn't allow that to stop her, and sighed

-"It's not what you think. The Princess will turn 18 in a week, and he is to be married to her..."-

-"WHAT?!!"- Blake screamed, inside Lith's fist

-"Really?"- Lith asked, though no longer in an angry tone. Karina nodded in response. And Lith opened her hand and brought Blake near her face

-"You said they bought you as a slave"-

-"What else could it be?! Normal people isn't sold!!"-

-"It's sorta of a tradition... human men used to pay a certain amount of money to the bride's parents or the person responsible of her... given that here, there are very few men, it changed to the bride's family paying some money to the groom's family... But still, and under our own laws, it was illegal to pay those bandits..."- Lith said, and while Blake was getting scared, her last phrase relieved him

-"Wait a minute... how is it possible... he's your son?!"-

-"Yup"- Lith replied

-"How's that possible?! Everyone knows all Zasshu died fighting the King along the penultimate Dark Sage... They even taught that at schools!!"-

-"That's why I kept him secret, and was raised among human people..."- Lith added

-"This is so incredible. And I thought I had only bought a ordinary human..."- Karina seemed excited, and Blake said

-"I'm not yours anymore!!"-

-" *Sigh* I've already paid a lot for him, and he's really worth it. What do you think? Do you agree to give your consent for him to marry the Princess?"-

-"W-What?!!"- Blake asked, sensing the imminent danger

-"Are you serious?"- Lith asked, and sounded enthusiastic about the idea

-"Lith, I don't want to make you feel guilty, but for THIS ONCE, protect me!! don't give me back to that spoiled brat!!"- Blake hugged her cheek in desperation, and added -"Please, I'm too young to have my life ruined... there are so many things I want to do, I want to go back with my friends, to keep doing mercenary jobs, to travel around the world, to hang out with no worries, please!! Don't ruin my life a second time..."-

Lith had laughed at Blake's desperation until she heard he was serious, and the words "Don't ruin my life a second time" fell heavily on her heart. Blake was clinging to her cheek like she was about to drop him from a cliff, and her expression changed to a worried one

-"I'm sorry. But I'm afraid I can't give my consent... he really looks scared..."- Lith paused, then she asked -"What did the Princess do to him to cause him to be like this?"-

Karina gasped at that question, and answered -"NOTHING!! The Princess has done nothing to him, he was the one who hurt himself attempting to escape, he dismayed and was bleeding..."-

Lith took Blake with her fingers and stared at him seriously -"Is that true?"-

-"She hasn't done anything YET!!. I was unjustly captured and sold against my own will, and when the other servant explained me what was I there for, I had to escape!!"-

-"You also threatened the Princess' life, and that's a serious crime..."- Karina crossed her arms

-"Blake..."- Lith sounded disappointed at her son

-"If you just let me go, it wouldn't have happened. Tell me how much did you pay for me and I'll pay you back every single coin!!"- Blake answered to Karina, and she said

-"Even if you paid the money back, that doesn't help us. The money can't marry the princess, nor save the royal family from dying out."-

-"Then get someone else to do it..."- Blake was growing angrier, and started to check his surroundings to pull off another escape. Lith said to him

-"You're being mean..."-

-"MEAN?!! Is it mean to refuse a forced marriage?!!"- Blake was almost out of his mind

-"Yes, it is. They're paying money for YOU. And it's the Princess we're talking about. You would no longer to wander around and constantly doing mercenary jobs for little payment..."-

-"ACTUALLY I like that lifestyle!! I've lived like that for 8 years!! You have no right to force me to do this..."- Blake said -"And there's no way in hell I'm marrying a girl I don't know, let alone one many times my size... when she gets angry at me for no reason she can just crush me as easily as crushing a bug. And nobody will care, of course, because the only one who cares about me is myself!!"- Blake didn't realize but those words hurt Lith a little.

-"It's normal to be afraid. Your father was afraid of me when we were younger... It's easier for us to accept the idea of loving a being smaller than ourselves..."-

-"Because you aren't the one who can die easily..."- Blake was examining his possible escape routes in the mean time, though he couldn't believe his mother had just found him and wanted to give him to that princess...

-"You wouldn't be crushed easily. Your body is way stronger than a normal human's... And the Princess is a shy girl. I doubt she'd dare to do something wrong to you... specially after your threat..."- Lith remarked that with a more serious tone

-"I don't care!! I have no reason to marry her!!"- Lith's expression changed and brought Blake closer to her mouth, and whispered

-"There's another girl, isn't it?"- Then she brought him closer to her ear

-"What makes you think there's one?!"- Blake asked angrily

-"Your persistence on not getting married..."-

-"I don't want to marry anyone!! I just want to live my freaking life until I die by old age..."-

-"Don't you feel lonely?"-

-"I've been always alone. You said it, I'm a freaking hybrid. But I can live with that. What I can't live with is to be married to a giant girl for the rest of my life"-

Lith's expression saddened, and sighed, saying -"Blake. I'm afraid you have a lot of things yet to learn. Karina, I give my total consent about the marriage..."-

Blake felt like it was the end of the world, what was more, the end of his world, of life as he knew it. And he wasn't going to let it go without a fight. Remembering that he had eaten, and wasn't restricted by his clothes' weight, he decided to quickly, open Lith's hand, and dashed away, he muttered

-"You really disappointed me. I'd have preferred not to know who was my mother... Just to find that is a woman capable of selling her son just because of becoming part of the royal family..."-

Blake dashed away but bounced from what he recognized as a light shield, which appeared in front of him. He fell to the floor and heard Lith

-"I told you..."- She said, referring to her being the daughter of the Sage of Light (technically the next sage, but she never claimed the title)

-"I will not give up"- Blake said, and got up, but Lith snapped her fingers, and he fell unconscious. She picked him up, and whispered -"Blake, I know you already hate me for this, but I want you to see through appearances..."-

Then she handed him to Karina, though rejected the money she offered in exchange...
