15211111111111111.content:
There the gang sat, a cliff over looking the entire bandit village. By village, they basically meant stronghold. There were 40 foot stone walls surrounding it, with towers holding guards all around. The gang stood at the ready to charge and the man just stood there.

"We can't send more than one of us in until one of us triggers the alarm. I'll go in. If I'm in trouble I'll shoot this firework and you guys come in. If it doesn't fire and I'm nit back in three hours, I'm dead. Understand?"

They all nodded or mumbled a yes and he rappelled down the cliff. Around his waist, a belt of exactly 24 throwing knives, strapped to his thigh a short-sword, and a bow with a quiver of arrows across his back. From there they watched as he fired an arrow and the shadow of a guard disappeared. He grappled up and climbed the sheer wall. The man was now sneaking along behind a guard and then quickly stabbed him in the spine and covered his mouth silencing anything he might say. The same fate followed for each lookout. He climbed down and walked to the fort in the center of the town unhindered.

Two guards attempted to block his way and he apologized about not having an appointment and walked away. He snuck around, stabbing one and throwing the knife into the other's neck. He retrieved it and walked in.

He walked in and a guard at the desk said "Appointment?" he stared at him before the reply of "I am here to check in on a search I started. My name is Ajax." the guard began scanning his ledger and didn't see the sword that severed his neck. He walked straight into the leader's room, a throne room furnished by crimes that were punished by death from the true throne room.

"Sir. I humbly ask you give me something." the fake king glared at him and said

"What do you want?"

"Tell me where you sent the boy that led the mercenaries." The king laughed.

"He was a secret. Guards! Kill this man, don't spare him any pain!" 12 guards flooded the room armed with assorted melée weapons.

"Let me guess. These are the grunts who don't know any magic, except for the sergeant over there?" they began to close in but the man flicked knives from his belt taking three down in a few seconds. The others closed in, and he jumped over one and put an arrow through the top of his head. With 8 survivors, they began to charge him. He parried a few and killed all but the sergeant, who stood with his arms crossed.

-"Earth Battle Spell #41: Earthen Armor..."- He muttered and a solid rock armor formed around him.

"Let's do this!"

152111111111111111.title: Fight!

1521111111111111111.content:
The morning after...

Blake woke up, chained from head to toe, and inside two cages, despite this, he was still laying in a bowl with medicinal water. He noticed that his sword was no longer in the room 'I guess they won't allow me to be armed anymore...' However, despite Blake usually fought using his sword, he was very strong without it. And he started struggling to break free. The chains were made of solid iron, and Blake might have broken up to four, but he was completely enveloped in chains, save for his head and feet.

He remembered that awakening his dark powers enhanced all his capabilities, and again, he realized he was not wearing his silver chain and tag (It's been in his pocket so far, as well as the metal rings that make his clothes heavy). So, he concentrated, trying to focus his power. A reddish black aura surrounded him, and the chains started to crack. Blake felt that powering up was quickly draining his energy and stopped. He tried to struggle and managed to break some, but he was still tied, he had limited mobility in his legs and arms.

'Better than nothing' Blake could free his left arm after another struggle, and started to punch the cage. He had noticed that the so called princess was watching him, but he didn't pay attention to her. He shot a golden beam through the cage's padlock, and could open the cage. The princess stood up, and he thought 'This is not good... she'll have her damn servants to catch me again...' She was walking slowly toward him, and he muttered

-"I've had it with this..."- He broke all his chains in anger and dashed toward her. She instinctively covered her stomach, but Blake disappeared and reappeared next to her face, and punched her in the right cheek with all his anger. Quickly, he disappeared again, and reappeared on the other side, hitting her left cheek as well. Then he dashed downward and punched her in the stomach several times, now uncovered, after the punches, he kicked her. The hit was so powerful that knocked her backward, and fell to the floor. Blake landed a few feet from her, and walked toward her, charging a golden beam in his right hand

-"I am sick of you!! You're the cause I'm held here!! I am just here to be used so you be come the Queen!! Well, guess what?! I'm NOT doing it!!"- Blake noticed her right hand moving toward him and almost by reflex fired his golden light ball at it, causing a small burn. Strangely, she didn't scream. Blake kept walking toward her face, and added

-"You bought the wrong guy to be a slave... I guess you don't know how it feels because EVERYONE serves YOU!! Well, I'll give you a taste of what happens when you enslave someone... "- Blake aimed his right hand at her face, holding his right wrist with his left hand. Just then he noticed that she was silently crying. Also, that no matter what he did, she could have screamed at any moment and he'd be really screwed...

Blake cancelled the energy he was charging, and muttered -"What am I doing? Have I really sunk so low?"- Karina's words from the previous day rang inside his head "NOTHING!! The princess has done nothing to him!!" 'Technically, she's right... what the crowd said that day, years ago, was true, in the end, I'm just a monster...'

And speaking of the princess, she was still crying in silence, and didn't move, fearing another wound. Her right hand had a small burn, but it hurt a lot, and she couldn't even rub the wound, nor wipe her tears. She noticed Blake turning around (no longer facing her), saying

-"I have nothing to say in my defense. You were the wrong target for me to take my rage out on..."- Still without looking, he aimed his hand toward her, and muttered

-"Shine, sun's gentle glow, 10 days of spring, heal, stop the bleeding, close the wounds with nature's touch..."- Pale golden light illuminated the princess, and her wounds started to heal, and also, her pain disappeared, and it was replaced by a comfortable warm feeling. Because of her size, It took a while for Blake to heal her, and when he was done, he fell to his knees, tired. He said

-"You have all the right to hit me, I won't block..."-

-"N-no... I don't want to hurt you..."- She said, she was no longer crying, but her voice still faltered

-"It's not that difficult. Just stand up, put your foot above me and let it go... just as easy as a bug..."- Blake said -"If I can't escape, at least help me to end this... If you say you killed me because I tried to kill you, they won't be mad at you..."-

-"I don't want to kill you..."- She said, and slowly stood up -"I tried to stop you because everyone is alert, and if you leave this room they might hurt you..."-

'And I shot a light ball at her hand for that... I'll never learn... If I never get out of here, one day she'll take revenge no matter what she says, and what's worse, is that I'll deserve it...'

-"I know it's cruel to keep you here against your will..."- She added, and Blake opened his eyes wide. She was the last person he'd expect sympathy from, which made Blake feel worse about what he just did.

-"Can't you do anything about it?"- Blake asked, and the princess could tell he was being honest. She sighed and denied with her head, and answered

-"I can't. Karina is in charge until I marry someone..."- She could heard Blake's grunt, because he was the one she'd marry to...

-"What if you say you don't want me? That you want someone else?"- Blake said, and the princess could notice that he really wanted to escape more than anything else.

-"I don't know... I'll try..."- She said, and walked out of her room, and closed the door. Karina immediately went to talk to her

-"Your Majesty, is something wrong?"-

-"Uhm... well... I... I'd like to ask you something..."-

-"What is it, Majesty?"-

-"What if... What if I... I mean... I-I don't want to marry the human you bought... Can't you get other one?"-

-"I knew this would happen!! That little bastard..."- Karina cracked her knuckles, and was about to rush into the princess' room, but the princess stopped her

-"It's not for that!!! I... I think we shouldn't keep here... it's cruel... he's a person... and he doesn't want to do this..."-

-"It's not cruel... it'd be cruel if we kept him with no food nor water, and to be killed for something. He's been fed and healed here, and he's to marry you. I don't see anything wrong with that..."-

-"But it's against his will... would you marry someone by force?"- The princess asked and had her index fingers tented together

-"If I was paid for, I'd have to. It's the tradition..."- Karina replied sternly

-"But... What if I want...someone else?"-

-" *Sigh* If he were a simple human, I'd give him to someone else, he's already bought... Maybe Claire would be interested, I've seen how she looked at him..."-

-"If he were? W-what does that mean?"- The princess was really confused

-"It's as I said, if he were, I'd give him to someone else... HOWEVER..."-

-"H-however?"-

-"I can't lie to you, Majesty... I can't give him to anyone else. He was too expensive, and is a really rare type of male..."-

-"What does that mean?"- The princess asked, and this time, she didn't stutter or pause in mid-sentence

-"He's the only Zasshu alive..."-

-"Zasshu?"-

-"You learned about them when yo were taught History... Zasshu, is a human name for the hybrid males, born from a human male and a giantess..."- Karina paused, ten she said -"They are exceptionally strong, far more than almost any human... and the best type to marry a giantess. You wouldn't have to worry much about crushing him by accident. He wouldn't die... That's why I requested a strong human, I never expected to find a hybrid..."-

-"He... he's a hybrid?! That means... his mother must be a giantess..."-

-"Yeah. It's Lith, a woman that lives nearly outside the village. I don't know much more... But she gave her consent to marry YOU. And she was who informed me that it was her son whom we bought..."-

-"And she agreed?"- The princess was confused

-"Of course. Any giantess with a son would say 'Yes' if offered to have him marrying a princess..."-

-"Uh..."-

-"I'm sorry, but that's the truth... and for the reasons I told you, I can't give him to anyone else. The chances to find another one are practically none..."-

-"Uhm... well... thanks..."- The princess went back to her room. Karina sighed, and thought 'I know perfectly that he told her to act as if she disdained him... I know the princess better... He really doesn't like to be here, but I can't let go such a chance... I wonder why the princess actually bothered to do this?'

-"Hmm... maybe she likes him already..."- Karina muttered, and giggled at her thoughts
1521111111111111111.title: Blake questions his actions...

15211111111111111111.content:
Back to the princess' room...

-"What happened?"- Blake asked, having a bit of hope, but the princess was looking down, and said

-"I'm sorry. They won't let me to get someone else... She said that because you're special (She remembered that 'Zasshu' was a name with a negative meaning) she can't let you go..."-

-"Thanks a lot, Lith..."- Blake muttered, then, when her words hit him in the head, and he asked -"What do you mean with special?"- Blake thought 'God. I reall hope she doesn't know I'm a hybrid... that might mean trouble for me...'

-"Karina said nothing else. You tell me..."- The princess did a bold move with that

-"Uhm... I don't know..."- Blake lied

-"Really?"-

-"Why would you want to know?"-

-"Because we have nothing else to do..."-

-"In that case, I'll go back to sleep..."- Blake went back to the bowl and laid on its bottom, which still had medicinal water. But the princess walked near the bowl, and said

-"M-maybe... if I knew...I might make something up...to help you..."- She said, again, boldly but shyly at the same time

Blake raised an eyebrow 'I thought this girl was just shy and dumb... it seems she's shrewder than I thought...' But he had seen the catch, and said

-"What would change if you knew more about me?"- This caught her off-guard, and blushed a lot, then, she kept thinking, and got nothing...

-"I knew it. It wouldn't help. It'd just dig deeper into my grave..."- Blake said, and closed his eyes, but muttered -"Goddammit!! If I were a normal human I'd be released from this hell!!"-

-"Actually, no..."- The princess had heard his 'confession'

-"Huh?!! You heard me?!!"- Blake was snapped out of his thoughts

-"Karina would only release you from marrying me..."- She blushed more when saying that -"But because you cost a lot, she'd give you to someone else... and it's likely she'd give you to Claire..."-

-"Huh?!!"- Blake's eyes opened wide, and his imagination tortured him more... Instead of the princess, Claire getting him... she already seemed to be weird, and acted weird toward him, and since she told him what he was there for, she imagined Claire whispering to him something like 'Well, well, well... So, you rejected the princess? That's too bad... because I'm going to do to you what she won't!!'

-"NO!!!"- Blake screamed, then he got back to reality, and noticed the princess staring at him, a bit confused by his scream -"That never happened... It was just a day-nightmare..."-

The princess didn't really know, but she assumed Blake was afraid of Claire. Then, Blake sighed

-"I have no choice then..."- He sighed again -"I'm stuck here, I'm going to be married by force... can this be worse?!!"- He sighed a third time -"I'll just go back to sleep. This is too depressing..."-

The princess stared at him, and felt bad for him. He really hated the idea of being married to her, and she couldn't blame him, she knew that someone that size would be more than scared if forced to marry someone much larger. Though what Karina told her intrigued her, he was the son of a giantess and a man, but obviously, he was raised as a human.... the only hybrid who did not die in that fight against the King, as it was said in the books.

-"Will you sleep for 3 days?"- She asked, and sounded so sincere and naive Blake replied

-"You didn't have to remind me of how long I have left... But... yeah, if I can't escape, I can't do anything, so, I'll just sleep. Wake me up when it's my death's day..."-

-"Y...y-you aren't going to... to die..."-

-"Killing my freedom is just as bad..."- 'This is so low... I'm just used as a tool...' Blake thought while he closed his eyes, and tried to sleep, though he couldn't as he just woke up, but he didn't want to spend time with the princess. That was just worse, and Blake was starting to realize that he was given to the princess with that purpose... them alone, start to spend time, and get used to each other before marriage 'That's not going to work. I'm smart enough not to fall, specially if I'm aware of the trick...'

Blake knew this because in some of the villages he worked, there were similar customs. The man and the woman that were to be married usually were given a certain amount of time to get to know each other. 'Trying to soften the damage... but it's already done...' Blake thought. He didn't realize that the princess knew he wasn't sleeping, and heard her

-"What's your name?"-

-"Does it matter? I'm nothing to you. I'm just your ticket to become a queen..."-

The princess gasped, she didn't like the way he was depicting her. She felt hurt by this, and said, saddened

-"W-why do you say that?"-

-"Because it's the truth..."-

-"But...how can you say I think like that?"-

-"I don't care. You don't care either. Nobody cares. Legally, I'm nothing. Enough said..."-

-"I care... if we're going to be married at least I want to know my husband's name..."- The princess blushed very much after she said that

-"Huh...what?!"- Blake blinked twice, and sat up -"H...h-husband?!!"- Blake was now the one stuttering -"You aren't taking this seriously, are you?!!"-

-"I'm not..."- She replied

-"Phew!!"- Blake was relieved

-"But I had a point..."-

-"Whatever..."- Blake said -"I don't know what's so special about knowing my name, so I'll tell you and you'll stop annoying me, okay?"-

The princess stared at him in silence, and Blake knew it was a 'no'. She wanted to spend the time with him, since they were pretty much enclosed there except for things as eating or taking a bath, which Blake hoped it was not going to be done together.

-"My name is Blake... are you happy now 'Princess' ?"- Blake said the last word sarcastically, but the princess took the chance to reply

-"You don't have to call me that"-

-"I honestly don't care. I won't be saying your name too often, whatever it is... unless that's a keyword to get me out of here..."- Blake laid back on the bowl's bottom, his arms were submerged in the medicinal water.

-"My name is Joana..."-

-"...So?"-

-"You told me your name, I told you mine..."- She answered happily, with a n_n face

-"I still don't care. Nothing you can do will lessen the fact I'm going to be forced to marry you... and that I can kiss goodbye my good old life..."- Blake's mood wouldn't change

-"What did you do before being... errm... 'caught' ?"-

-"Seriously, don't you have anything else to do?"-

-"Nope. Karina ordered yesterday that we'd spend as much time as possible together..."-

-"WHAT?!!"-

-"You were brought back, and unconscious..."-

Blake slapped his forehead, and said

-"Don't you have any book to read... or something? A village to destroy... someone else's life to ruin?"- Blake was trying hard to hurt her with words so she'd shut up, but it was only saddening her

-"You know... this is not my fault..."- Tears started to form in Joana's eyes -"I didn't tell them to buy me a human... nor to capture and force one to come here..."- She was on the verge of tears

-" *Sigh* I guess you're right... It's Karina's fault..."-

-"It isn't her fault either... My mother told hers to make sure I was married by when I turned 18... and since she also died, Karina was told to carry that order..."-

-"She still had the option of NOT to...wait a minute... 18?!!"-

-"Yeah, why?"- Joana asked

-"This is worse than I thought..."-

-"Why?"-

-"I'm 17..."-

-"So?"-

-"I have never seen a man marrying a woman older than him... and since I'm 17, I'm not an adult according to the king's law... THAT'S IT!! This will get me out of this, now what I need is to- "- Blake was interrupted by Joana

-"Uhm, Blake... we're not in the human kingdom... and here, the law states that a guy 16 years old is old enough to be married... Formerly the age was 14, but they changed it because some giantesses felt wrong with someone so young..."- Joana said

-"How do you know that?"-

-"I've been taught many different things during my life... law was one of them..."-

-"I guess..."- Blake said, his bubble of hope was burst once again...

-"I'm sorry..."- Joana said, trying to comfort him

-"It's alright. I guess it serves me right..."-

-"Why?"-

-"It's a long story. To make it short, my entire life is product of a mistake... so, I guess I deserve this, to be miserable until I die..."- Blake said -"But what I hate is that my friends ended up paying for my sins too..."-

-"What happened to them?"-

-"You don't know them... and as I said, it's a long story..."-

-"I'd like to hear it. We have time..."-

-"Oh God..."- Blake said 'Seriously, I wonder how are my friends doing... They must have been sold as slaves, but it can't be as bad as this... What would they be doing now?' He thought...
15211111111111111111.title: The princess wants to spend time with Blake...

152111111111111111111.content:
"Come on!" The man yelled as he looked the place over.

"The place is so well guarded and made that there's no way we can get in, it's a suicide mission!" He sat around with Blake's friends as they ate, he continued looking at the blue prints until getting very angry.

"The village isn't all that hard to get to and through, but for the castle, we'd need an army." He continued looking down and grinned a bit.

"Or a nice diversion. He looked the four of them over.

"Three of you will start a diversion. I'll supply you with ten kegs of gunpowder, that ought to do the job. Then, while you run one of you comes with me and we find Blake. I'll let you decide who does what." This man had basically taken the role of Blake in his absence. After the hood incident they seemed to question what was under his hood, as it was always pitched black, even when the light shined into it. It was something people called an imbued hood. It would hide the wearer's face no matter what. This was mainly used by infamous criminals. What was so terrible his face couldn't be seen?
152111111111111111111.title: Meanwhile

choices: They have a ways to go, will they make it in time?
1521111111111111111111.content:
Ferdinand stood up and said

"I'm coming with you." The rest agreed. They all stored their stuff in the carriage and set off. On the road a few highwaymen stopped them.

"100 coins for each of your lives." The man smiled and got out holding a bag with a few knives in it. He moved so fast if was as if the knife appeared in his throat. When the man's sword came level with the other's throat, he simply said,

"Leave or die, your choice." Apparently not wanting death the bandit left. When he got back in and started the horses going again, he simply said,

"The dead one had killed many. The other is not stained by blood." They all looked at him and began to wonder more and more. Who was the man who could kill so easily without any magic and could tell who has killed before? Ayrton spoke their thoughts.

"Who are you? At least tell us your name!"

The man looked back, his face invisible under the hood, and said

"Be patient. I'll show you when the time is right. The ride continued peacefully for the next day until the carriage's wheel broke off.

"I'll pull into this village and get it fixed. It'll be the rest of the day, so make yourselves at home." he threw each a small pouch of coins. These'll get you the food and any trinkets you may want. If I see any for my sister I will hit you in the face Ferdinand. Meet back here at sunset."

They all jumped out of the carriage. The man went to talk to the man inside the village's blacksmith shop. The rest went on to do a few things. Ferdinand went to see what he could learn of the giantesses at he local library. The others took some money for food and herbs for healing. Others went to train very hard to increase their strength and speed, just in case.

The man simply waited and watched the repairs get done. He stayed until he saw the singed and shattered part. He got up to leave and walked along the path they took seeing a creature of relation to a dragon, minus wings and more resembles a crocodile. It began to breathe fire at the man and he dove away. They went into close combat and the man gouged out an eye, but took a semi-deep slash across the chest.

It opened it's mouth to inhale and the man formed an ice crystal, shifted lodged into it's throat. The monster began choking. The man jumped into the air and brought his sword down with huge power, beheading it. He brought a section of its tail, which was an orange patch. When he arrived at the blacksmith, the carriage was nearly finished, and the sun was on its decent. He handed the blacksmith the orange patch and his eyes widened.

"Sell it to the healer. Ought to be more than enough to cover the cost." The gang arrived back, slightly wiser, stronger or prepared than they were before.
1521111111111111111111.title: The decision

15211111111111111111111.content:
After another day's travel they saw the village in the distance. The man looked up at the castle.

"We need two days to check the watches. If they change, we'll wait a month. If not we have a chance to break in after three nights." Sadly, the next two nights went right, but then a scramble began for something big. In their camp they could see the village with a telescope but were nearly invisible from elsewhere.

"Looks like a celebration. Sorry guys, we need to wait a little while and-" there was a rumble behind them. In their spot, there was nowhere to go only to stand and wait. Soon, two giantesses came up to the cliff. One was talking to the other.

"Yeah, it has the best view of the town, this should calm your nerves. I know it helped me..." she trailed off when she saw the gang standing there, nowhere to go but through them or jumping off the cliff. Soon they both were right next to them. For once they all looked to the man and he didn't do anything. They looked over and saw that there was a chain leading behind the brown haired girl. The black haired girl looked at them curiously. Soon, the thing on the chain got close enough that they could all tell what it was. Blake. The man snapped out of his trance.

"I'll grab Blake, you keep the other one busy." He pulled out his shortsword and started cautiously moving in. They now looked angry. The black haired girl spoke up.

"Do you know who you're threatening? That is the soon-to-be queen!" The man ignored her and continued. Joana did nothing and let him continue.

"Do something, he's going to hurt you!" the black haired girl said. Neither tried to attack and the black haired girl was actually not wanting to do any fighting, just smashed her foot down near the man. He jumped away, but if his face were visible, a rare look of fear would have been seen on his face.

"Release your prisoner. We just want him." The man said, standing up and walking towards Joana.

"We won't have to fight. Just release him and we can all go our separate ways." finally the black haired one got fed up with it and said.

"Power of light, bind the foe, spare his life and tie the ropes" the entire group was binder in golden glowing ropes, except Tabitha, who managed to escape them. They both began to reach down for them and as the man was picked up you could clearly see him tense in fear. Joana whispered that she wasn't going to hurt him but the struggling didn't stop. She eventually calmed him down enough to grab the others. They were brought into the castle and then hit with a strange gas, as darkness approached they knew that terrible luck had just gotten them killed through a gas chamber.
15211111111111111111111.title: They have a ways to go, will they make it in time?

choices: Blake asks the messenger if the duke can nullify the forced marriage...
152111111111111111111111.content:
2 days earlier...

After several minutes of nagging, Blake decided to tell Joana a bit about him

-"What do I have to do to stop this madness?!!"-

-"Tell me your story..."- She said in a cute way, though Blake didn't care

-"Not a big deal. I was a mercenary, got caught, and I'm here. THE END..."- Blake said, and Joana stared at him, confused

-"What does a mercenary do?"-

-"Mercenaries work for money. They are paid for doing a certain thing, it varies. Some of them do dirty works like killing people..."-

-"Uh... so... you?"-

-"I worked with my friends as a mercenary squad, but we didn't do such jobs, I mean, we were paid to catch thieves, help people, or rescue kidnapped people, or to fight wild beasts... We never killed innocent people..."-

-"Isn't that the same as soldiers?"-

-"Nope. We depend only on ourselves, and when we aren't needed anymore we go to somewhere else. Where? We never know. It has something special to live like that, never know what's next, and-WAIT!! You tricked me!!"- Blake realized, too late. Joana giggled

-"But... don't you miss your home?"- She asked, back to a more serious mood. When she asked him that, images from his early life flashed in his mind. He couldn't help but clench his fists.

-"I don't want to talk about it.."-

-"Huh?! Were you banished or something?"-

-"I have NO home... That's why I have no problem with traveling, I don't have a home to return to... nothing awaits for me, and I don't care. I like to live like that..."-

-"Uh..."- Joana didn't really know what to say, but could sense a very faint sadness in Blake's words. However, she picked him up and hugged him. Blake tried to push her away but given the physical difference, Blake was unawarely pushing her breast, which made her giggle. Blake then realized and blushed heavily, and asked both angry and embarrassed

-"W-w-what was that for?!!"-

-"I felt like it... You need some affection..."- Joana still had him standing on her palm (Blake was barely the size of her pinky finger)

Blake blushed even more, and angrier, said

-"I don't need pity from anyone!! W-Who d-do y-you think you are?!!!"-

Joana giggled at his reaction, thinking 'He acts as he had never been hugged been by a girl before...' Then she realized, and giggled more, and answered

-"Your future wife..."-

-"GAAAHHHH!!"- Blake nearly fainted -"Don't do that EVER again!!!"-

Joana giggled and had a n.n face while Blake was still blushing like mad, and thought 'Calm down!! Calm down!! How is it possible I feel embarrassed... it's not like it felt good or something... NO!! It can't feel good!! It's not even natural... she's a giant!! Despite I'm a hybrid I'm still MOSTLY human!!'

-"Why are you so scared of it?"- Joana asked sweetly

-"It scares me that you're beginning to take it seriously... I'm not going to be your...husband..."- Blake blushed even more -"...Nor anything like that!! I'll just play along with this farce, I'm not going to be married to you for real..."-

-"It is real..."-

-"Stop it!!!"- Blake said, and tried to calm himself -"You're a giant, I am a human... don't you see something NOT matching?!!"-

-"Well, we both have two eyes, two ears, hair on the head..."- Joana started petting Blake's head while saying that

-"But you're huge!! I'm the size of your fingers!!"- Blake was still exasperated

-"You look cute to me..."- Joana blushed almost as much as Blake was, and now, he nearly fainted, as almost all the blood of his body went to his head. She giggled at his reaction. Blake thought

'Why do I blush?!! Why it affects me that a giant girl likes me?!! I shouldn't care!! I'm Blake, the mercenary warrior!! I'm no ladies man!! I shouldn't care about this!!!' Blake was torturing himself mentally, and Joana just giggled. Her intuition told her that Blake was trying to resist to her...

The rest of the day passed, and Blake was constantly shutting off his mind in an attempt to ignore what he was living here. But this time, Joana kept him near her almost the whole day. When the night fell over the village, Blake returned, though this time, to a piece of fabric that Joana's servants left as an improvised bed for Blake, however, the night was cold, and Joana picked Blake up, and placed him on her belly. She said

-"It will be cold..."-

-"Meh..."- Blake answered, and almost instantly fell asleep. He had been used to sleeping on tress, due to his early life customs, but also slept at inns usually on hard wooden beds with a towel on top. Joana's belly was soft and firm, and also warm... Blake had never felt better, but hadn't time to deny it as he closed his eyes...

The next day...

Blake woke up when a giant finger brushed his hair, and he woke up, though grudgingly

-"Wake up sleepyhead"- Joana said happily -"Didn't you sleep well?"-

-"Meh... Just as always..."- Blake said, rubbing his eyes

Joana sensed that he was lying, trying to seem tougher than he already is, and giggled. She knew Blake slept better than ever before by how fast he fell asleep. She said

-"See? You don't have to suffer..."-

-"Don't try to soften the damage... it's already done... how long have I left?"-

-"Uhmm... well... it's been 5 days counting this one... you have two days left..."-

-"WHAT?!!! I've been here just 3 days!!"-

-"I guess it took 2 days to bring you here... Sorry..."- Joana said

-"I hate my life..."- Blake said, facepalming himself

-"Uh... well.. "- Joana could think of nothing that may comfort him, as the sole idea of being with her was bad enough for him. Still, since he was brought, Joana thought he was particularly cute, and by his looks it was obvious he lacked lots of affection during most of his life, and that triggered some thing in her mind...

-"I'll go lie down on my 'bed' and do nothing for the rest of the day..."- Blake said, but Joana stopped him, and laid him back on her belly

-"What about telling me more about you?"-

-"I've already told you!! I'm a low-class warrior who works with his friends as mercenaries and wanders around the world... there's nothing special about it..."-

-"Who says you're low class?"- Joana didn't like that Blake depicted himself like that

-"I do, and pretty much any person you ask in the kingdom... I'm just someone with no family..."- Blake was really disappointed at his newly discovered mother, who gave him away just for being part of the royal family, at least, so he thought... 'I can't believe she'll get away with this... I'm gonna make her pay...'

-"Well... you won't be low class for long..."-

-"Huh?"-

-"You know that... after we marry, I'll become the queen.. so..."- Joana blushed a lot when saying that

-"What?!!"- Blake didn't get it

-"If I'm the queen and you're my husband, what does that make you?"- Joana blushed even more, and Blake finally got it

-"A king!!"- For one moment, Blake's hopes raised, and thought

'Karina said only the King could nullify my marriage... but if I become this land's king, I can nullify it myself!!! And get the hell away of here!!! And if that doesn't work I'll banish myself!!! Hehehehehe...' Blake for the first time didn't feel so bad about the marriage 'This is not going to last even a day, the moment I'm made king the moment I leave this damn place!!!' Blake was smiling for the first time. Joana looked at him sympathetically, believing that he was comforted...

Then, they noticed movement near the window, like someone who had been watching them. Blake disappeared from on top Joana's belly and reappeared near the window. He looked below, and there was a man with a scroll and what seemed to be a money bag

-"Who are you?"- Blake asked

-"I... I am a messenger the duke of Kildevar sent..."-

-"Really?"-

-"It took a lot to follow those bandits... and to sneak here, my most sincere apologies, sir..."- The messenger said

-"Don't worry... why do you look so scared?"-

-"I saw you, captured by a giant woman..."-

-"Who, her?"- Blake pointed at Joana -"She's harmless, come in..."-

-"Are you sure?"-

-"Of course..."- Blake offered his hand to help the messenger climb up. Joana was curious at seeing other human, and walked near them. The small quakes caused by her steps intimidated the messenger a lot. He gave the scroll to Blake, who read it, and closed it rather roughly

-"Damn!!!"-

-"What's going on?!"- Joana was worried about Blake

-"The Royal Army was called... if they get any clue of where I am I'm dead meat..."-

-"Don't worry, sir..."- The messenger tried to calm him, and gave him the money bag -"The duke and people of Kildevar gave me money for you to survive, this should be enough for you to go anywhere..."-

Joana wasn't happy about the messenger. She thought Blake was starting to accept the idea of staying. Blake, however, thought of the opposite
152111111111111111111111.title: Blake almost loses hope... and regains it...

choices: Joana stops nagging him for the rest of the day...
1521111111111111111111111.content:
-"Hey... do you know if the duke can nullify a forced marriage, preferably before it happens?"- Blake asked the messenger

-"Umm... I don't know, sir. I've never seen such a thing done..."-

-"But maybe he has the power to do so... well. I'll ask that one thing of you... Well, I would... I guess you'd take a lot to go and return here"- Blake realized about the fact of distance and got disappointed

-"Don't be disappointed sir. I have this!!"- He showed a small bird, which had been posing on his shoulder the whole time, but Blake hadn't noticed it

-"I'll write a message to the duke, and he'll sure reply immediately... The bird would take 2 days at most..."-

-"It would be the same..."- Blake said, thinking that it was 2 for going and other 2 for returning

-"No, sir. This bird will take 2 days to do the whole travel..."-

-"Really?"-

-"Yeah..."- The messenger started muttering while he wrote, and after finishing, tied the scroll to one of the bird's foot, and it flew away -"Done. We'll have to wait for the answer..."- The messenger said, then, noticing Joana, he gulped and said

-"I... I'll be outside... if you need anything, I'll be in that tree..."- The messenger said to Blake, and left anxiously. Joana picked Blake up and went back to her bed, this time, she put Blake on her lap.

-"Why didn't he stay here?"-

-"Because NOBODY wants to stay here... good for him that he could leave..."- Blake said, with his arms crossed, Joana was saddened, as she realized Blake wasn't giving up. It wasn't that she really wanted him to give up, but if he failed, he'd feel worse... and, she was growing fond of him, despite his behavior... she even thought that if she knew under different circumstances, things might be different...

-"Uhh... Blake... have I done something wrong to you?"- She asked, and she was being really sincere. Blake was about to reply with a long list, but her tone stopped him... her tone was like that of a girl about to cry... or about to be scolded, or punished...

It reminded of Blake's earlier life, when he started wandering around the world, at 9 years old, along Ferdinand, who was 10... A year later, when they were 10 and 11 respectively (It was just he and Ferdinand by that time), they were hired to rescue a count's daughter, from thieves who kidnapped her for money. Ferdinand, being the older one, took on the thieves, despite Blake's strength and ability, he didn't want to risk him, and he went to rescue the girl... who was 11 or 12 years old, Blake couldn't tell.

For Blake, if was nothing special, one more job. But the girl followed him around (They were hired for a year, partially because of this girl) and kept nagging him trying to know more of him. Ferdinand thought it was funny, despite he had bad luck with girls himself. Blake grew exasperated about the girl and one day he was about to shout at her, and she spoke in that tone, asking if she was doing something wrong... He stopped and sighed. He told her that he was just a mercenary, and was younger than her. That she was the daughter of a count, and deserved someone better than him. He also told her that he wouldn't be there forever, when they stopped needing him, he'd have to leave, to move on to somewhere else...

He saw her tears dropping, and knew that truth almost always was more painful than a lie. He sighed at that realization. He also told her, that someone like him was not fit for being a husband, that taking care of a wife and a family wasn't something he was fit for... He told her that he was meant for nothing, and it made no sense ruining more lives. However, Blake agreed to spend his free time with her, as friends...

She had convinced her father and most of that village's people to keep Blake and Ferdinand hired, as they were doing a really good job. And they weren't particularly expensive, in fact, their services were cheaper than most mercenary bands. The count's wife had somehow guessed why her daughter wanted to keep those mercenaries, and even told her husband about the idea... she knew that they were too young but that when Blake was older, he might ask them for their daughter's hand. They also allowed them to sleep in their guest rooms...

However, an unknown person called for the Royal Army, and told them that there were mercenaries in the village, and that they were suspicious of practicing dark magic. Luckily, a scout came first, and interrogated the count. He told him that he had no knowledge, and that the mercenaries left the previous day. He also gave them a false indication, telling him that they headed for north. (Blake and Ferdinand were sleeping at the count's guest rooms)

After the scout left, he woke up Blake and Ferdinand, gave them a lot of money, food, water and equipment, and told them what happened, and told them to leave, heading for south, and better if it was south eat or south west to not be so predictable. However, the noises woke up the count's daughter, who was shocked to see Blake and Ferdinand packing their stuff. Her father explained her that they needed to leave, otherwise the Royal Army would kill them. She was on the verge of tears, and Ferdinand, understanding, took most of the stuff and said he'd wait outside, meanwhile he'd load some things on Tabitha (who was a bit bigger than a colt by that time)

Blake didn't know what to do, but decided to explain her, and whispered to her the truth about himself, that he and Ferdinand were, indeed, the last living dark magicians, a species not allowed by law, and punished with death... He said he usually spoke with the truth, and that there were very slim chances he'd ever return, and apologized for that. His last words before leaving were "I would write to you... but if I stopped for some reason, it would worry you... it also would feed your hopes about me returning... and... if I die in battle, or by the Royal Army... I don't want you to know..."

She, crying, hugged him very tightly and kissed him in the left cheek. After some seconds, Blake sighed, and left, carrying the stuff Ferdinand left... It was the only time Blake had been hugged and kissed by a girl before... As he walked, he quietly muttered her name "Aranza*..."

-"Huh?"- Joana asked confused, and Blake was snapped out of his memories

-"What?!"-

-"You muttered something... I couldn't hear it clearly..."- Joana said

-"Nyeh!! I...I-mean... it was nothing!!"- Blake said, but thought 'What would've been if I never formed a squad, and stayed there for longer... would I... no... I'm still the same... but maybe... I wouldn't have ended up here... it would have been better to be married to a normal girl rather than a giant...' Blake then realized of what he was thinking, and scolded himself 'What are you thinking?!! You aren't meant to marry ANYONE!! You are a Warrior!! A proud low class warrior!! I'm not a man who would be in a warm house playing with children!! I'm someone who fights battles!!'

-"Sure?"-

-"Yeah, just stupid stuff of mine..."- Blake tried to pretend the situation never happened, but his mind kept wondering 'Now that I'm probably marrying this girl by force, it wouldn't hurt to think of other possibilities... seriously, was Aranza that bad?! No matter what she'd be better than THIS' He thought, referring with "THIS" to Joana...

-"It's ironical I rejected her to end up like this..."- Blake muttered

-"Who?"- Joana asked

-"What?!! You heard me?!!"- Blake said, and thought 'I need to stop thinking aloud...'

-"Nothing... I guess I get what I deserve for being myself, nothing you care about..."- Blake remained silent, until Joana asked him if it was about his friends, and that reminded her that he didn't tell her about them, and so, she nagged Blake, and poked his head with her index finger in a comical way until Blake grew desperate again...

-"Enough!!"-

-"Will you tell me?"-

-"Does it look like I have a choice?"- He said, and sighed -"There are 5 of them. Ferdinand, is like me, uses dark magic, and fights using a scythe... he's smart although a bit weird... and he says he has bad luck with girls because none have accepted him as a boyfriend... Something I personally don't care about... Then, there's Gustave, a nice guy, he's polite, and knows many things, he was once from a noble family, but the Sand Bandits killed them, as well as steal their wealth..."-

-"That's terrible..."-

-"Nobody said the Sand Bandits were nice people... whatever... the others are Ayrton, a very cheerful guy, he also seems to be the most insightful among us. A little too happy I'd say... Also, Caesar... he's a normal guy. He is at a mid point at most things, and also knows a lot of ancient history, because where he's from, people did their best to preserve history..."-

-"I see... but, what about the 5th?"-

-"That would be Anthony... he's no longer with us... he left to join the Royal Army, although I still consider him a friend..."- Blake looked down...

*Just to get facts straight, this character is entirely fictional, although I thought of the name because that's one of my friends' sister's name... Real me had no previous relationships before meeting Joana...
1521111111111111111111111.title: A new hope for Blake... well... maybe...

15211111111111111111111111.content:
The rest of the day passed, and Joana noticed Blake's gloomy mood, so, she stopped annoying him. At night, she had him sleeping on her belly again, but this time, Blake didn't fall asleep easily. He couldn't stop thinking about that fateful day... Had he not been forced to escape, he would've stayed there for a longer time, and luckily he wouldn't have ended up here...

He also wondered if the Royal Army ever went back and took vengeance, or just left them alone... Blake wouldn't forgive himself if he found that the Royal Army destroyed the entire village and/or killed the count and his family... He thought 'They're okay... and there's no way I'll know... plus, it's been years, I doubt they're still looking for me, and most likely think they were victims of a stupid prank... so, I better stop thinking about that...'

The next day...

Blake slept, and seemingly stopped thinking about his past. This time he woke up by himself. Blake started to question why he hated this so much... He was doing almost the same he did years ago, and regretted that. He remembered his talk with Ferdinand, when they were leaving the town

-"I'm sorry..."-

-"About what?!"- Blake tried to sound tough

-"You know about what... that girl... you..."- Ferdinand added -"I know it must be difficult..."-

-"We had nothing... She was just a friend..."- Blake replied

-"Riight..."-

-"In difference of you, I don't drool by merely seeing a girl..."-

-"Huh?!! *Ahem!* Still... you and her may have been a good couple..."-

-"I'M 11 YEARS OLD!!!"-

-"Hee hee... the more you deny the more true it is..."-

-"It doesn't matter anymore..."-

-"You needed more time... you know... it fits you... a girlfriend like her... older than you... that helps you to heal your wounds..."-

-"I can heal my own wounds..."-

-"Not the physical ones... your mind's wounds..."-

-"Whatever, it's over... Let's move on and forget about this!!"- Was Blake's final answer. The rest of their travel was with no talking...

Ever since that, Ferdinand noticed Blake's heart hardened even more, and he longer even tried for a second time. Several girls along their way were nice to him, but he didn't really care much about it. The most they'd get from Blake would be polite answers, and indifference... Blake also convinced everyone he knew that it wouldn't work with him. That he was not fit for a relationship, and that his fate was to die in battle, one day... Nobody else other than Ferdinand and Blake himself knew about this...

Blake stopped considering those memories, and after thinking deeply about several other things, he realized that this was his 6th day... counting this one, he had only 2 days left... 'I can't believe I have 2 days left... I feel I wasted my life...' Blake thought

-"Are you still sad?"-

-"I was NOT sad!! I'm... forget it... I have just 2 days left..."- Blake then remembered about his 'backup plan', but didn't want to be married in the first place...

-"Blake..."-

-"Don't start with that... All of this is bad, and nothing will change my mind about it..."-

-"I know, but- "- Joana said

-"I DON'T like you. And I doubt I would no matter what..."- Blake said, emphasizing the "don't", and crossed his arms. He felt the "ground" beneath him move rhythmically, and heard quiet sobs. He stood up (with some difficulty) and saw Joana crying silently. Blake found strange that she didn't cry liudly when he realized that it would've drawn attention towards them, and Blake would be in trouble. He sighed

-"Listen... I can't apologize for what I said... because it's true..."- Blake started, and her crying increased, it was very quiet but some sobs sounded louder -"I had to tell you this... I noticed that your hopes started to raise, and I didn't want to ruin everything in whatever ceremony you're going to have... It's just, you're a giant.... I don't feel good with this, I wouldn't marry a human girl I don't know, and I would never marry a giant girl..."-

Blake's attempt to tell the truth worsened Joana's crying. He got off Joana's belly, as her crying no longer let him stand up. He said

-"Would you prefer a lie? I hate hypocrisy..."-

Joana wiped her tears (but didn't stop crying), and asked Blake

-"Did you listen to yourself? You wouldn't marry a human girl you don't know... but you would never marry a giant girl..."-

-"I was not considering marring anyone. I just wanted to get my life back, as a mercenary, travel around, and have nothing to worry about... That's who I am. That's also why I told you I'm not for relationship... I'm someone who can't love nor be loved..."-

-"You aren't even trying. You didn't even try to be friends with me..."- Joana was still crying

-"Excuse me for being angry..."- Blake said, and added in a sarcastic tone -"Oh, I was captured to be forcefully married to a giant princess. Hi giant princess. Wanna be friends?"- Blake stopped his sarcastical mode and shouted

-" WHAT KIND OF FREAKING WORLD DO YOU LIVE IN?!!! Nobody told you to be nice, you have all the right to be angry too!! You're being forced to marry some guy you don't know!! Now it's even worse, you know it's a low class vagabond who fights for money!! And you're still NOT angry!! Doesn't it anger you that a princess like you marries a mercenary!!"- Blake had practically released almost all of his anger through words, by the end of his angry speech he was breathing heavily

-"Actually... no... I never cared where does someone come from, or what's their job..."-

-"You should still feel insulted. There are many human nobles you could marry..."- Blake said, looking down

-"Karina said they were too protected..."-

-"Why aren't you angry yet? I gave a lot of reasons to hate this forced marriage, and to hate me. And the solution is as simple as grabbing me and throwing me through that window, or stepping on me like an insect..."-

-"I don't hate you..."-

-"You should... it would make things easier..."-

-"I know that you say this because you're suffering... and because you hate yourself..."- Joana said, and her crying stopped for a moment. Blake opened his eyes wide, but then regained composure, and said

-"That doesn't matter..."-

-"Let me help you..."- Joana said, and Blake was confused

-"Huh?!! How?"-

-"Just try to be my friend... telling things to a friend would help your soul..."-

Blake never told anything personal to his friends, nor was he intending to tell them for example, that he was a hybrid... one of the infamous Zasshu, hated by most of people...

-"Also, spending time with a friend can help..."- Joana added, and regained some of her cheerfulness

-"I don't know how to do that..."-

-"You were starting to go good yesterday... until you took out your rage again on me..."- Joana said that with a different tone, as she didn't mean to make him feel guilty

Blake sighed, and said -"It's not like I can't do much else..."-

Joana giggled. She couldn't understand why she was insisting so much on helping him, for some reason she was growing fond of him. She also wanted to heal his soul, it was obvious that Blake was bearing a lot of grief, and many other things torturing his soul. She remembered when she was taught by her teachers that a hybrid, if fertile, can succeed attracting the opposite sex from both species... And also remembered, that despite his human size, Blake is in fact a hybrid, and 50% of his blood is from giants... 'Could that be why?' She wondered.
15211111111111111111111111.title: Blake screws up...

choices: Tabitha goes back to release Blake's friends...
152111111111111111111111111.content:
They heard a knock on the door, and a giant girl entered. Blake had never seen her until now. Joana sat up and he immediately hid behind her. Joana's friend spoke

-"Hey, I just heard the news... You've got a guy, and you will become the Queen!!"-

-"Heh... yeah..."- Joana got nervous when she heard that. She was trying to get used to the idea herself, though in difference of Blake, getting married didn't anger her, but the ceremony and the wedding made her nervous.

-"Where is the lucky guy?"- She asked cheerfully, and Blake muttered angrily

-"Yeah... lucky..."-

Joana then noticed that Blake was hiding behind her, and it looked cute to her, but still, she grabbed him with her fingers and put him on her lap. Blake was reluctant to meet Joana's friend, as she already thought he was happy about this. She petted his head a bit though. Then she said

-"You look pretty nervous. Let's take a walk outside..."-

Joana nodded, and was about to g outside when Karina stopped her, and told her that if she was going out with Blake, she'd need to keep him tied, and chained him. A ring was closed around Blake's neck, then a long chain, which in its other end was attached to Joana's wrist by a larger ring (handcuff-like) around it. They went to a cliff...

[Then this happens http://www.writing.com/main/interact/cid... ]

Joana and Blake returned to her room, while her friend went to get dressed for the public announcement and celebration. Then Blake heard something, and saw Tabitha coming in through the open window. She almost tackled him and licked him desperately. Then she noticed Joana and hissed angrily. Joana was confused by how the cat entered and started licking Blake, and he said

-"This is my cat, Tabitha..."

And although Joana tried to move slowly and act harmless toward the female cat, she roared (panther-like), and Blake had to grab the back of her neck before she tried to attack. he petted her head and massaged her neck until she calmed down. Then he started moving his hands, and placed his open palm on her forehead. Tabitha's eyes changed from green to yellow. And her claws glowed in golden. He then ripped a small piece of paper from Joana's desk, and wrote a message, which read (btw, the parentheses used in the note count in-story)

'Before anything. Thank you very much to all of you guys. I felt bad because you ended up in the same mess as me. And because I failed to beat the sand bandits. As the squad leader, it's my fault, I recognize that. That aside... HELP ME!! They are forcing me to marry a GIANT princess!! (Leave the laughs for later, this is serious guys). These girls are not to be underestimated as you probably saw. Their powers are light based, Ferdinand knows how to counter that. Also, I gave Tabitha a spell breaker so she releases you. Don't get caught again!!

PS: HELP!!!'

He rolled it, and gave it to Tabitha, who carried it in its mouth. Blake told her -"Go, wherever my friends are..."- and she left. Joana stared at him with a sad look

-"It seems your friends came for you, after all..."-

-"I didn't really expect them to. But this is really good, if we're lucky we'll not even marry!! My friends are the best ones!!"- Blake was happy, and Joana just answered with

-"Uh... yeah..."- To tell the truth, she was sad, she wanted to marry him, or have other means to spend more time with him, and stopped disliking her just because of her size.

-"You aren't gonna tell the guards, are you?"- Blake was worried because she knew what happened, but she denied with her head

-"It might be your chance to escape. If it succeeds, I won't stop you..."- Joana said, and her words rang in Blake's mind

After rescuing the count's daughter, Blake and Ferdinand intended to move on to somewhere else, and the girl stopped Blake, she said

-"Why are you leaving?"-

-"My job is already done... I have to go somewhere else..."-

-"Why don't you stay, there's still jobs for you. You can stop thieves or something..."- The girl said

-"Why do you want me to stay?"- Blake asked

-"I'd like to know you better..."- She got very close to his face, and he could feel her breathing -"You look like someone who is sad about something... I want to help..."-

-"Huh?!!! Yeah... whatever..."- Blake pushed her away and decided to stay for a while. Ferdinand, who watched everything, agreed, and thought it would do Blake good. One day, some months later, after they had stopped the majority of thieves, killed dangerous beasts and did some deliveries, there wasn't any job for Blake and Ferdinand, so, the former decided to leave, and the girl stopped him again. By the look in her eyes, Blake knew what she was going to say, and Blake spoke first

-"I'm leaving because there's no more work to be done here..."-

-"Can't you take a day off? It wouldn't hurt...you know... spending time with a friend or something..."- She asked, and while doing so, she kept playing with her hair, which was auburn, wavy and shoulder length. Her eyes were brown (Joana's were hazel)

-"Ugh..."- Blake just grunted as an answer, and knew he'd end up doing whatever she had in mind...

-"But... if you really want to go somewhere else, I won't stop you. I don't want to force you to anything..."- She said in a more serios and saddened tone

Blake sighed and thought deeply. He really had a difficult choice: Either keep with his mercenary life, or stay in that place. After a while, Blake decided forthe latter, which led to Aranza giving him a happy n.n look (she knew Bake wasn't used to hugs)

Blake just thought 'This is going to be very loong...'

They heard Karina's voice from outside, which snapped Blake out of his memories

-"Your Majesty, the ceremony will start in 30 minutes..."-

-"Yeah... I'll be ready..."- Joana said, and sighed, saddened by what she knew was going to happen...
152111111111111111111111111.title: Back to where we left off...

choices: Let's hear Blake's side of this.
1521111111111111111111111111.content:
The group of five were now hanging from golden ropes attached to the ceiling, less than a foot from the floor. At this point they had given up. Tabitha rushed in, a giantess behind her. She lunged and cut each of their ropes and the giantess stood over them.

"You are not to leave until the ceremony is over!" The man walked up and held his arms up. "We didn't do it, the cat did now you can let us go back into the HIYAAH!" A huge blue glow erupted from behind his hood and the entire giantess froze solid. He dropped onto one knee for about a minute until Ferdinand brought the nite to him. After reading he said simply,

"This makes everything harder. But who cares, let's go! We need to improvise a way through the princess's guards and get Blake." The man ran out while the others followed. Unarmed they snuck through a few hallways.

"Where are we going? Ferdinand whispered into the man's ear."

"Yes." Was the only thing he whispered back. They followed and reached a staircase. He pept up one and pulled himself up. Eyes wide they all looked as he held his arm out.

"Come on! We can't waste time!" they each managed it with each others help and did this for the entire set if stairs to the top floor.

"Her quarters should be the third door on the right. Wait, was it left?" Eventually he walked over to the third door on the right and, hood glowing, kicked a piece out of the door. Looking around, this was her quarters. The cage proved that, but no Blake could be seen. "No! He'll be in the courtyard for the wedding ceremony! We have to run!"
1521111111111111111111111111.title: Freedom

choices: Blake and his friends keep fighting back...
15211111111111111111111111111.content:
After Joana was done dressing (fortunately for Blake, she didn't take too long), she took Blake in her hand and headed to the courtyard. There were a lot of giantesses wanting to hear what was the public announcement for. While Joana was walking toward the courtyard, they could heard Karina speaking, when they got closer, they could hear that it was a public speech about Joana.

Blake checked his surroundings, but couldn't find his sword. Blake only knew the entrance and Joana's room anyway. So, he guessed Karina kept it somewhere.He had the feeling his friends would bust during the event, at least he hopes so. He was now fully recovered, and hadn't put on the metal rings that restrained his strength, although he had put back on the silver chain with its tag, which suppressed his dark powers. It was given to him by his grandma, but she said both his mother and his father made it, they knew he'd have the two powers, but only dark ones were punished...

'I can't show my dark powers to the rest of the guys, otherwise, I'd have to do a lot of explanations...' He thought 'Good thing Joana is bringing me in her hand... Though, I could bet it was because she knows what's going to happen too... I wonder why she's sad... She should be happy since I'm not marrying her... ANYWAY... Focus, Blake!! You know you will have to pull off your best effort'

Blake took the silver chain off, thinking 'Just in case...' Also, he put his hood back on (Just to specify, Blake's hood didn't cover his whole face as those of executioners, it was more like this http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=2rd9nox&... Except for the hair, the sword, and the metal rings, as well as the silver chain and tag, Blake looks like this)

Karina was saying some more stuff (I was too lazy to write a whole political-like speech. Sorry) and ended introducing Joana herself and her... fiancé? When she walked outside, the crowd applauded, and while most of them expected her to show Blake more happily, she just held him in her hand. Still, this shocked most of the giantesses because they had never seen a man*...

Blake felt a very tiny energy ball hit him behind the neck, and looked toward where it came from. It was a tactic he and Ferdinand used to be communicate without making any noise. Ferdinand gestured him with a thumbs up, to which Blake replied by smiling, He showed his wrists so they saw he was not chained anymore. Nobody noticed this because they all were asking Joana about how did she get a human male and just in time...

Ferdinand whispered to everyone -"He's fine. We'll attack n-"- He stopped when noticed that the man was missing -"Where did that guy go?"- He asked, and everyone shrugged

-"I wonder why does he know Blake and us... well, we don't have time, we'll proceed..."- He added, and Ayrton, Gustave and Caesar nodded. Tabitha stood still, knowing she wouldn't able to do much in battle (She reacted very badly to Joana's presence, because she looked human-like but gigantic... I can't blame her...)

Ferdinand grabbed his scythe and gestured with his other hand the killing sign (thumb moves resembling a knife cutting someone's neck, I don't know how it's called...) Then pointed at Joana, with a somewhat sadistic smile, however Blake replied by denying with his head and waving the 'No' sign with his hand. Ferdinand was confused, but shrugged

-"Well... according to Blake we're not killing the princess..."- Everyone said

-"Huh?!"-

Then Ferdinand went to look back at the princess, and Gustave went to catch a glimpse as well. Both of them stared at her for several seconds and Ferdinand said

-"I can understand Blake... she would be such a beauty if she wasn't giant..."-

-"Man, Blake has good taste... It would be a crime to kill her... if she was a normal girl..."- Gustave said, and soon both guys started drooling, Blake, who was watching them, facepalmed himself. Ayrton and Caesar punched them in their heads hammer-like. Ferdinand, after some moans of pain and cursing his friends, said

-"Alright!! We're attacking now!!"- He stood there, and nobody moved

-"ARE YOU DEAF OR WHAT?!!"- He sighed and added -"Alright, I'll start myself..."- He aimed both hands toward where Blake and Joana were, muttered an incantation and shot a wide dark beam. The crowd gasped in shock as they noticed a black beam with a blue outline seemingly striking down the princess. It created a powerful explosion, but it created lots of dust, smoke and a shockwave. It wasn't much of a fire explosion, and missed Joana intentionally. Blake then jumped upward, encountering with his friends. He shook hands with Ferdinand but Gustave hugged him (despite knowing Blake disliked hugs, and Gustave was actually saved by Blake nearly 6 years ago). Blake, maybe because of being rescued, allowed it for this time...

However Blake shouted -"WATCH OUT!!"- He pushed Gustave away, caught with his hands an incoming giant light ball. Blake had a bit of difficult but compressed it a bit and threw it back.

-"Light... Magic?!!"- Caesar was the first to wonder

-"Weren't light magicians extinct save for you, Blake?"- Ayrton asked

-"We were wrong... These giant women have light magic as well..."- He answered

-"But... how?!!"- Caesar, Ayrton and Gustave asked. Ferdinand was thoughtful, and soon suspected 'Can it be... no... that would mean Blake is not... that he is a... no, it can't be... though... I've always wondered why has he always worn those weights... I thought it was training to become a sage or something...'

-"It doesn't matter right now!! We'll talk later!! We're being attacked, we need to fight back!!"- Blake said, and dodged two more giant light balls.

-"I'm gonna get payback from whoever imprisoned us!!"- Caesar cracked his knuckles, and started firing thunderbolts from his hands.Ayrton unsheathed his two swords, and prepared to dive, but Blake stopped him by holding his shoulder, and denying with his head, he said

-"Melee combat is not an option here, Ayrton, we'll need to stick to distance combat for now..."- Ayrton noticed that Blake hadn't his sword, and asked

-"Where's your sword?"-

-"They took it away. It doesn't matter, we have to fight back and get THE HELL out of this place!!"-

-"You always went back for that sword... you said it was important to you..."-

-"It IS important to me, but no more than my life... I'd rather die than be married!!"- Blake said, strangely sounding heroic

-"Didn't you just contradict yourself?"- Ayrton observed

-"Shut up and fight!!"- Blake replied

Blake was the only one able to fire back the light energy balls, so, he ended up at the front, using his light abilities to stop the light shot at them and throw it back. Ferdinand formed a bow and started firing dark arrows at the giantesses (who were Joana's servants... somewhat trained to defend their princess, despite their lack of practice...)

However, his attacks did very little damage, and angered them more. Gustave kept shooting fire balls, which caused more damage, as they burnt the giantesses' skin. Caesar was also having a bit of success, as his thunderbolts also damaged them. Ayrton kept waving his swords to create what according to him were called Wind Cutters (Other elements have wave-shaped attacks, but only Wind cuts, the others cause heavy damage according to their element, and usually explode. Also, Wind Cutters, despite requiring a lot of training, don't consume much energy, and Ayrton can create them massively for a long time without draining his energy)




*Although not mentioned by Lith, The King's attack on the dark magicians also killed all remaining men that lived among gianteses, to prevent the birth f new Zasshu hybrids. Thus, the youngest giantesses are Blake's age at the very least (17). Older giantesses were surprised because of nearly 20 years without seeing a human male...
15211111111111111111111111111.title: Wedding? Not yet...

152111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ferdinand noticed Ayrton's tactic, and stopped firing dark arrows. The bow (made of darkness) disappeared, and he grabbed his scythe. He swung it twice to create powerful dark waves, which were very large, and hit 3 giantesses at once. The explosion also distracted them. Blake and his friends tried to escape but as soon as they landed on the ground, the giantesses recovered quickly and kept attacking them. Blake and his friends were surrounded, and the giantesses kept getting close. Blake also noticed that Joana's servant, and Joana's friend were the ones attacking. He wondered about Karina and Claire, but honestly, he didn't want to know...

Blake shouted -"THE HELL WITH THIS!!"- And dashed toward Joana's friend, he punched her in the stomach with such force that she was knocked backward a great distance (although to the giantesses, it was equivalent to 3 feet)

Blake's friends were amazed, and asked -"How the HELL did you do THAT?!!"-

-"We have no time I'll explain things later..."- Blake did a lot of quick moves with his hands, while muttered

-"Purify evil, Light punisher... Bring the judgement of light... Consume the darkness, sentence to death... Incinerate!!"-

A circle made of golden light appeared in the ground, and it was massive. Enough to be around roughly 10 giantesses. As Blake said the spell, a pentagram formed inside the circle, and five pillars of light struck the pentagram's peaks (or points, I'm not sure how are they called). Then, a sixth emerged from the center, which grew until it engulfed the giantesses, and rose high into the sky. It was incredibly huge, and pretty much anyone in the human kingdom may have been able to see it (although only as a very thin pillar)

It also caused a massive explosion, and Blake's friends had their mouths wide open, and their jaws dropped.

-"H-h-h-h...he took down 5 giantesses in a single shot..."- Ayrton said in disbelief. Blake fell to his knees, and they went to help him

-"Forget about punching a giantess...How did you DO THIS?!!"- Caesar said

-"Heh... *cough!! cough!!* it was one of the most powerful spells I learned *cough!* I would only use them in *cough!!* life or death situations..."-

Ferdinand looked, 5 giantesses were down (Joana's friend was NOT among these) and the damage done to the courtyard was considerable...

-"Well, it was really something. Now, let's escape before something worse..."- He was cut off when a huge shadow towered over them, it was Joana's black haired friend, who was very angry.

-"It's YOU again!! How dare you to humiliate the Princess like this?!!"- She tried to stomp on them, but Blake got up and stopped her foot with his two hands. Blake's friends were further impressed, and stared for a moment. Blake slowly sank into the ground, which cracked because of the giant girl's force. Blake shouted

-"What are you waiting for?!!"- Blake's friends moved away quickly, and saw Blake disappearing, and reappearing near them. The giant girl said

-"And YOU are on their side?!! I thought you came here to marry the Princess!!"-

-"I was brought BY FORCE here!! I didn't come on my own will. And I will fight for my freedom!!"- Blake dashed again at her, but this time, she covered her stomach with her left arm and Blake quickly jumped from it, punching her in the left cheek. Blake disappeared and punched her right cheek. Then, he reappeared behind her head, and kicked her in the back of her neck. She fell again, but caught Blake in her hand.

Ferdinand then fired a dark wave from his scythe, which exploded in her face, and Ayrton shot at her hand a Wind Cutter, which shed a bit of blood, and forced her to release Blake. She tried to pound the ground with her right first, but missed, and Blake shot a light beam at her face. The girl got up, and wiped the blood off her hand. She shot a light beam, which to them was massive and could barely dodge. Ayrton said, worried

-"We aren't hurting her that much..."-

-"It's alright. I'll take her on..."- Blake said

-"But we came to rescue you!!"-

-"I know. Back me up. I need all the help I can possibly get..."- Blake said, and they heard quakes, coming from different directions. Karina and Claire towered over them (and formed a triangle if you count Joana's friend)

-"So... did these little pipsqueaks come to rescue their friend?!"- Karina said, in a despising tone (Unknown to them, Karina had higher than average training to defend the Princess, although her training was more of melee fight and didn't work properly on humans... still, she's stronger than average and can take more damage without much problem. She also knows some light spells...)

-"Yeah, they are the ones I imprisoned earlier..."- Joana's friend said

-"I thought you had already learned your lesson..."- Karina said to Blake -"You disappoint me. I thought you already had accepted your fate..."-

-"NOBODY tells MY fate!!"- Blake readied two golden light energy balls in his hands

-"We do..."- Said Claire, teasingly. And the three girls aimed their hands at them, and fired three light beams, which Ferdinand and Blake blocked by creating a dark shield that absorbed the light, and shot it back as a single beam, which missed, but caught the three giantesses in its explosion. Blake and his friends then started to run, and soon they heard fast quakes which were nothing else than the giant girls running... until a giant woman stood in front of them. It was a different woman, she had wavy brown hair, and her skin was fair. Her eyes were green, and Blake's friends could tell she wasn't at the celebration. However, Blake knew who she was said

-"Ignore her"- And tried to walk around her, but she moved, blocking Blake's way. He shouted angrily

-"WHY YOU?!!"- And shot several energy balls at her face and chest. They did very little damage, and Lith denied with h head in disappointment. Then the rest of the girls arrived and they found themselves surrounded by 3 giant girls and a giant woman. This was definitively bad...
152111111111111111111111111111.title: Blake and friends need help, really...

choices: Let's see how our escapees are.
1521111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Never let the enemy out of your sight, or battles won't go well." The man's voice echoed across the courtyard, not giving his position away. Joana's black-haired friend signaled to Claire, who went to find him. He continued to speak as he laughed a bit. The man was kneeling on a roof, echoing his voice with a spell. "You're getting warmer." Claire neared the perfect spot beneath the roof.

"Found me!" He lunged down slashing her cheek with the sword. She stomped at him but he jumped back and fired a light blue beam right into her forehead, jolting her from consciousness.

"Next?" The other three stayed put and he sighed. "But the fun just started!" He began charging towards them and stopped just far enough away that they couldn't reach him. The black-haired friend grabbed Blake and quickly teleported away with him. Karina started to move in.

"No." He threw a knife that froze her solid. "You're special, eh Lith?" Lith herself was surprised by this man. I will let you get off fine if you leave. If not, things'll get ugly." Lith stood her ground.

"Three, two, one. Ready or not here..." he disappeared and smashed the back of her head with full power. "Went." with each incapacitated, he firmed a ladder of ice up to a roof.

"Stay put, I'll be back." He formed a roughly cone shaped shard of ice around him, point facing down. It drilled into the dungeon, where the black-haired girl sat with Blake restrained and gassed. She saw the cone fall through the ceiling and the man stepped out of it.

"Give me Blake. Now." The man was silent and she picked him up. "Don't you dare teleport again because, if you do...." A wavering beam of light blue hit her and drained her energy. She fell to her knees and she drained her to sleep. He grabbed Blake and got back into the cone. He finally arrived on the roof to see a frantic search. The man handed him to Ferdinand. He formed a huge bridge of ice, spanning from the rooftop to outside the village.

"Go across! I'll get rid of it." they ran across and the man followed, melting it. He began to feel the strain of everything he had done, but continued.

"Go to that village where we stayed a day. If I'm not there four days from now at noon, I'm caught or dead. That means keep going back home." The gang wondered what he meant, but saw the mob of giantesses at the base of the bridge.

"Hello ladies." he said as he formed a huge golem of ice. He jumped in and prepared to fight on a more even size scale. He managed to buy them enough time to escape, and knocked out fourteen giantesses before he failed, but by now the gang was long gone, and only the insignificant seeming cloaked man laid by a bunch of huge feet.
1521111111111111111111111111111.title: Finally, the mysterious man appears...

15211111111111111111111111111111.content:
After running for a while, Blake and his friends stopped. Then, Ayrton said

-"Maybe this is not the moment, but I have to ask... Blake, who was that man?!"-

-"How do you expect me to know? You came with him..."- Blake answered, confused

-"Well... he seems to know about you and us... we thought he may have been someone you worked for in the past or something..."- Caesar said

-"Nope... I had never seen him..."- Blake replied

-"Well... I guess this is over... how about going back to Kildevar?"- Gustave said

-"Uhm... no... I'm afraid... we can't..."- Blake remembered about what Rick told him in the message

-"Why?"- All of them asked

-"The incident with the Sand Bandits.. Rick had to call the Royal Army, and you know, a bunch of mercenaries is a perfect scapegoat..."- Blake answered, but his friends (except Ferdinand) were a bit confused.

-"Anyway, we should wait for that man..."- Blake said -"After all, he saved us from this mess..."-

-"Blake... he told us to keep going as if he wasn't coming back... He said 'Go to that village where we stayed a day. If I'm not there four days from now at noon, I'm caught or dead. That means keep going back home' "-

-"Then we'll wait those 4 days..."- Blake said, and after discreetly removing his metal rings, rode on Tabitha.

In 3 hours they arrived to the village Blake's friends stayed previously, and paid for 4 nights at the inn. However, Blake didn't pay for himself, as he usually slept in some tree's branch. It was near sunset and they bought some food to have dinner. Blake's friends were hungry (at normal level) but noticed Blake wasn't as hungry, and ate slowly and little quantity of food.

-"What's wrong Blake? You should be happy!! You avoided being married to some giant girl..."- Ayrton said

-"I'm glad for that... but I'm just not that hungry..."- Blake replied

-"Huh?!"- His friends (except Ferdinand) asked in confusion

-"I was fed while I was kept there, thus, I'm not hungry right now..."- Blake didn't want to do more explaining, and grabbed his glass (filled with water, while the others drank wine or beer) to drink. Then they heard the door opening, and a seemingly unknown man entered in a rush. Blake was the only one who wasn't surprised about him, and the man said

-"Sir!! The duke's reply arrived some hours ago, but I watched your successful escape... I came to deliver you the message anyway, although I guess it's pretty much useless now..."- He handed Blake a scroll, which read

'Blake. I received the message... I'm sorry, but I don't have the power to do such a thing...
