Only the King by means of threatening with his army would be able to force the marriage to be nullified... I don't even have much of an army of my own... I'm sorry, the only thing I can do is to pray and to wish you the best luck.

PS: Seriously, a giantess?! Of all people!! I'd hate to be you...'

Blake was a bit disappointed, but at least they escaped. However, Blake's mind couldn't rest until he saw the man who saved him and his friends. He owed him, and Blake has a honor sense that tells him that if that man helped them, he would at least thank him himself. Getting back to the message, he thought that he'd better wait for the mysterious man to return, but also worried that if the giantesses caught him, what would they do to him?

-"Alright... There's one last thing I'd like to ask you..."- Blake said

-"What is it, sir?"-

-"You have been able to be in the giantess village without being seen. Could you survey them?"-

-"Huh? I can, but what would it be for?"-

-"A friend of us is still there, he told us that if he didn't come in 4 days he was caught or dead. I would like you to find out what happened to him. If he's in danger, tell us as soon as possible..."-

-"Alright"- The messenger left. Blake and his friends would stay for 4 days or until the messenger returned. Although Blake's friends were happy that it was over, only Blake wondered why did someone he doesn't know help him, to the extent of risking his life. That weird feeling that his well-being was costing more than it should tormented Blake's mind, and opaqued the relief of not being married to the giant princess. And also, he wondered what happened to her... Blake dismissed that thought, as he knew it wasn't officially her fault, so, they couldn't blame her... but maybe...

'It doesn't matter, she's giant and she's a princess. I don't care' Blake shut his mind up about anything else related to the giantesses.

-"What a hell of a day, huh?"- Ferdinand said to Blake, whose mind had been absent for a while. Ferdinand didn't know what happened those days Blake was alone, but it left a mark in his mind for sure. The rest of Blake's friends didn't notice this, and were talking about the day, happy about their victory, despite the fact that their savior's fate was unknown. Caesar and Ayrton were thinking about just moving on to somewhere else, and start again, as they had done for years. Gustave somehow also perceived Blake's absent mind, and he thought deeper that maybe he suffered torture of some sort...

-"Hey, Blake... what happened while you were alone back there?"- The redhead asked

-" *Sigh* Nothing worth telling. And, to be honest, very little happened, it was just waiting for that damn wedding day..."- Blake said, and Gustave added

-"Yeah... we kinda came at last minute..."-

-"Nope... It was supposed to be tomorrow... Today was just some announcement..."- Blake replied

-"Then it's even better..."- Ayrton said

-"It would have been even more dramatic if we came at the very last moment..."- Caesar said

-"That's very risky... those things only happen in books..."- Ayrton said to him

-"Anyway, Blake's back, we're no longer slaves... We're at a nice inn... Life's Nice..."- Gustave said, leaning back in his chair

-"I guess..."- Said a not so convinced Blake, who after finishing his food, went outside, where Tabitha was waiting for him, he petted head, and she purred happily. She was definitively the one who missed him the most. And despite being far larger than her master, she rubbed herself against him (like normal sized cats usually do with their owners' legs as a sign of affection... I don't know how it's called in english), and also licked him in the cheek. Blake stayed with her, playing for about 30 minutes, then, decided to go to sleep, and Tabitha followed him. Both of them climbed to a tree with thick branches, but in difference of other times, this time, the tree had very wide and thick branches, and when Blake laid to sleep, Tabitha climbed near him, and moved him so that his head rested on her back. She usually did this when they slept on the ground, but Blake didn't mind. Tabitha was more comfortable than the tree's branch...

'Whoah... this is almost as comfortable as...' Blake was thinking, and stopped right there, blushing madly, and dismissed that thought as well, and tried to sleep...
15211111111111111111111111111111.title: Finally free?

152111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The man woke up after he went down in the battle in the huge dungeon. He was aware that he was now in a small cage with a bar strange band around his head. He went to pull it off, but no matter how hard he pulled, it stayed in the same spot. He knew he needed out, but was surprised that there was no security. He was sitting there, still cloaked, witt a mysterious band over his head. He decided to take care of the cage first, band later. He began to form an ice blade to cut through, but electricity shot out of the band, zapping him until he cut off the magic. He decided to try once more so he could escape.

He was zapped more strongly as he continued and began to scream in pain and curl up in a ball. He cut off the magic, after barely damaging one bar. He heard the door open but didn't even shift. He just held himself in his position until he saw a hand simply open the cage from the top. He managed to crawl away but was soon picked up. He was then face-to-face with the princess.

"I'm sorry. They wouldn't let you stay if you could still use your magic." He remained silent and turned away, seeing a cast over her wrist and hand. She sighed a bit and set him back into the cage.

"I didn't want anyone kidnapped, but things just didn't work out at all. I'm sorry." She said that and then walked over to her bed and laid down. The messenger, in this time, had only seen part of it. That was the tortured screaming, the man in a cage, and Joana walking up with a broken wrist. He went back to the town Blake and his gang were staying in and told them what he saw.
152111111111111111111111111111111.title: Freedom For Some.  Captivity For One.

1521111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Some time earlier...

It was the day after the escape, Blake got up when the sun shone over the tree, and got off it. Tabitha followed him, and he went to buy some food for him and his cat, he wasn't in the mood for hunting as he always did, Tabitha noticed this, and tried to comfort him by rubbing her head against his side, he smiled at her and petted her head, but Tabitha could sense that that smile was empty...

After what happened, and the fact that he was sort of hunt like any other animal, made Blake's mood gloomier... Also, the fact that their mysterious savior wasn't in the village yet stung in Blake's mind. He hated when something for him implied something bad for someone else. His grandma died to save him and Ferdinand... his father also died because he hid his very existence (Lith didn't tell him this, but is grandma told him in a more vague way). Blake arrived to a shop and bought some meat and some fruit juice.

Even the shopkeeper noticed Blake's mood , and despite he didn't know him, asked politely about it, Blake said it was just something from his job, and that he didn't want to talk further about it. He went back to where the tree, and sat under its shadow, eating and drinking, although he wasn't enjoying it at all. Until the messenger arrived, and noticed him immediately

-"Sir!! I've got news!! Bad ones!! The g..."- He started to say, but Blake covered his mouth and said

-"Tell me, but not here. Let's go somewhere else..."- Blake and the messenger started to walk toward the nearby forest and after getting a good enough distance, he said

-"Alright, what happened?"-

-"It's not very clear... but they're torturing the man..."- The messenger said, Blake grunted at that, then he added -"Also, it seems that the giant princess has a broken arm or something..."-

Blake's mind flashed back into his memories...

Some time after rescuing Aranza, and months before he was forced to leave... The girl followed Blake around nearly all day, and wanted to be like him as well, despite being 2 years older. Blake found that she was a decently trained sword fighter, and wielded a nodachi (longer katana-like sword, at least 90 cm). Despite Blake and Ferdinand didn't want her to get involved into their mercenary jobs, she kept appearing, and at least ended up being helpful, in circumstances Blake and Ferdinand alone weren't enough, this was the first moment Blake thought of not only a mercenary duo, but a mercenary squad. He'd think about that later, but wouldn't enroll Aranza for such a job. She was the count's daughter... and it looked rather weird that she acted between typical girl and warrior-tomboyish girl...

However, after realizing that she would go to missions with them anyway, he and Ferdinand stopped trying to keep her from that. One of those days, they were fighting a group of rebel warriors, who used their abilities to steal and destroy whatever it was in their way. Blake decided to go ahead and have Ferdinand and Aranza in reserve. He engaged 6 of them at once, and was having a difficult time (Blake was 11 years old by that time). And he was about to be slashed from behind when Ferdinand blocked the incoming sword with his scythe, and helped Blake fighting, then, realizing it was only Ferdinand, he looked to where Aranza was, alone, and other 6 warriors were attacking her...

-"Ferdinand, you idiot!! You left Aranza alone!!"- Blake shouted angrily, and Ferdinand also looked toward her. They could do nothing to help her... unless... Blake took the decision, and while fighting one-handed, used his other hand to remove the weighted metal rings around his wrists and ankles. When he was done, pounded on the ground with his sword, knocking his opponents off their feet and rushed toward the other warriors and Aranza. Blake punched and kicked them with tremendous force, but it was a bit too late...

Aranza got badly slashed, and her right arm was nearly cut completely. Ferdinand was horrified, and not many things really freaked him out. Blake performed the healing spell on her (Ferdinand was unable to do this, as it was a light spell), but fell unconscious before completing it. he healed her whole body, and most of her arms, regenerating almost everything but the bone, which wasn't as damaged...

She ended up with a wound equivalent to a broken shoulder, and Blake never forgave himself for that, despite she acted cheerful and even kept training using her left hand to wield her sword. Blake also gave Ferdinand the scolding of his life. And he laughed, because even if it was a reckless thing, he knew why Blake got angered.. In the end, nobody blamed them, and Aranza even promised that she'd become stronger so she wouldn't get hurt so easily. Blake facepalmed himself when heard her, not imagining a girl with red waist length hair as a warrior... she looked more like she was, a member of nobility.

-"You should leave these jobs to people who doesn't matter..."- Blake said in a serious tone to her, but she broke the seriousness by playfully pushing him aside...

The image of when she got her arm nearly completely cut was what haunted Blake for a long while, and just recently had gotten over it to a decent extent... now... Joana's situation reminded him of that day... It was his fault, because he was so persistent on escaping by any means, he was really desperate, but who could blame him? Not much people would marry an unknown girl who, besides anything, was much larger than average houses, or even mansions...

-"Sir?"- The messenger asked, and Blake snapped out of his thoughts, and answered

-"Alright... I'll go to save that man myself... Don't tell my friends. If they ask, I'm doing something personal... and if I'm not back here in 2 days, I either died or failed"- Blake said and wrote a note in a piece of scroll (he carried several ones to quickly send a message to whoever it was necessary). The message read

'To Ferdinand, Gustave, Ayrton and Caesar: If you're reading this, it means that it's been over 2 days after I went on a personal mission. I intended to rescue the man who helped us, but by this time, I'm probably imprisoned or dead. Don't go back to that giantess village, and go somewhere else, wherever you may get a job. Keep the team alive, that would be my only last will...

There's not much more I'd write. I've lived for 17 years... I've done many things, and didn't do many more. I've made mistakes I will never make up for... And I've regretted for many things I didn't do at their time... People who knows me knows different things about me... but that doesn't really matter... Guys,it was nice to meet you, all of you.... and it was my pleasure to have worked with all of you for all these years...'

Blake ended by adding his sign, and gave it to the messenger.

-"After two days, if I'm not here, give this to them. Don't let them find out before the two days... That's the last thing I'd ask from you. Thank you very much for everything"- Blake shook hands with the messenger, and started to walk, heading for the giantess village...
1521111111111111111111111111111111.title: Blake's decision...

choices: What happens next?  Hint: It isn't nothing.
15211111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The man, of course, was now stuck. Joana, to pass the time, called in her black-haired friend, who he learned was named Taylor, and they were talking. She asked why she chose to keep him from the dungeon, and she said it was because he would be tortured.

"Why does it matter? He attacked us." Joana replied with something that he didn't think a single giantess would have seen.

"He attacked us to protect and save some people he cares about. Didn't you attack them because you care about me?" Taylor stopped to think.

"But they broke your wrist..." Joana smiled a bit.

"Actually I did that. I went to avoid that beam and forgot about the drop." Taylor finally gave up. The topic went to other things that girls do end up talking about, and the man, though bored, still didn't shift. As Taylor walked out she stopped by the cage and whispered

"Looks like I misjudged you little guy." and walked out the door. Joana followed, and opened the cage.

"Can I see your face?" She asked quietly.

"No." Was the man's reply.

"Why not?" The man smirked under the dark hood.

"There is only one person who I have let live who has seen under my hood." Joana stopped but respected his wishes. The next two days were nearly silent, until Blake showed up in the dead of the night.

"I can't believe it. You trying to return the favor?" Blake nodded.

"I heard they were torturing you."

"Where'd you hear that? Seems you should check your sources." The man stood.

"Let's go." He started to walk and Blake began to follow, but turned away.

"What are you doing?" The man motioned to him to get back to him.

"Fixing something I did."
15211111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue...

choices: Speaking of Blake, what's he doing?
152111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The man nodded to Blake.

"Do what you have to. You have a week to get to the village. I'll tell the others you don't want to be rescued." Blake starts heading towards Joana's rook and the man says

"One week. Find a way out." The man leaves Blake to his own issues and heads towards the village. So much had gone wrong. This village had become a necessary backup plan. It was supposed to be get in, cause a distraction, get out with Blake. But no. Joana and Taylor had to go up to the cliff. They needed to go catch them. The man was angry that his plan had been ruined by a simple walk. He arrived at the village. He walked to the inn and saw the gang at a table. They mostly ate in silence. The man gave them the news of Blake. A mix of emotions passed over the group.

"I was also warned that if we get caught again we are going to be killed. It's all up to Blake."
152111111111111111111111111111111111.title: What happens next?  Hint: It isn't nothing.

1521111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
[NOTE: I hadn't written it, but Blake has been all the time wearing his hood, which shadows his eyes and the upper half of his face. This prevents anyone from seeing Blake's scar in the right eye]

-"Why did he say you didn't want to be rescued?"- Joana asked Blake

-"Don't get me wrong. It's just that there's something I must do before leaving..."- Blake did some quick movements with his hands, then, he said -"Shine, sun's gentle glow, 10 days of spring, heal, stop the bleeding, close the wounds with nature's touch..."-

Joana's arm was illuminated by golden light, and it gave her a warm and pleasant feeling, meanwhile, her broken bone, damaged muscle and everything was being regenerated. She noticed that Blake was putting a lot of effort into healing her, and she reasoned that healing a giant would be much more energy consuming than healing several people...

-"Wait a minute!! How can a human perform an advanced light spell?!! Light magic is exclusive to giants!!"- Taylor was very surprised when she noticed what Blake was doing

-"Really?"- Joana was surprised, as she temporarily forgot about Blake's real nature, but soon she remembered about it

-"Well, it seems that it's not anymore. Not that I care..."- Blake said, and headed for the window, but Taylor stood in front of him

-"Where do you think you're going?"-

-"I'm done. I'm leaving..."-

-"What do you mean?!"- Taylor asked in an angry tone

-"I just came to fix what I did wrong. I never said I was going to stay and be married..."-

-"But... but..."- Taylor was confused

-"She got hurt because of me. I came to fix that. Now, we're all even, I don't owe you anything, nor you owe me anything. I shall leave and we'll never meet ever again, I promise..."- Blake resumed walking toward the window, but Taylor extended her hand in front of him, to which Blake replied

-"Fine..."- He extended his right arm (toward the right) and closed his eyes. His sword came back to his hand, and both giant girls were surprised by this. Taylor knew that it was another advanced spell, but Blake bypassed the incantation, something that only sages were said to be able to do... Taylor was starting to wonder who was really this human...

-"Your princess has done me no wrong. But if you try to prevent me from leaving, I'll fight..."- Blake dashed toward the window, and anticipated that Taylor would try to catch him in her hand, which he dodged. Then, he disappeared, and quickly reappeared behind Taylor. She reacted by turning around very quickly and fired a white light ball at him, which Blake deflected with his hand. Taylor then muttered

-"Power of light, bind the foe, spare his life and tie the ropes"- She fired two ropes made of golden light, but much to her dismay, Blake was able to catch both of them in his hands, and they shattered.

-"Impossible!!"- Taylor shouted (She was a medium-high class light magician, which meant not many people would be able to break her spells so easily), then, Blake said

-"Golden shine, brighter than thunder, disable my enemy, by piercing their nerves... Paralyze, Seven Solar Spears!!"- He shot a beam that split into 7 spears made of pure golden light (which by the way was another thing that alarmed Taylor even more, as using golden light energy implied that the user was someone very powerful), and they pierced, 2 through her shoulders, 2 pierced her knees, 2 pierced her hands, and the last one pierced her chest. Although they didn't cause physical damage, they paralyzed the black haired giant girl completely, only her vital functions were untouched. Then Blake headed calmly outside...
1521111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Light Magic vs Light Magic

15211111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The man returned to the group. They were hopeculiar until seeing that Blake didn't follow. The man said only

"He is righting what is wrong." No further explanation followed. He left the group on their own to sleep. They mourned the very possible loss of their leader. At the same time a man was watching Blake finish Taylor. After binding the giant girl he begins to leave. He drops in next to Blake. He is wearing a black trench coat that covers his entire body.

"Hello Blake." He walks closer to him, looking around.

"Fighting with simple peasant girls, eh? Maybe I will serve as more of a challenge." He immediately begins to float into the air and throws his arms wide. The trench coat falls, which leaves the man in a black suit of extremely light, but just as strong armor. He looks to Blake, purple eyes and shoulder length black hair that falls in a ponytail, which makes no bash to how imposing he looks. Blake is still confident he can beat the man.

"My friend in the cloak won't be there to save you. Now you fight alone." The man smashes into Blake with surprising speed, sending him into the wall and leaving a dent where he hit. Blake solemnly removes the metal rings that restrain is strength and rushes at the man. He sends a black beam into his chest and he flies back into the wall. Blake fores his own beam but the man dodges it. Blake fires many more, each either deflected or dodged. Until one hits the man. He steps back and laughs.

"You are weak. Look, you are tired already." Blake was beginning to show strain from his fighting. The man charges at him, first tricking him with a fake punch and hitting him with a real one, which leads to a combo of about twelve punches and kicks. The man finally throws him into the air and them flies into him, careening them both down to the ground. Blake lies defeated and the man stands. The man leans in and whispers in his ear.

"There is no fighting destiny." He smashes Blake's face, leaving him unconscious.

"Start the wedding tomorrow. He wont be able to escape in time." The man flies out the window as if he never existed.
15211111111111111111111111111111111111.title: It Takes Two To Tango

choices: Back to the village where Blake's gang has been staying...
152111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After some time, Blake's spell wore off, and Taylor was no longer immobilized, Joana had picked Blake up, and was staring at him with a sad look, Tayor asked

-"Hey, what's wrong? You're going to marry him after all!!"- Karina had told them that because of the sudden attack, they'd need at least 2 or 3 days to repair the damage done to the coourtyard and heal the servants that got hurt in the conflict...

-"I feel bad for him... He didn't really want this to happen, and just because he came to heal my wrist he ended up like this... He could've just left and never come back, and the other man would've been executed... I think he came to save him..."-

-"Meh... It was his own decision..."- Taylor shrugged

-"He'll hate me..."- Joana said, looking down

-"If you want you can have him prisoner in the dungeon, only to get him whenever you feel like it..."- Taylor said, and Joana looked at her with a disgusted look

-"Why has it to be like this? We took this guy without asking him anything and we're forcing him to renounce to his life, and everything else... I don't feel this is right..."-

-"Whatever he used to do can't be better than living here... if he doesn't do anything stupid, he can live comfortably here..."- Taylor replied

-"I don't think he would like it. He liked his previous lifestyle a lot..."-

-"Well, sucks to be him then... I'm sure other guys would kill to marry a princess and live like a king... He has to be real stupid to despise such a life..."-

Joana sighed in defeat, she knew nobody cared about other than their own species. She had got to know a bit of Blake, and she already felt he was someone who didn't do his job for the money, but rather for the living style... something that it would be taken away from him against his own will...

Blake was secured with a double binding spell by Karina and Taylor. However, Joana still took him with her, and said she'd go out for a walk. She looked for Blake's mother, a seemingly lonely woman called Lith. It took her a while but she found her house. Lith was surprised to see the princess... After Joana explained briefly what was going on, Lith asked

-"I see... he came back to heal you... now, where is he?"-

-"Here..."- Joana took him out of her skirt pocket and showed him to her, and felt ashamed of Blake's mother seeing him tied with light ropes -"Someone beat him up, and he won't wake up... he also told us to do the wedding tomorrow..."-

-"He didn't get to recover properly..."- Lith mumbled

-"Also... I'm a bit afraid..."- Joana said

-"Huh?"- Lith asked with a confused tone

-"Taylor and maybe the others will suspect of him... everyone saw him using light magic... and Taylor said he used advanced spells, even bypassing the incantations sometimes... I know he's your son... which means he is... a..."-

-"I know..."- Lith sighed -"A hybrid..."-

-"What if everyone wants him dead because of that?"- Joana asked, genuinely worried

-"Karina already knows, and I doubt anyone would interfere... in fact, it'd be better to know that you'll be married to someone who won't die by accidents... Ask any woman my age or older and they'll tell you what was like when their human husbands lived..."-

-"What happened to them?"-

-"They were killed by the King's Elites... The very same ones that killed all other Zasshu hybrids..."-

-"Uh..."- Joana didn't know what to say, but Lith patted her shoulder, comforting her

-"Don't worry. What already happened can't be changed..."- Lith said -"By the way... you haven't told me the real reason you're here for... I doubt you just came to visit me..."-

Joana looked down, sighed, and said

-"I came to ask you... to deny your consent on Blake marrying me..."-

-"Why?"-

-"Because I got to know a few things he told me himself... he liked very much his lifestyle... and I'm nobody to take it away from him... Anyway, he'd hate me for it..."-

-"I'm afraid I can't..."-

-"Why? If it's about the money, don't worry, you won't have yo pay anything... it's just that I feel bad ruining Blake's life..."-

Lith put her hand on Joana's shoulder, and gave her a serious look

-"Tell me something. Why would you care so much about him? Why did you bother to come here to practically ask me to cancel the wedding?"-

Joana blushed, and looked down nervously

-"I... I just..."-

-"It's alright. I trust you. You'll be a good wife..."- Lith said

-"N-No... it's not that!! It's just... well... I don't know how to explain it..."- Joana was blushing a lot

-"I know it's just been like a week... but I see you already have certain feelings for him..."- Lith laughed -"Don't feel ashamed. It's just that I went though almost the same... I recognize that look..."-

-"Uh..."-

-"Also... my son needs to learn some things... like to see through appearances..."- Lith added, and Joana blinked twice, she remembered that Blake had stated he didn't like anyone in particular, but he would never choose a giant... which had saddened her previously... however, now Joana reacted with a mixture of anger and embarrassment

-"Does that mean you're using me as a punishment?!"-

-"Of course not... you're a nice girl. Blake just needs to realize of that himself... He didn't tell me, but since I first saw him, I felt he needed love in his life... And you can be the one to give him that..."-

Joana's face was nearly as red as a tomato after hearing Lith saying that.

-"So... don't worry... you won't be doing anything wrong... and if you want, you can blame it on me. Blake was angry at me anyway..."- Lith said, and Joana perceived the very slight sadness in Lith's talk. Joana knew she wouldn't deny her consent, so, there was nothing else to be done. She said goodbye to Lith and left. When she walked outside, Lith said to her, laughing

-"Tell Blake I want at least a grandchild!!"-

Joana just waved goodbye, and blushed even more. After she walked some distance, and her redness disappeared, she muttered to Blake, to whom she was holing in her cupped hands

-"I'm sorry. There's nothing else I can do..."- Joana still felt bad about Blake, but tried to calm down and listen to what Lith said...
152111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Joana tries one more time to stop the wedding...

1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The man had basically ran from the giantess village to the nearby town, and woke up to Blake's friends packing.

"That leader of yours needs saving a lot, huh?" Ferdinand gave him a look.

"This is probably a lost cause." The group seemed to be mostly angry at him for saying that.

"But definitely worth fighting for. Get packed while I go get horses. Ferdinand, you ride Tabitha. We are getting Blake back if we need to storm the place to save him."

An hour later the gang sat on horses, preparing to travel once more to a place they hoped could remain a bad memory. They traveled fast, pushing the horses to keep up a fast pace for a long time. As the sun came down they stop under a small group of trees. The group eventually rifts off to sleep, but the man stays awake. He walks a long ways away and begins powering up. The band around his head begins to overload him but he continues until the pain seems unbearable and the band snaps down the middle. The man is not finished yet and begins his next fight of the night.

He takes a few deep breaths as a light blue symbol forms on the ground, steadily growing and glowing brighter. A flash of light comes and a golem of ice is left standing there.

"Prove your worth or find peace in death!" the golem's voice is nearly a whisper and can only be heard in the man's mind. He pulls out his swords and feels a vertigo as the world blurs by, leaving him in a desolate, icy wasteland.

"Should I be freed, we can rule the world make it like this, make it perfect." The golem now stands fuller and stronger than before due to it being in its home element.

"No. You were sealed for a reason. You had your time to rule. Now the world can be at it's delicate extremes, the way it was meant to be."

The man is now in combat position, his feet steady and solid on the frozen ground.

"I WILL HAVE MY SECOND ICE AGE!" The golem charges, spikes jutting out at the hands, shoulders, and feet. Its eyes glow white, blazing with rage. The man steps out of the path of a clawed hand, throwing a knife into the golem's back and jumping away. The golem holds its arms out and begins firing ice shards at an extremely fast rate. The man brings up a shield of ice that collects the shards and then fires them back in one burst. Ice shards collect and the golem takes a sluggish step back. The man looks at the golem who begins walking to him. Then.....
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Try, Try Again

choices: What's Blake been doing these last two days?
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The golem is walking closer to the man, who hasn't moved from his spot. During the time, he had been preparing a few trap spells for the golem. They were simple, but effective to stop him from being beaten to a pulp or having to move away from this extra icy patch of land. The golem took a step and realized too late as the ground flew up in a catapult motion.

The golem went back about forty feet, not too far, but enough to buy time. If his plan works, the golem should go down with two spells and a powerful thrust of his sword. The man had drained all the ice out of this patch and continued moving, collecting the ice in a cavern below. He drained a second patch of ice. With another, he would be ready. The man fires off an ice harpoon, which smashed into the golem's head. It pulled it out and laughed.

"Running away and using traps? Are you scared of me?"The man smiled as he finished gathering ice.

"No. You should be afraid of me." The man raised his arm as a mass of ice rose from the ground. It was about ten feet around and the man smashed it into the golem's back, rocketing it to him. He takes out a sword and pulls it back, waiting for the moment. He thrusts it with all his strength and it hits the golem in a weak spot formed by the javelin. The sword pierces the golem's head and the man feels the world blur again and he stands once again near the camp. He walks back and goes to sleep.
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Only Memories Remain

1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
2 days earlier...

After Joana's last attempt at stopping the wedding, she had no other option other than going back to the castle and rest. the next day, she woke up, and found Blake was still seemingly unconscious, she poked him very lightly with her finger, and he moved a bit, which relieved her, she knew he was sleeping. She laid back on her bed, as she had nothing to do, Karina told her to stay inside and to spend time with Blake for the two days that were left, she didn't have much hopes of Blake changing his mind but at least get him to accept the idea...

Of course, Joana didn't agree, but could do nothing about it. Some minutes later, Blake woke up, just to find he was tied with 2 light based spells. He then noticed he was inside Joana's room, and that she was laying on her bed. Blake analyzed briefly the spells, and said

-"Tch... Is this the best those girls can do?"- He closed his eyes, and the light ropes shattered, as well as the light chains. Joana noticed this and quickly sat up. Blake, without even looking at her, said

-"Don't even bother saying anything. I'm outta here..."-

-"But... Blake... You'll get hurt..."- Joana said

-"Meh. A bunch of giants isn't enough to stop me..."- Blake just walked toward the window, and pushed it open, then, he proceeded to go outside, but after taking 5 steps, he started to get electroshocked, and fell down to the window's base, as he didn't get to jump out of it. He tried to crawl but he kept being electroshocked, and Joana quickly got up and picked him up

-"I was trying to tell you..."-

-"What the hell?!!"-

-"They used an old spell to keep you captive..."- Joana explained -"Karina wanted us to spend some time... uh... before... the wedding..."- Joana said hesitantly, and Blake said

-"That's it!! I don't care about the pain, I'm definitively outta here!!"- Blake stood up, checked if he had the rings on (they were still in his pocket) took some steps back, and dashed outside, however, doing so also triggered an alarm that that was placed by another spell, Karina was alerted by it, and called Claire and several other servants outside, Karina yelled

-"What the hell do you think you're doing?! How did you break from that double seal?!!"-

-" 1, I'm leaving, and 2, That's none of your business..."-

-"I'm going to count to 5, and if you're not inside that castle, I..."- Karina said, charging up a white energy ball, but she felt a slashing pain in her right cheek, and noticed Blake had fired a golden beam, and had disappeared, next thing he did was to punch Claire in the stomach, then, he hit another servant's back of the neck. Karina shot the white light ball at him but Blake deflected it back, and added two of his own (again, his are golden). When Blake landed on the floor, he started to get electroshocked, but he jumped, as he had found the spell's weakness, it only worked as long as he stood on the ground.

Another female servant started chanting a light spell, but Blake punched her in the back of the neck, and jumped again, this time, he was surrounded by 4 servants, and Karina, who had gotten up. Blake was in a giant tree's branch. The girls aimed their hands at him and charged up white light beams, and fired them, but Blake stopped all of them at once with his bare hands, and absorbed them through them. He glowed in a golden aura and his body got healed.

Blake then performed another spell without incantation, and formed a bow made of light. With it, he fired several light arrows at the giant servants at amazing speed. Blake then disappeared and reappeared behind Karina, and hit the back of her neck with his knee. Then, he did quick moves with his hands, and said

-"Golden shine, brighter than thunder, disable my enemy, by piercing their nerves... Paralyze, Seven Solar Spears!!"- He had summoned the same spell he used against Taylor some time ago. The light spears hit her hands, knees, shoulders and chest, and paralyzed Karina completely. Blake took impulse to jump to a nearby tree, and barely had time to dodge a huge light beam, it was Joana's black haired friend, Taylor, was still standing, and wasn't going to let him go so easily.

Blake knew he had to do something, but also, more servants came, and the ones he had knocked out were getting up... this was not good... Taylor then said

-"Why don't you just give up already? There's nothing you can do!! You're gonna marry the princess and that's all!!"-

Taylor's phrase was like the last straw for Blake's mind. He answered firmly

-"Never!! I am a proud low class* warrior!! I will fight until the last moment!!"- Blake then sighed, and muttered

-"Shining light of the heavens, burn the enemy, using my soul, destroy, incinerate them down to ashes..."- Blake then jumped from the tree toward Taylor, while added -"Golden Blade Cremation!!"-

Taylor opened her eyes wide, as she thought Blake was bluffing... the spell he had done was one of the most powerful ones among light magic, also, it required the user's life, thus, it was known as a "Sacrificial Spell". Blake's grandma had taught it to him but she told him not to use it unless it was a real emergency, and this was a real emergency to Blake. Blake's grandma used a dark analog version of it to save him and Ferdinand from the angry crowd...

From above, a giant sword made of golden light landed right on Taylor, and created a colossal explosion that engulfed her and the servants (about 15, counting Karina), after the light and smoke vanished, Blake was surprised to find himself to be alive, as he knew that if he used that spell he would die... he muttered

-"I... I... did it... at last..."- Blake coughed up blood, but stubbornly he started walking away (By this point, the spell that kept him captive was nullified when Karina took such enormous damage). Blake was limping, but still, he felt like the luckiest man in the world, he had meant to die while taking the giants with him, but instead, he survived. He walked some more, but then, Lith appeared suddenly before him (Using a similar high speed technique to that of Blake, high level magicians of any element have this ability, although in difference of all of them, Blake does it with just raw strength)

-"Dammit..."- Blake muttered

-"I can't believe you used that spell to escape the wedding!!"- Lith sounded disappointed and angry

-"You're nobody to tell me what's good or wrong!! You sold me out!!"- Blake shouted, and coughed more blood

-"I'm trying to teach you a lesson..."-

-"That giants are evil? I already knew that..."- Blake fell to the ground, with no more strength to stand on his feet, Lith picked him up

-"You can't judge someone by their appearance or size..."-

-"You're not the best example... Anyway, if I wanted I may learn that, but not marrying a giant girl!!"-

-"Why not?"-

-"Because I don't want to!! I want my life back!! As it used to be, with my friends, missions, and nothing of these stupid things to worry about!!"-

However, Lith wouldn't change her mind, the fact that he used a fatal spell meant Blake didn't value his life enough. She knew Blake would be very angry at her, and maybe not speak to her ever again, but she knew she was doing the right thing. Blake noticed she was walking toward the castle, and drew his sword, and saying no words, stabbed himself through the chest, much to Lith's shock.

-"There's more honor in dying as a warrior than in living as a slave..."- Blake muttered very silently, and fell unconscious, expecting death. It was a decision he had made while he traveled to do things right (saving the mysterious man and healing Joana), that if he failed to escape, the only way to really escape would be to take away something not even they could get back, his life...


*It's been said several times that mercenaries were usually seen as low class, and even some of them were people who failed at making it to the Royal Elites, although Blake and his friends are on par with almost any Elite Squadron.
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: What's Blake been doing these last two days?

1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
However... he woke up... in Joana's room once again... He was bandaged, and inside a bowl filled with herbal water. He noticed that his sword was still next to him, but he still felt angry at failing even at killing himself. He noticed Joana wasn't in her bed, and he turned around, she was sitting in a chair, near the table the bowl was on. He felt that he had very little strength left, and even standing up was a bit of struggle. He put his black cape on (it was laid next to him, completely intact, as he didn't damage it when he stabbed himself) and grabbed his sword, he said nothing but started to walk away, then it was when Joana spoke

-"Your mother was very worried about you... She used her best healing spells to keep you alive..."-

-"I don't care. I'm still leaving..."- Blake answered

-"Why did you try to kill yourself?"- Joana sounded like she was about to cry, but this only annoyed Blake, as he thought it was none of her business, and that he should be the upset one. Still, he replied

-"Because dying as a warrior is better than living as a slave. Someone without freedom is as good as dead. That's a lesson your princess life will never teach you... Even when you apparently have everything, you lack that freedom... And that's why you'll never understand my reasons... I'll just tell you, that if I'm gonna die, I'll die as what I am, a warrior... a free warrior, not some girl's slave..."-

-"You don't have enough strength to survive outside... You can barely walk..."-

-"Why do you care? To you, I'm just another slave, and you already have a lot..."-

-"I care because despite what you think, I appreciate life. I never agreed to Karina paying the sand bandits to capture someone and I never agreed to have that someone forced to marry me..."-

-"Yeah, sure..."- Blake was still walking away, and jumped from the table, although he fell, because his legs, as well as the rest of his body, were heavily weakened. Joana stood up and walked, standing before Blake, she sighed and said, looking down, staring at him

-"I also tried to convince your mother to deny her consent... But she didn't listen to me..."-

Blake was briefly with a surprised look, but soon he regained composure and said

-"I don't believe you..."- Right in that moment, Blake froze, as he realized Joana MET his mother...

-"What would I gain if I lied?"- Joana asked, but she got no answer, Blake was now frozen, realizing that if Joana met his mother, that means that she knows he's a hybrid... Joana stared at him, and somehow knew what he was thinking, and she said

-"Yes, I know your mother is a giant... what's wrong with that?"-

-"I've been told that if anyone found ever what I really am, I'd be executed, although my grandma never told me what exactly was I in the first place..."- Blake said, feeling unable to do anything by this moment, Joana felt bad for him, she remembered being taught that the human king ordered a genocide of all hybrids...

-"Nobody's going to kill you here..."- Joana tried to calm Blake, or help him in some way

-"Yet, my life is going to be thrown to waste... death is not so bad after fighting so many battles... as I said, it's preferable to die free than to live enslaved..."-

-"If you die you're not getting your old life back. You lose whatever you liked..."- Joana said, and Blake stopped

-"SHUT UP!! You have NO IDEA about what's life!!"- Blake was very angry at her for saying he'd lose anyway -"I don't have to stand this..."- Blake tried to run, but his muscles failed, and wounds opened in his ankles, result of the weakening from the sacrificial spell. He also coughed more blood, but he spat it out, and crawled, muttering

-"No wound is gonna stop me!!"- Blake's body was suffering from a hellish pain, which was worse than when he stabbed himself, but he stubbornly kept on trying to escape, and more wounds opened in his torso and arms, the bandages changed to red from his intense bleeding, while Blake still crawled toward the window. He managed to stand up and jump, but when he landed, he fainted from the effort and the immense pain, that not even he could handle. Joana picked him up, and put him in the herbal water once again, but this time, used a weakened version of the light ropes spell to bind Blake's wrists and ankles with small ropes, which were proportionate to him

After that, she laid on her bed, and cried silently, for the pain she was causing, and that she was unable to remedy it. She felt really guilty about having Blake forced to marry her, and knew he'd hate her if he was forced to stay alive and with her. She was mad at Karina for having someone to marry her, and for hiring the sand bandits to get a strong person that might withstand living with giants... although she knew Karina's intention was to accomplish what she was ordered to, and that if she failed, she'd fall into dishonor for letting the Royal Family die out...

So, she was between 2 bad situations, and her attempts at fixing the mess failed (telling Karina to release Blake, and trying to have Lith denying her consent). She also felt bad because Blake returned to save the man who led his friends to save him, and because he felt guilty about hurting her, the only giantess he believed innocent at the time. Blake could have chosen not to return and let the man die... but his attitude showed that Blake respected others' lives as well, as long as they didn't mess with him of course. Joana had seen part of this, that Blake was noble and actually nicer than he seems, but the circumstances put them as enemies, at least from Blake's point of view...
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: However... Blake wakes up...

1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Blake woke up, again, almost at midnight... this time he was tied with light ropes, however, they were white, and were thinner than Taylor's, he saw Joana sleeping, and guessed she did that. His whole body still ached, although the wounds closed. He sighed, knowing he wouldn't be able to get up, and went back to sleep, as he didn't want to think about what's going to happen if he stays there for too long.

Blake would've liked to get revenge on all the giantesses, and knew many mercenaries would give it a try for the giant food and coins, but at the same time, he wanted to get away from there and never come back, which was also more realistic to do, although if he got someone else to tell some bad thing about them, the King might lead a war against them. He fell asleep thinking about that...

Blake woke up once again, this time, by the feeling of someone pulling his arm, and when he opened his eyes, it was Tabitha, and his friends had just come in, and used their elemental spells to create an explosion, and got out of there. Running away on horses, while Blake and Ferdinand rode on Tabitha. Blake noticed the mysterious man ahead of them, who, without turning his head, said

-"Your friends are really good ones"-

Blake nodded in response, as they kept getting away. 2 days and many hours later, by sunset, they were away enough, and stopped in the nearest village they found. Blake was a bit surprised about escaping being so easy, but thought it was just a lot of luck. He petted Tabitha's head several times, in relief of escaping from being married to a giant girl. They went into an inn, and Blake was asked by his friends what happened, and he only spoke about the battle he nearly won. Blake's friends wanted to know a bit more about Blake's days as captive (they didn't know the full reasons Blake went back there) but he refused to tell further, then they heard a voice

-"I can't believe it... Blake, the mercenary leader, prisoner?"- Everyone turned to where the voice came from, and they were really surprised

-"Anthony... what are you doing here?"- Blake said

-"Is that the way to greet an old friend?"- Anthony then got up and laughed, and said -"You haven't changed at all"- He walked toward Blake and his friends' table

-"Yeah, I've been told so..."- Blake said -"I thought you were with the Elites"-

-"I am. I'm now a Major"- Anthony then sat in another seat with Blake and his friends

-"Congratulations"- Blake's friends said, not too cheerfully, as the Elites usually looked down on almost everyone else

-"I was taking a break here, after a mission... we were sent to investigate on abnormal activities..."- Anthony said

-"Like what?"- Blake asked

-"Well, some massive demonstrations of energy were sighted like a week ago... The King said that if the Sand Bandits or such someone is getting that strong, he, she or them might be a threat..."-

Blake looked at the table thoughtfully, and said to Anthony

-"I have some things to talk to you... in private..."- Blake said, he and Anthony got up and went outside. They walked toward the forest, and Anthony crossed his arms

-"What's going on, Blake?"-

-"Can I still trust you?"- Blake asked

-"Of course!! Don't let this armor fool you, you're still my friend!!"-

-"I want you to swear that you're not going to reveal who am I, or my friends, nor how you got this information..."- Blake said, with a very serious look

-"Of course I wouldn't betray a friend. What's up?"-

-"Well... Actually, me and the guys were involved in the incident you're after"-

-"Really?"-

-"We had been working at Kildevar for a while, and when we got a day off, we went to the forest and have lunch, but the Sand Bandits attacked us"-

-"It seems they were no match for you"- Anthony tried to cheer Blake up, but Blake looked down

-"We lost to them... they used some sort of paralyzing venom during the fight... But that's not all"-

-"Huh?"-

-"The Sand Bandits aren't the real threat... there's something you're not going to believe"-

-"What?"-

-"Giants... they were the ones who paid the bandits to catch us"-

-"Giants? I was taught they were extinct!!"-

-"They aren't, believe me"-

-"I don't know, Blake... it's a bit weird"-

-"What would I gain by lying to you?"-

-"You have a point"- Anthony scratched his chin

-"The giants are the real threat, they paid the bandits to catch us"-

-"Why? Did I miss the day you attacked a giant?"-

-"We NEVER messed with them, hell, we didn't even know such beings existed... but they are evil... truly evil... They paid the bandits to get them slaves, and were after strong people so they could carry on tasks for giant people"-

-"Whoah"-

-"Yeah. In the end, only I was sold, my friends were bought by someone else, who freed them... and they rescued me... but the point is, the giants must not exist anymore"-

-"This is something big... heh, no pun intended"- Anthony laughed at his unintentional joke, then went back to serious mood -"Do you know where are they hiding?"-

-"Yeah, but it'll take a while to get there. We need a lot of resources and a great force"-

-"We?"-

-"If you get a great force to fight them, I'll fight as well. I'm gonna take revenge on these people... I am no man's slave, let alone a woman's"-

-"Woman? Are you not telling me something?"-

Blake sighed, then he said -"They are mostly female, but don't let that fool you. They're evil... and they have also know some magic. They'll be dangerous..."-

-"You better not be lying, Blake... I'll go back to report on this..."- Anthony walked with Blake, and Anthony got on a light brown horse, and left. Blake then heard a voice

-"Are you sure on what you did?"- It was the mysterious man that saved him

-"How long have you been here?"-

-"Long enough. Anyway, thanks for not mentioning me. But I still ask... are you sure on what you've just done? Will you unleash and participate in what seems to be going to be a genocide?"-

-"Yeah. I'm not forgiving those damn giants!! They are just giant beasts!!"- Blake said, clenching his fists (Nobody so far, other than Blake himself knows Blake's mother is a giant)

-"Not all of them were, Blake, and you know it..."- The man said, Blake immediately thought of Joana, but he replied

-"Sucks to be them then. It's not my problem... But I won't let live anyone from their kind"-

-"Was really that evil that they tried to get you married to their princess?"-

-"H-how the hell do you know?!"-

-"Me and your friends actually listened a bit of Joana's conversation with her friend Taylor... also, she mentioned that it was what you were bought for..."-

-"Well, yeah. It is evil to get me married to anyone by force..."-

-"A species desperate for survival, trying to not die out... and this is what they'll get?"- The man asked

-"You know nothing about them. They're just a bunch of wild beasts..."-

-"I'm sorry, but if you are going to fight them, I won't help you... I won't get stained by innocent blood..."-

-"Are you saying you'll be on their side after they were to execute you?"-

-"No. I won't be on anyone's side..."- The man sighed -"But, Blake... I thought you'd be better than this..."-

-"I've worked as a mercenary for years, yet, this is the first time it's personal. And I will never forgive those who have been evil to me for no reason..."- Blake said, clenching his fists tightly. The man sighed, and left, nowhere to be seen

Blake was asked by his friends, and told them the man left for personal reasons, and told them about the next battle

-"Will we going back there again?!"- Ayrton asked

-"This time, with reinforcements"-

-"Why don't you let the Royal Army handle this?"- Gustave asked

-"Because those damn beasts made it personal!!"- Blake shouted, and punched the table with anger

-"Whoah, I had never seen you THAT angry"- Ferdinand commented

-"That is because this is the first time someone tries to force me to be a slave"- Blake said, calming a bit, but it had been revealed already that he was repressing a lot of anger

-"Well... I guess we should train while we wait for Anthony"- Caesar said, and the rest of the group nodded.

-"We'll start tomorrow. For now, let's get a good sleep"- Blake said, and most of his friends went to their rooms, except Ferdinand, who was holding a cup of wine, and asked

-"Tell me something Blake, would you be this mad if Aranza's father suggested you marrying her? I know you're mad at the giants because of that"-

Blake moved very quickly, grabbing Ferdinand's neck, and squeezed it a bit, starting to strangle him -"Don't EVER DARE to compare Aranza to such animals!!"- Blake released his grip on Ferdinand, who said

-"Okay... that answers my question..."- He left, and Blake went to a tree to sleep, and was followed soon by Tabitha, who again put herself as a pillow for Blake (she does that always). Blake stared at the stars in the sky until he fell asleep...
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Bloodthirsty Blake?

1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Blake opened his eyes, and found himself in a seemingly endless grassy plain, the sky was dark blue, and there was a silver full moon in the sky -"Huh? I was sleeping on a tree..."-

-"Blake... Haven't you realized yet?"- A mysterious man, completely covered in a dark hooded cloak spoke

-"Realized what?"- He said, turning to face this unknown person

-"The hate you feel now... it's the same hate that brought an end to the Dark Magicians... the king hated them deeply and wished to slay every single of them, just like now you want to do to the giants..."- The mysterious man said, and from hearing him, Blake concluded it was most likely an old man, but still had no idea who.

-"The Dark Magicians weren't offering the King to be a monster's toy..."- Blake replied, and the old man smiled

-"But who's the real monster?"- The old man said and Blake heard thunder, he saw imaged of the giantess village burning, dead bodies, both from giants and humans laying on the floor, in puddles of their own blood, while further away, some humans and some giantesses were still fighting violently...

-"What they did may not be completely justifiable, but still, it was a species' desperate attempt to avoid extinction... and YOU brought this upon them for it..."- The old man said in a more echoing voice, and Blake saw Joana and her servants not even trying to fight back, instead they were trying to escape. Karina and Taylor were just trying their best to protect Joana while Royal Elites started to swarm around them. They were stomping and just killing as many soldiers as possible, but every time they got even more wounds and eventually both were on the ground. clinging hard onto life, leaving Joana alone. Blake could see more soldiers go at her, and he couldn't help but look away...The vision stopped

-"Why did you look away?"-

-"Because I didn't want to see her get killed..."-

-"Why?"-

Blake sighed in annoyance, seeing where this was going -"Because she's innocent..."-

-"I thought you said giants were monsters"-

-"Not all of them... in the true monsters sense... but physically, she's just as much as any other giant..."- Blake replied trying to not let the man be entirely right, he laughed

-"You still care about her..."-

-"Just because she's innocent so far..."-

-"I see..."-

-"Well, now what?"- Blake asked raising an eyebrow

-"I have already confronted you with what you're intending to do, you still have a choice, there's still time. The rest is up to you..."- The old man vanished just as mysteriously as he had appeared, and his whole world started fading away...

Blake woke up, he was sleeping on Tabitha on the tree's branch "Damnit, that was some dream..." Blake mumbled annoyed, and he jumped off to the ground to get some water to drink. After he quenched his thirst, he headed back outside and saw Anthony and a considerable number of Royal Elites who had just arrived, most on horse, and a few on giant cats like Tabitha. Blake looked around and roughly counted less than 100 men

-"Is this all you got?"- Blake asked

-"Well, I found that if we were to go to war against giants, it would be actually somewhat of a big deal with the King and it would take long for us to get even an approval, so, I discussed it with my men and we agreed to pull this off on our own! All the more fame to all of us for slaying the monsters ourselves"- Anthony said with a boastful laugh.

-"I should remind you they are like freaking over 100 feet tall and know magic... I think we'd get slaughtered if we even try to attempt this as we are..."- Blake said, sincerely trying to dissuade them from attacking

-"Blake, we are royal elites. We kill giant beasts and fight armies for a living"- Anthony said in a reassuring tone -"We should be able to put these giants back to their graves, where they belong..."- Anthony offered his hand and Blake shook it, however he added

-"I will lead you there as promised, but, I reconsidered about having my squad participate in this battle... You're on your own Anthony"-

-"It's no problem"-

Blake then snapped his fingers and Tabitha jumped off the tree, he rode on her and then they started advancing toward what Blake called the forest of the giant trees. He left his friends sleeping at the hotel because he didn't intend to go fight anymore, however, he still felt like he might be still unleashing the massacre he saw in his dream. When they had just got to the entrance of the forest, Blake's friends had caught up to them.

-"Why did you not tell us?"- Ferdinand asked annoyed

-"Because I decided we're not participating in this battle. I'm just leading them to the village and the rest is up to them"-

Blake's friends were a bit relieved to see their leader regained his calmer behavior and gave him thumbs up, however they decided to accompany him. Blake broke several branches and Gustave lit them so everyone had a torch except Blake, who used a golden light orb himself and they walked into the forest, there was a minor shaking and everyone stopped.

-"Are there giant beasts in the forest?"- Anthony asked, looking around and illuminating with his torch

-"I don't know, didn't run into any when I was here myself"- Blake replied, but he felt the shaking growing stronger 'I don't like it though, it gives me a bad feeling...' Suddenly, they noticed giant shadows move between the trees, and before they knew they were surrounded by Lith, Karina, Claire, Taylor, and a few guards

-"Holy hell!"- Anthony exclaimed

-"How the...?!"- Blake's eyes opened wide, and Karina smiled

-"Going through the forest with those torches is quite a manner of giving away your position..."-

-"How come...?"- Ayrton thought out loud but Karina interrupted him

-"We have far greater night vision than you..."-

-"Damnit..."- Ferdinand mumbled

-"EVERYBODY RUN NOW!"- Blake used his golden orb to flash a blinding light for a few seconds, which everyone used to start running away, however, only Blake's friends made it out of the forest, Karina had anticipated herself to this and closed her eyes, preventing her getting blinded, and she used a massive light rope spell to tie up Anthony and his forces. Blake himself was also unable to escape because despite getting blinded, Claire managed to catch him in her hand.

She recovered her sight rather quickly and smiled, Blake gulped, and Karina walked closer to them, a small firefly made entirely of golden light flew from Blake's shoulder and it vanished -"A tracking spell, of course..."- Blake facepalmed himself hard for failing to notice he had been marked with such a thing

-"Trying to get us slain by the Royal Army is a bit harsh, isn't it?!"- She asked barely suppressing her anger

-"I was angry, I admit to being wrong, but you provoked me with this 'bought slave' nonsense!"- Blake said, somehow managing to both sound humble yet defiant

-"I would kill you right here and now if you weren't so valuable"- Karina replied tightening her grip on Blake, despite this, he didn't show any sings of bein in pain, and then he suddenly smiled, and Karina noticed this, she felt the pain of getting wounded with sharp weapons in several parts of her back and legs, and let go of Blake by reflex, he landed safely while Anthony and his soldiers started attacking the giantesses.

-"Simple girls with basic spell usage think they can take on Royal Elites just because you're oversized? Hmph..."- Anthony said and taunted Karina, who even stopped paying attention to Blake and tried to stomp on Anthony instead, he laughed as he kept dodging every stomp and mocked her each time. Meanwhile, the other soldiers were attacking Taylor, Claire and the guards, and while some did manage to wound them, many soldiers got smacked against trees or the ground.

Outside the forest...

Blake's friends heard and saw that explosions started, and the ground was shaking violently -"So, the fight already started..."- Ayrton said -"Yeah, and we ran away like rats!"- Ferdinand said, clenching his fists in anger -"I doubt we stand a chance against them with such a small force"- Caesar said, trying to help -"Screw it, Blake is there, and I'm not letting them take him prisoner again or kill him! I'll go... Whether you want to follow or leave is up to each of yo... only come if you're not afraid"- Ferdinand said and rode on Tabitha, who seemed to agree to this whole situation and headed back inside the forest.

-"That was intense for sure..."- Gustave commented, scratching the back of his head

-"Blake is the last light magician, Ferdinand the last dark one... And they've gone on adventures together since before even forming this mercenary squad, I think they understand each other pretty well, both are sort of outcasts that aren't even supposed to exist by the King's law, and they have stuck together since they were kids... Even I, who has been with them for less time, feel like I can't just ditch Blake..."- Ayrton said -"I'm going too"- Caesar and Gustave just nodded to each other and followed as well...
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Uh... Continue?

1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The Royal Elites kept fighting the giantesses using both elemental magic, which varied for everyone, and sword fighting as well as acrobatic skills, this particular terrain surrounded by giant trees favored them in fighting the giantesses, they might have not as many chances to strike back in an open field. However, despite their young age, Karina, Taylor and the guards were actually trained soldiers as well, although they weren't used to fighting enemies much smaller than themselves. Despite their best efforts, however, most of the men were defeated, with only Anthony and a few others still standing after about 15 minutes.

Anthony jumped and bounced off one of the trees and seemingly had Karina in a perfect angle to slice her neck from behind, but a few meters before reaching her, Blake appeared before him and blocked his sword with his own, and Karina turned around and looked in confusion.

-"What do you think you are doing?!"- Anthony asked furiously

-"Saving your freaking life"- Blake whispered, and they landed on the ground, but still, their blades locked against each other -"Don't move your head, but try to look from the upper corners of your eyes... if you got JUST any closer, that black haired giantess was ready to blow you up..."- Anthony glanced, and indeed, Taylor was charging a golden energy ball, ready to fire at any moment, but lowered her hand when she observed the scene.

-"I also saved your men from getting finished off"- Blake showed him a pile with the unconscious men, they let go of the blade lock and Anthony sighed in annoyance -"You're still stubborn about sacrificing a few lives to achieve something greater... that's the sole thing keeping you from being an exceptional leader, Blake, if you just put that aside, you could be one of those generals that make history..."-

-"Who's to say what lives are to be thrown as sacrifice? Would you agree if one of those lives was your own? If there is a God, maybe he could tell because he created us and stuff, but otherwise, deeming other lives anything less than equal in value to your own is foolish and is what separates us humans from animals and monsters..."-

Karina was amazed at the speech, but she frowned shortly afterwards to try to hide it. They were all interrupted as Blake's friends arrived to the scene and started attacking the giantesses, while Ferdinand pulled both Blake and Anthony further away from Karina -"Are you two stupid or what?"-

The three of them stopped in their tracks as Taylor jumped and landed before them, shaking the ground violently upon landing, and held a web made of light which held the defeated soldiers. Blake gasped and turned around, noticing that all his friends except Ferdinand were pinned down by Claire and the guards, using either their hands or feet. -"ONE wrong move, and all these guys die, Blake..."-

-"You witch!"- Ferdinand said angrily and grabbed his scythe, but Blake stopped his arm, and denied with his head, Taylor smiled -"I'll tell you what... give yourself up, and all these soldiers will be set free and spared... Or, try to fight your way out, and we all just step on them..."- Ferdinand growled and tried to grab his scythe again but Blake's grip on his arm grew tighter -"ARE YOU SERIOUS?!"- He shouted angrily

-"OUR FRIENDS WOULD DIE TOO YOU IDIOT!"- Blake said, and Ferdinand turned to see the other guys were indeed pinned under giantesses' feet or hands. Blake sighed in annoyance and stuck his sword in the ground. -"Let them go"- He said with a firm tone. Taylor nodded and Lith came to her side, she cast a small golden orb that knocked Anthony out, and he was added to the pile of unconscious soldiers, then, they started chanting a spell in a language Blake didn't know. A golden heptagram appeared in all of the soldiers' foreheads, including Anthony, and it vanished just as quickly.

-"What was that?"-

-"An ancient spell that erases the victim's memories, we erased only this day's. We can't have the Royal Elites know about us and leaving just free..."- Taylor said and she along Lith started doing hand signs for a different spell -"And this is a teleporting spell, we'll send them back to the last place they slept at"- The soldiers glowed with a blinding flash and once it disappeared, they were gone. Blake noticed his friends were still pinned, and Ferdinand was still next to him

-"What about my friends?"-

-"I'm sorry, I said we'd set the SOLDIERS free... you and your band of misfits aren't true soldiers, right?"- Taylor said with a smile, and while Ferdinand was suppressing his anger by this point, he noticed Blake was tempted to grab his sword but still was making an effort not to. -"You will still be married to the Princess, and I'll see what we can do with the others... I read in some old book that many years ago some giants ate humans, maybe we can have a nice dinner after this battle"- She added, and Claire looked at them, winking and licking her lips. Taylor walked towards Ferdinand and Blake and bound them with a golden ring of light each, and picked Blake up -"In fact, scratch the part about marrying the Princess, what's to stop me from eating you right now?"-

She expected to see him cower in fear, but instead, Blake smiled -"Go ahead"- Everyone gasped, even Taylor herself, but then Joana walked out from between some trees -"What do you think you're doing?"- She said to Taylor, and she noticed the anger in her voice -"I... uh... I wasn't serious..."- Taylor frowned -"I was trying to make this insolent bastard feel fear for once in his life!"-

-"Keep trying, whale, oh wait, you're even bigger than that"- Blake said and laughed a bit, Taylor's grip tightened on him as she growled

-"Blake, you too stop. I'm not going to let you die nor get yourself killed"-

Blake's friends were amazed to see a giantess talk like that to Blake. However he just laughed -"I don't think ms. elephant lady here agrees"- Taylor tightened her grip even more, but Joana slapped her across the face and took Blake in her own hand. Ferdinand was amazed by this enough hat he voluntarily put his scythe down. Joana crouched and gently placed Blake on the ground near Ferdinand.

-"I order you to let them go, and let's stop this madness"- She said with a firm tone none of the giantesses had ever heard her with in her life until now, the guards let Caesar, Gustave and Ayrton free, and they ran towards Blake and Ferdinand. However, Taylor and Karina denied with their heads -"I'm sorry Joana, but I don't think we can let them go, specially the hybrid, he was way too expensive and we most likely won't find another one"-

-"Hybrid?"- All of Blake's friends said in confusion, and they took a few seconds to realize they might be referring to Blake, he looked down and sighed

-"Yes... Apparently, I am the son of a man and one of those things..."- He said the last part in an angrier tone than the rest. They all took a step back in fear out of instinct, but Ferdinand spoke

-"So that's why you kept on wearing heavy equipment..."-

-"It would have been way too obvious if I hadn't hidden my real strength all these years..."-

-"But still... damn... the son of a giantess... hey, wait! how come you look like a normal human?"- Gustave said scratching his head

-"I can answer that"- Lith said, taking a few steps forward -"The offspring of a human and a giantess varies depending on gender... Females are born giant, and develop just like any of us, no real noticeable differences from pure giantess save a bit of a greater variety of skin and hair colors*. However, males are different... they are born the size of a human, and they remain that way their whole life as far as we know. They have much greater physical strength, speed, senses and magic power than a regular human. Because they could have been a threat to the throne, the King ordered their destruction years ago... and the only one who was left was my son..."-

Blake's friends opened their eyes wide at the giantess' last words and their jaws dropped, then they looked at Blake, he nodded shamefully -"I guess this is *ahem* uncomfortable..."- Ferdinand said, but Lith smiled -"I see that Blake managed to find good friends who were willing to risk their own lives to come save him"- They all, even Ferdinand blushed a bit -"We're a mercenary squad that is also made of friends, I guess we're like brothers..."- Ayrton said

-"Why do you want Blake though?"- Gustave asked, and Joana blushed, Lith laughed and she replied

-"He was bought to marry the princess... with the intention of having babies so we can start repopulating before we go extinct"-

-"...my god..."- Ferdinand muttered -"Now I see why Blake had been so desperate to escape..."- Joana blushed even more while Lith laughed even more

-"It takes strong humans to be able to do this... and a hybrid is just about the best possible candidate... none lived long enough for us to see what kind of offspring they'd have either"-

-"TOO...MUCH...INFORMATION..."- Gustave said and promptly fainted, Caesar and Ayrton fell dismayed as well...

*Giants in this story prior to getting hybridized with humans were fair skinned with either blonde, light brown or red hair. Think of norse people.
