Ferdinand sighed -"So...?"-

-"The hybrid is too valuable to let go..."- Karina answered

-"And you all might just help us a bit more"- Claire said cheerfully, while also trying to give them a seductive look

-"Whatever happens, don't be left alone with her"- Blake whispered to Ferdinand, but she stomped on the ground angrily

-"I heard that!"-

-"I did not ask you, Karina. It's an order. LET THEM GO!"- Joana said

-"I'm sorry, your majesty, but your orders can't go against your parents' last will and order, which is to find you a suitable husband by the time you turned 18 and start with the repopulating attempts"-

-"Are you aware that he will not even do it EVEN if you manage to marry us?"- Joana said annoyed

-"Well, in that case, I guess we can have him be 'educated' about it..."-

-"In any case, the other guys will be healed and will remain in custody at the castle until you decide what to do with them, as long as it does not violate your parents' last will"-

Ferdinand finally fainted and Blake remained alone, bound, and defeated, he sighed in annoyance as well, and Karina picked him up -"It seems you never even got to have any sort of experience with a woman from your species, right?"- Blake just gave her an angry glare, and she laughed a bit -"I guess that answers my question... so, I will have you be 'educated' by Claire..."- Said giantess just smiled and her eyes seemed to have gained a little spark to them

-"What what?! Are you crazy?"-

-"She knows what she can and what she cannot do... I'll leave you to be taught by her about certain things you need to know to get used to your new life"-

-"My god..."- Blake shuddered. and Karina handed him to Claire

-"I'll be trusting your judgement, lady. But if you go beyond the limits you will also be punished"- Karina said

-"Oh, don't worry, there's no need for that..."- She winked at Blake, while Joana herself was baffled at the fact her orders were invalid and that they're going to do who knows what with Blake and his friends.

-"It'll be only for a full day if you behave properly after... but if you don't, Claire will need more time to teach you..."- Karina added, and Blake gulped in fear

They were taken to the castle, and Claire took Blake to her room. Even though she was a servant her room seemed fairly large in proportion, and it looked decent to live in. Karina had changed the spell that bound Blake to wrist and ankle cuffs made of light. She put him on her bed and started taking off her clothes, Blake just turned around and sat on the bed, not really wanting to know what she was up to. However Claire giggled and turned him around with her fingers so he looked at her, who was already in just her underwear, a rather simple black bra and panties.

-"Please put some clothes on"- Blake said closing his eyes and taking a deep breath

-"Have you forgotten why Karina left you at my care? I'm supposed to help you on being around a giantess"- Claire said with a giggle -"You have to learn these things so you can be a good husband for the Princess. She's fairly shy and she won't make any advances if you just don't cooperate... also, like I said, you're supposed to look"-

-"I don't think looking at a woman dressed inappropriately is within my list of things I do"-

Claire laughed and decided to take advantage of Blake having his eyes closed, she leaned forward and licked him

-"The hell?"- Blake opened his eyes just from sheer surprise, and immediately started wiping his face off as best as he could

-"Had to start somewhere. Get used to it. The Princess looks like she'd be an affectionate wife and she might do this often to you..."- Claire said and licked him again, this time more slowly, then she grabbed him with one hand and started licking him over and over. Blake tried to struggle but being handcuffed and gripped by Claire's hand, there wasn't much he could do other than take it. After a few minutes, she stopped and without warning, she wiped him dry on one of her breasts. She was giggling while Blake had an angry and annoyed face.

-"Aww, come on, don't tell me you aren't having a little fun?"-

-"I'm not..."- He answered closing his eyes in anger

-"Well, how about this?"- Claire sat on the bed and put Blake on one of her thighs -"The Princess might also have you like this fairly often"- She moved her leg slightly, making Blake fall face first on her thigh, she laughed a bit and added "Her thighs are also bigger and most likely softer than mine, but this should give you an idea"-

Blake just struggled to stand up and just crossed his arms, hoping that this day would be over as soon as possible and just lie when Karina asked whatever she wanted to hear. By this point he almost preferred being with Joana, at least she wouldn't be putting him through this stuff herself. The 'ground' shook more as Claire laid on the bed and grabbed Blake, placing him on her stomach, and as she had a bit of a tummy, he sank into it while Claire giggled

-"Oh, that actually tickles!"-

-"Give me a break!"- Blake replied to no one in particular as he struggled to 'swim' in Claire's soft flesh with his wrists and ankles cuffed -"This doesn't even make sense"-

-"Umm... yeah, partially"- Claire said with a thoughtful look -"The Princess has a flatter stomach, but it's likely that when you're both sleeping or taking a nap, this is one of the two places she might put you in"- She giggled more, which made a small earthquake for Blake and he sank even more into her tummy -"She would get a bigger tummy if you get her pregnant though"-

-"Like that is going to happen..."- Blake said while shuddering

-"It will. Or I'll have to teach you in every detail..."- She gave Blake a look that seemed more predatory than seductive, and he stopped in genuine fear -"I'm not going to do that this time, so, you better try to get used to your future wife and give her babies!"-

'I seriously wonder what's even the limit Karina drew to Claire's behavior...' Blake thought while he didn't even notice he fell into Claire's navel, even she gasped. He heard her stomach gurgling a bit 'I really hope that doesn't mean she's hungry...' -"Whoah, that's a new one"- Claire sat up, surrounding Blake completely with her tummy once again -"Carrying your husband in your navel... sounds fun, I must totally tell this to the Princess"- Then she noticed Blake seemed to be tickling it and wondered what he could possibly mean, until she felt a stronger punch and yelped, she fished him out of there with 2 fingers and had a slightly angry look

-"What do you think you're doing?"-

-"You *gasp* were *gasp* FREAKING SMOTHERING ME!"-

-"Huh..."- Claire then realized he was inside her belly button while she had sat up, and given she had a tummy, Blake was completely surrounded by her and had little to no air -"Alright, sorry about that one, my bad..."- Blake was completely baffled by hearing Claire say 'sorry' and added -"Believe me or not, I'm not trying to hurt you"-

-"By this point I wish you were trying that instead of what you're doing"-

-"How did you even do with human women?"- Claire asked this time, herself now being the baffled one

-"THAT'S THE POINT! I DIDN'T!"-

-"Oh... so... you're really a virgin..."-

Blake facepalmed himself hard enough that Claire heard, but she just laughed more

-"We all are, but at least our moms taught us stuff... so... you really have no idea..."-

-"That's the point, we get it..."-

-"That's just perfect for the Princess. But you need to cooperate!"-

-"All of this stuff is scary enough as it is, and you have no idea how much worse it is when beings big enough to swallow you whole are the ones doing it..."-

-"And that's the point of this... you have to stop fearing our bodies just because of our size, you're a hybrid, you can take it... at least your friends can be genuinely afraid because they're ordinary..."- Claire said and held him close to her chest to drive her point, and she mumbled -"Although then again, the Princess is a bit heavy..."-

-"And you still expect me to go along with this?"-

-"You're the best possible candidate for that, as a hybrid, I doubt even her weight would harm you, which reminds me..."- Claire put Blake next to her hips and then raised them above him

-"HOLY..."- Blake shouted but didn't get to finish the phrase as Claire's large butt descended on him, he started trying to break free, which only tickled her

-"Maybe the Princess will ask you on occasion to sit on your lap, and you must absolutely say yes and behave... unlike you're doing right now"- She heard very muffled screams but she kept on sitting -"She's shy and sensitive, if you do this to her you'll make her cry and she will probably stop eating for a long while..."- Claire wiggled her hips on the bed as an attempt to force him to be quiet, but he kept struggling, and Claire gasped when she noticed he was lifting her.

-"I seriously doubt Joana would do this"- Blake said, while still lifting Claire at a bit less than half his arms' length above him, because over half his arms' length was sunk into Claire's literally gigantic butt.

-"And you were saying you couldn't handle this"- Claire said a bit satisfied
1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Prisoners again...

1521111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
-"Get...OFF!"- Blake shouted, still holding Claire above him, but she giggled

-"You know, this is not a bad exercise, you may need it... like with everything else, the Princess is kinda bigger than me..."- Claire said and leaned on her left hip, increasing the pressure on Blake -"The strength of a hybrid is sure something you don't get to see everyday"- Claire kept sitting on Blake for about 10 more minutes, while she bounced a bit on him from time to time, but he kept holding her up, then she suddenly sat up, but when she turned to face Blake, she didn't find him on the bed anymore, she glanced at a full body mirror behind her and laughed when she saw the tiny warrior almost buried in her soft butt cheek, and she wiggled it just to tease him more.

-"I thought you wanted me to get off you..."- She taunted, and received a muffled answer she couldn't quite make out, but she had a good guess on what he was probably saying -"Anyway, I have a deal you'll be interested in"- She grabbed him and brought him to her eye level -"It's very likely that your friends will also be married to giantesses here... and even more likely they're going to give them to me for about the same lessons I'm giving you right now"- Blake's eyes opened wide

-"They're not hybrids... If you sit on them you'll kill them!"- Blake said and Claire smiled

-"Can you pay the price?"-

-"What is it?"-

-"Full obedience from now on, for the rest of our day together..."- Claire said adding a more sensual tone to her voice, Blake wasn't liking where this was going and hesitated -"I will allow you to ask questions, hopefully I can explain stuff to you, but you better do everything right when you're left alone with the Princess..."-

-"What guarantees you'll go through with your part of this deal?"-

-"My honor as a royal servant"- Claire said offering him her other hand's pinky to shake as if it were a hand, Blake took a deep breath, thought about it for a few seconds and shook it -"I assume you will put your honor as a warrior on the line"- Blake nodded, although silently, as he was starting to make an effort to endure whatever Claire had in store for him, she placed him on the bed and turned around -"Deal. Your friends won't be squashed under my butt... as long as they behave..."- She looked down from her shoulder -"Even if it's not really that big"-

-"If you sat down in a human village you would leave at least 2 families homeless..."- Blake said with a half smile hidden by his hood's shadow

-"Hey!"- Claire tried to sound mad but couldn't help but laugh -"Even if it poked a bit of fun at me, I like your sense of humor"- Claire said and sat down next to Blake, this time he jumped before she sat to avoid bouncing out of the bed, she gave him a sweeter look -"So you're not entirely bitter"-

-"That depends on your interpretation..."- Blake said, looking down in a more serious attitude -"Wait a minute!"- He said after a moment of thoughtfulness -"What's with that 'as long as they behave' part?"- Claire smiled again

-"The deal you just made guarantees that I will not sit on your friends, as long as they don't do anything to provoke my anger and thus, a punishment"-

-"I should have known there was a catch"-

-"There's something more you can do for them though"-

-"What is it?"- Blake asked annoyed, and even if she had already gotten around with wording, he still hoped to trust on her promise and was willing to make another deal

-"You can take your friends' punishment in advance..."-

About 10 days earlier, outside Kildevar...

A mysterious man, covered by a black hooded cloak wandered around the forest, he walked to where the battle between the Sand Bandits and Blake's mercenary squad took place. He observed the two dead Bandits, and also noticed the damage in the terrain

-"Pretty intense conflict... to think there's anyone who can put up this kind of fight to trained professional assassins..."- He muttered as he crouched, he recognized the marks of lightning attacks, as well as the faint lines from what was most likely air magic, and he also noticed some parts of the ground were scorched

-"Lightning, Air, Fire... interesting..."- He mumbled, and stood up, then he observed a bunch of really large craters, and in one of them, rests of quartz chains and a rock coffin -"This looks like someone broke through this thing..."- He looked around at the crater -"I don't think the Bandits did these..."- He then observed marks in the ground -"This looks like the marks from shockwaves from someone with exceptional strength... or a highly skilled self enhancing magician..."-

The man then closed his eyes, and observed the same landscape as if they were open, but in black and white for the most part, and he could see the lingering aura of the different types of elemental magic used, a shining blue for lighting, fiery red for fire, brown in varying tones for Earth, and a faint sky blue for air, he observed remains of bluish dark magic, and reddish one near the craters and the shockwaves -"Dark magic, at least two users..."- He muttered, but then he gasped when he also noticed traces of golden aura -"Light magic?"- It lingered in the same places as the reddish dark magic aura -"Since there are no traces of giants in here... I might have a good guess at this..."- The man then opened his eyes and decided to head into the town...

Despite being covered by a cloak, he didn't seem to stand out, and he walked quietly to the local tavern, assuming it'd be a gathering place for various kinds of people, and hopefully someone could give him any leads. He pushed his hood back as he entered the bar and politely greeted the barkeeper. He asked for one glass of beer and got quickly served, he drank slowly, he observed the barkeeper attend other people, and when he was done, he spoke

-"Excuse me, barkeeper. I'm not from this town, but I happened to walk by the forest outside the town as I came, and I couldn't help but notice what looked like a battle zone, looked pretty intense, do you have any idea what happened?"- Despite his polite tone and that he tried to sound discrete, the chatter going around suddenly stopped, and there was a complete silence for a few seconds.

-"Don't worry... I'm just a vagabond writer, looking to collect stories for my book"- He said, laughing a bit in a casual manner

-"Listen... you may not believe it, but that was a battle between the infamous Sand Bandits and our local mercenary squad..."- The barkeeper said after looking around, making sure there were no Elites around -"This town is currently under vigilance by the Royal Elites, and I don't think they'd take it too well to someone asking questions..."-

-"I think it's alright, Thomas"- An older man said from the other side of the bar -"Elites aren't allowed to come to somewhere like this during work hours..."-

-"As I told you, I'm a harmless old man who just wanders around anyway, looking for stuff to write, I couldn't be any more dangerous than one of such guys..."-

The barkeeper laughed heartily -"Old man? You look no older than 20..."-

-"Let's just say I'm a bit older than that, but that's besides the point..."- The man continued to drink his beer -"...So, how come this town had mercenaries capable of fighting off the Bandits?"-

-"We don't really know where they came from... a bunch of kids, hey, how long ago was that, Albert?"- The barkeeper said

-"I think it was 2 years ago, could be 3..."- The older man that had spoken before replied

-"Well, yeah, they came 2 or 3 years ago offering their services as a mercenary squad, I admit, it was a bit weird to see those 13 or 14 years old taking on dangerous criminals and hunting beasts, but they proved to be really strong, and our duke hired them, not just for sporadic jobs, but to stay and serve as a protective force..."- The barkeeper then leaned to whisper -"To be honest, they were far more reliable than the Royal Army"-

-"They also were much less greedy"- Another man said, this one was corpulent, and had strong arms, as well as short black hair and a thick yet trimmed mustache, he lifted his shirt a bit to reveal a faint stab wound's mark -"I was robbed by some bastard with a knife yesterday..."- He said, letting his shirt fall back into place

-"That wound looks like it healed long ago"- The man said, and sipped his beer

-"The leader of the mercenaries was walking around the house roofs and saw it happen, he rushed after him and used magic ropes made of golden light, and he came right back at me, he chanted something and healed the wound in a few seconds, he also brought me more money than the thief had taken from me, and when I told him to keep it as a reward, he said I needed it more because I work hard and have a family, and he left..."- The man laughed -"It's strangely moving in its own way that a youngster could think like that. That guy had to be 15 or 16 at most..."-

-"I think I heard him once say he was 17"- The barkeeper added -"Yeah, he's saved people here and there, and he can heal wounds with warm magic, but can also fight with golden beams, he said he was a Light magician, but, I don't remember ever hearing of one such before"-

-"He also has this shiny black sword that doesn't ever dull, and has sometimes even cut through stone. I don't know what smith gave him that sword, but it must be pretty amazing. I once had a look at it, as I'm a smith myself, but I had never seen such a skillfully made weapon. Maybe it was made with that thunderbolt iron some people talk about"-

-"So, the mercenary leader is a powerful light magician as well as a skilled swordsman? Sounds good. And I take it that he and his squad were sent to fight the Bandits?"- The man said, writing some notes in a small notebook

-"Actually, they were hanging out at the forest, the duke gave them a day off, and i's more like they intercepted them, because maybe those bastards were heading for our town. I don't know the details, but the ground shook several times and quite violently, it must have been an incredible fight to see"- The barkeeper said -"However, it seems those bandits were worse than we expected..."-

-"How so?"-

-"We all saw an immense pillar of dark energy that rose from the ground, it even blocked the sun for a short while... That's why the duke had to call in the Royal Elites, if there's a dark magician alive and wants trouble, they have to hunt him down for good..."- The barkeeper added

-"Yeah, I too heard bad stuff about dark magicians. Something about being people corrupted by an immense power, once threatened the kingdom but were defeated and supposedly destroyed by the King and his army"- The smith said

-"And where are the local heroes today? An interview would be nice, to get some more from a first hand perspective"-

-"They went missing... nobody knows what happened, and in fact we were all discussing it yesterday... but the most consistent theory so far is that the Bandits had reinforcements and just overwhelmed them when they were exhausted, and afterwards, nobody can know... the fate of those captured by the bandits is maybe worse than death..."- The barkeeper said

-"There are only 2 corpses belonging to Bandits, but no rests were left of the mercenaries, so, it really looks more like they got captured rather than killed..."- The smith sighed sadly -"I hate it when bad things happen to good people, those kids were good at heart! They were hard working and were making a living by keeping everyone else safe!"- He slammed his fists on the bar, shaking it a little -"And here we are, all adult, fully grown men, going about with our lives as if nothing happened!"-

-"You know very well we can't come even close to fight the Bandits"- The barkeeper said, putting a hand on the smith's shoulder

-"We should tell the Royal Army to give chase to those bastards, and hopefully rescue the youngsters, those stuck up good for nothing highly paid excuse of soldiers should do their goddamn work for once!"- The smith added, still angry but calming down a little

-"It's up to the duke to handle the current situation, he asked us to be discrete about it..."- The barkeeper said

-"Alright... so, these mercenary young were captured by the Bandits after putting up an incredible fight... Not quite what I expected but better than nothing..."- The man said, finishing to write and putting the notebook and pencil in one of his pants' pockets

-"You're a writer, right? Please, let people of other places know about this, maybe with more popular support we can have those Bandits hunted down for good!"- The smith said, and the man put his hood back on, and smiled

-"I'll see what I can do..."- He finished his beer and walked out of the bar...
